story:
THIS NOVEL IS IMPORTANT...

...because it focuses on those people the mental health care system can't cram into some neurotic, phobic, psychotic, or PTSD pigeonhole; the ones brushed off as just being woefully screwed up. They become the socially disorientated, stigmatized loose ends among us. Loose ends tend to preoccupy themselves by tripping, stumbling, and, on occasion, gliding gracefully over the dance floor to velveteen strains of "The Straitjacket Waltz". The more you know about the waltz, the better you feel about loose ends.
This is a powerful story well worth supporting.

                                                            WHO AM I?
I'm Glynn Thompson. I've been working on THE STRAITJACKET WALTZ: Loose Ends and PTSD for sixteen years.
 It's finally completed.
I'm a very private person. I'm married with three children and three grandchildren. I earned a BA in History from Texas Tech University, minoring in English. I served two separate hitches in the Navy. I went to Vietnam during the first stint. I qualified to drive a destroyer during the second. I've fought wildland fires throughout the western United States, dealt with hermit gold miners in northern Nevada, busted sweatshops in Los Angeles, and spent five wildland fire seasons in remote, twelve feet by twelve feet lookout shacks. I'm not sure when I first started doing "The Straitjacket Waltz."

                                                          THE STORY

Gil McNeil is back from the precipice, stripped of every canon he'd ever adhered to. Very little is familiar to him. He feels out of synch. Initially it looks, smells, and feels like PTSD, but not exactly. He isn't exactly diagnosed with this other thing either. Or not exactly that thing. So, he is sent on his way. He didn't know it at the time, but, in the grand scheme of things, he had become a loose end. He attempts a genuinely enlightened path. A formula for happiness. A claim to authenticity. Instead, he becomes mired in contradiction and deceit. A myriad of distractions further complicate his endeavors. Through it all, Gil and his cohorts remain hell-bent on deciphering the great Mystery as they step to "The Straitjacket Waltz". Oddly enough, Gil's story, with all its dark humor, has almost a happy ending. Sometimes that's as good as it gets.

                                                        THE AUDIENCE
If you've made it to this section, then you're the audience. I hope you will want to make my project your project by contributing to the campaign. I can't make this a reality without you. If you can't contribute monetarily, then help spread the word. Be the one who introduces THE STRAITJACKET WALTZ: Loose Ends and PTSD to your circle of friends. They'll love you for it. Maybe.
Questions? Email me at gly63@hotmail.com.

                                                 PUBLISHING EXPENSES
I chose CreateSpace to publish my novel. They offered the widest range of personalized services including print on demand (POD) and direct shipping. Initially the book will be available only in paperback. Here's how your contribution will be spent:
CreatSpace copy editing, interior formatting, cover PDF, Library of Congress  Control Number (LCCN), ISBN, Kindle conversion, Kirkus review, and marketing copy essentials - $ 2,799 (245 pages; paperback).  
Additional campaign expenses (Perks and Indiegogo fees) - $2,000
Grand Total - $4,799
Should the target amount be exceeded I will be able to upgrade the CreateSpace publishing and marketing package. Should funding go through the roof I will use book sales and the additional funding to produce the movie. All contributors will be included in the credits. If the funding goal is not met, I will downgrade the CreateSpace publishing package or be forced to use a less comprehensive publishing site.

story:
The Book:

A comprehensive guide to Slasher Horror movies from over three years of research and writing on one of the more endearing genres in fright film history. Features reviews of hundreds of movies in the slasher genre with  hard to find and interesting facts, figures and connections for these films - as well as entertaining opinions on each one. Also included are brand new interviews with several of the stars and makers of some of the author's favorite slasher films - including: Adrienne King (Friday The 13th, Friday the 13th Pt. 2, Bully), Felissa Rose (Sleepaway Camp, Slaughter Party), Tom McLoughlin (Friday The 13th Part 6, Sometimes They Come Back), Jim Wynorski (Chopping Mall), Sean Whalen (People Under The Stairs, Hatchett 3), Thomas Drury (Don't Go In The Woods), Jon Fasano (Black Roses, Rock N' Roll Nightmare), Mark Metcalf (The Final Terror, Animal House), John Carl Buechler (Crawlspace, The Prey, Friday the 13th Part 7), Peter Giuliano (The Prowler) and more. It's a must for horror and slasher fans!



The Author:

Slashed Dreams comes to us from the mind of former professional wrestler and lifelong horror fanatic Ronnie Angel. Ronnie has been a fixture in the horror community for the past decade, known for various projects within the genre such as: his acclaimed reviews for the Best Horror Movies website (where he gained the nickname the "B Movie Expert"), articles for the website Watchplayread, appearances on the hit Youtube channel "The Horror Addicts" and several years spent as head announcer and expert panelist at the Seattle horror convention Crypticon. He is one of the foremost experts on slasher films in America and has spent the last three years working to compile what he believes could be the ultimate guide to slasher films.

 


The Publisher:

James R. Beach is the former publisher and Editor-in-Chief of the well-regarded horror magazine Dark Discoveries (publishing 20 issues from 2004 - 2012 before selling the magazine to a book publisher). He has also published anthologies and single author books under the DD imprint as well. He currently works for Dark Regions Press doing project development (including books with/for Clive Barker, Mick Garris, Richard Laymon, William F. Nolan, Joe R. Lansdale, Norman Partridge and others), sales & marketing and consulting work. He also works for Living Dead magazine doing sales, marketing and consulting and has launched a big Horror convention in Portland, Oregon with the owner of Living Dead (called the Living Dead Horror Convention of course). Slashed Dreams is a side publishing project that will debut at the first annual LD Con in November, 2015.



     

What We Are Offering:

 The  chance to pre-order this great book and get a discount on the price - as well the opportunity to get some great tie-in merchandise and/or the benefit of coming to a great new local horror event!


The Perks:

1. Signed glossy 5" x 8" Photos by Friday The 13th Final girl  Adrienne King! (1 of 5 assorted  photos signed by the actress with quotes from the F13 films she starred in). And you get print and ebook versions of Slashed Dreams along with it!



2. Tie-in classic slasher movie T-Shirts with images and themes from Friday the 13th (Camp Crystal Lake/Camp Counselor), Pieces and Graduation Day. (Shirts from Rotten Cotton). Classic movie poster designs as well as fun related shirts. High quality material and printing and licensed from the film creators as well. And you get print and ebook versions of Slashed Dreams along with it!



3. Weekend and VIP Passes to the first Annual Living Dead Horror Convention in Portland, Oregon! Come meet celebrities in person from Friday the 13th, Texas Chainsaw Massacre, Twin Peaks and more like: Adrienne King, Ari Lehman, Barbara Steele, Julie Adams, Teri McMinn, Edwin Neal, Sheryl Lee, Catherine Coulson, Lloyd Kaufman, Joe R. Lansdale, William F. Nolan, John Skipp, Butch Patrick, Lisa Marie Smith and others. Grab a VIP pass to the Friday the 13th party on Friday November 13th and hang out with our guests in a private, intimate setting at the popular Lovecraft Bar and get a swag bag with a convention T-Shirt, a Limited Edition (1 of only 100) Friday the 13th Art Print Poster, and more. Or just grab a weekend pass and come down and meet the celebs and get stuff signed and watch F13 with a special Q & A, and so on. And you get a copy of both the Trade Paperback and Ebook editions of Slashed Dreams. Grab yours at the con and get it signed by the author and an interviewee or two!



STRETCH GOAL #1:

If we make our first goal of $3000, then everybody who pledges gets their copy of the book signed by the author (and inscribed if desired). 


STRETCH GOAL #2:

If we make our second goal of $4000, then everybody who pledges gets a free 5" x 8" color print of the cover of Slashed Dreams signed by the author Ronnie Angel.


STRETCH GOAL #3:

If we make our third goal of $5000, then everybody who pledges gets free US shipping on anything ordered and half price shipping on Non-US orders. And all pledges will also get a special large 11" x 17" Living Dead Convention Guest Poster.


 


Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if your funds are low and you can't take advantage of pre-ordering the book and also getting some of these great offers, please consider spreading the word to your friends and people who might be interested via social media like Facebook, Twitter, etc.


(Additional Shirt Option images)

story:
About the Author

    Hi guys!  My name is David Álvarez and I'm a 28 years old artist from Costa Rica. I've worked as an animator for over 8 years on kids series like Artzooka, Elias Rescue Boat and Talking Tom. I 've always loved doing animation, but it took me years to figure out that what I really loved was the whole process of telling stories! So this one comes as my first self writen and illustrated children's book. And together we can make the production of this book a reality!


The Story

 "Mu, my Favourite Cow" tells the story of a little girl named Flurina and her favourite cow Mu.

All the cows on the farm make the best milk in the whole village, except for Mu, and is up to Flurina to figure out how to make that happen!

Her grandpa thinks Mu is lazy, but Flurina thinks there must be something more to it. In the end, she learns a valuable lesson about everyone responds in a positive way just by being understood.

The book shares the message of understanding how we are all motivated by different things, and how we can get the best out of someone by the simple act of understanding them.

 


 

 

 The Book

  • English or Spanish
  • 32 Pages
  • Softcover 
  • 17.5 x 22.5 cm
  • Full color
 

 

Why Indiegogo

 I've brought this project to Indiegogo in order to raise funds to print and distribute "Mu, my favourite Cow" to children around the globe. I've been working hard on this book for the past year, and it is now completely finished and ready to print. I'm using Indiegogo to be able to reach all the people who's been following the proccess of making this book since I first started.

 

 

How you can help!

You can pre-order the book with $25 or you can pitch in $5 to help us fund the production of the book. Also, you can always help by spreading the word on social media, by telling your friends, family, neighbors, educators, co-workers, librarians, and everyone about this book! 
I'm looking to raise $5,000 which is needed to print enough books so they can actually be affordable. The more I print, the cheaper the book :)

          

Risks and Challenges

 The first test print of the book was succesful! Everything looks good so now is just a matter of printing all the copys and ship them out to you. Delays may occur since after the shipping I'm no longer in control of the book, but I will be on top of everything to ensure you will get your book!
 
 

 

More about the Artist

 You can find me posting daily on Instagram at @dave.xp
 


 

Thanks a lot for the support,
and if you have any questions feel free to ask me anything!

story:
What is Kill Your Television?

Kill Your Television is a short film night screening the work of filmmakers based in North East London. Our mission is to create a community of filmmakers and other creatives around regular screening events. We show shorts of all genres by people of varying levels of experience.

Last year, we held nine events in total and showed 40 films by 33 different filmmakers. Our events have been as much about the screenings, as about giving filmmakers the space to present their ideas, talk about their experiences, and share learnings.

The publication!

We are currently working on a publication to celebrate the first year of Kill Your Television.

  • We want to catalogue the films, including extensive credits and information on where to see them online.
  • In a further attempt to create a platform for filmmakers to share their ideas and learnings, the publication will feature a selection of texts by some of the filmmakers whose films we screened in 2016. There will be case studies, pieces on how they approach production design or working under time constraint, and what they learned from making their first student film.
  • The design style will follow that of the posters.
  • We want to distribute the publication at a special launch event in the next two months, and then at future events and arts bookshops.

Aims & importance of your support

We hope this publication to be a valuable resource for the filmmaking community of North East London. We want to promote the amazing work that has been produced in our area and create a knowledge-and experience-sharing platform. Finally, this publication will constitute a tangible legacy of the events and conversations that took place in 2016.

What We Need & What You Get

Kill Your Television has been run entirely not-for-profit and we have donated our time and skills to make this project happen. Now we need your help!

  • We need your support to cover the printing costs. We hope the publication as an object to be a valuable artwork in itself.
  • The income from selling the publication will go back towards the project, so that we can run more events, print leaflets and posters, and create an even stronger resource for the filmmakers of the area.
  • Your contributions will be rewarded with excellent perks, including limited-edition gadgets and very special gifts courtesy of filmmakers from our community, set to develop your filmmaking skills...!

 

 

Risks & Challenges

As we are unable to pay ourselves or the filmmakers participating in this project, we are relying on enthusiasm and passion to carry us through. This can present difficulties meeting deadlines and receiving contributions from filmmakers. For this reason, we decided to run this crowdfunder at this, most final, stage, when most of the work has already been done: we've received all written contributions and are now editing and designing the publication.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Make noise about this campaign! Share, tweet, post, forward, ... 
  • Let us know if you would like to help us distribute the publication - in your bookshop, cinema or office?
  • Come to our events, submit your films, email us to say hi!

story: Alberto Ricasoli has completed the manuscript for his first graphic novel. Now, he needs your help in order to publish it and share his story with the world. As a new author, Alberto is self-publishing and needs help with the costs in order to hire an artist and then publish the book. The book is a supernatural story with a new, fresh take on vampires. Lucas is a self-proclaimed fan of the genre and felt that vampire fans didn't really have a good story to enjoy, so he set out to give them one. Please help him make this dream a reality!

story:
Hello everyone! Thank you for taking the time to look at The Love of a Bingle Lancer. This campaign is for the funding of the Softcover and Audiobook editions for The Love of a Bingle Lancer. We have many rewards though! Down below is all the information about The Love of a Bingle Lancer and how IndieGoGo works! 

If you would like to order a copy of the book here is how you do so:

1. Click a reward tier on the right side of the page.

2. IndieGoGo will prompt you to make an account.

3. Then you put in your information to purchase the book!

The Love of a Bingle Lancer is a Children's Poetry Book Written by Paul Gullen and Illustrated by Rachel Korsen. This beautiful poetic story has a timeless mix of poems blended together with painted illustrations that you'll never forget. This story will keep any reader captivated for hours on end as we visit the lands ruled by King Bandini and the far off kingdom of Fettuccine.

Love conquers all for Prince Bandini: many a King is good at sitting and forbidding, and many a Prince is good at prancing and romancing, but when it comes to Spanish Fancy Dancing, there's no one like Hoochie Coochie Smoocherini. This is a story that will touch hearts of dancers, lancers, and romancers. Pick your favorite reward tier and come to a far away land!

ALL Physical Perks come with a FREE Double Sided Bookmark with Tassel & the HC Book will have an Embossed/Debossed Cover & Foil Stamp, but there's still more...

Stretch Goals

  • If we reach $2,000 we will have the softcover come with a special surprise!
  • If we reach $2,500 we will have the Hardcover have an added Spot UV layer.
  • & If we reach $3,000 we will add a glossy dust jacket to protect Bingle's HC!

The Love of a Bingle Lancer is a story about Hoochie Coochie Smoocherini, a Spanish fancy dancer, and prince Babaloo Bandini, a prancing posing Bingle Lancer. He falls in love with Hoochie Coochie but his father, King Bandini wants him to marry a royal. The King banishes our Spanish fancy dancer to the land of Fettuccine.  

What was the inspiration for The Love of a Bingle Lancer? Watch this short clip from author Paul Gullen to learn about his inspiration!

The Love of a Bingle Lancer is going to be printed as a hardcover 8'' x 10'' book. This children's book is 32 pages and each page is illustrated with bright colors to portray Paul Gullen's poetic story. 

This hardcover case bound children's book will have a matte laminated cover. We chose the highest quality paper for the interior of the book so it would have a nice feel to the touch and portray the colors brilliantly.

Each page was illustrated with the intent of making the left and right pages of the book flow seamlessly together. Rachel Korsen drew the art to make it feel like you were looking at one large image connected across the pages. We know this story is a treat for children and adults with a wonderful rhyming tale and bright, colorful pictures.

Check out our many reward tiers and please don't hesitate to send us any questions about the different options!

Thank you so much for your support. You can also follow The Love of a Bingle Lancer on Facebook for additional updates and fun images.

https://www.facebook.com/BingleLancer/

Please share our campaign with your friends and family on social media to help spread the word of this wonderful children's book.

Risks and challenges

We've eliminated all risks from a production stand point. The book is written, the illustrations are complete, and the book is ready for print. Everything is ready with just a click of a button to send to the printer. Support from all of you is all we need at this point to push this project beyond its current limits. We know you're going to love the Bingle Lancer!

story:
UPDATE: All donations made in the last week of the campaign will be DOUBLED, up to $5,000!

These matching funds are a gift from YTM community member Carrie (Anderson) Parker -- youth 2000-01, counselor 2003-05 -- and her husband, Curtis. Make your donation today and watch it go twice as far.

A heartfelt THANK YOU to Carrie and Curtis for their generous gift!


What YTM is All About

For fifteen years, the Youth in Theology and Ministry program (YTM) at Saint John's School of Theology·Seminary has effectively developed young leaders for church and society. Rooted in the Gospel and guided by the principles of Catholic Social Teaching, we invite youth to commit their lives to the transformative mission of Jesus Christ in our world today.

YTM is an apprenticeship in Christian living. Our holistic, thirteen-month curriculum forms a beloved community where youth engage in college-level theology courses, service, justice, prayer, and vocational discernment—providing young people with the tools they need to live as disciples of Jesus.

Fifteen years of research reveal that twenty percent of youth who attend YTM study theology in college to prepare for leadership in the Church. If you are concerned about the next generation of Christian leaders, we invite you to invest in YTM's mission to transform the Church and the world.



Why We're Here on Indiegogo

A key element of the YTM experience is our engagement of young people in college-level theology courses, service sites, and afternoon/day trips in the local area to learn about Catholic Social Teaching and vocation. As you might expect, providing these experiences is no small task, logistically or financially.

This is where you come in!

We want to raise $5000 to cover the costs of transportation for all our Summer Institute experiences and textbooks for the youth theology classes. 


Transportation ($3500):
-   Summer I youth spend their afternoons at service sites in the
     local community--places like Casa Guadalupe, Boys and Girls Club, and
     Mercy Manor (assisted living facility)--every weekday of the Summer
     Institute.
-   Summer II youth take several afternoon trips throughout the Summer
     Institute, including to Catholic Charities in St. Cloud for a tour of their
     facility, the local grocery store to learn about food security and economic
     justice, and the State Capitol for a meeting with legislators to discuss the
     intersection between our faith and political engagement.
Theology textbooks ($1000):
-   Courses are taught by theologians--primarily professors from the College
     of Saint Benedict/Saint John's University.
-   Professors assign 1-2 books per course.
-   Courses are held for ten days (2 hours per weekday) during the Summer
     Institute.
-   All youth receive a Catholic Youth Bible at the beginning of their Summer I
     YTM experience.

Fundraising costs ($500):
-   Indiegogo and FirstGiving charge fees for hosting the campaign and 
     disbursing funds. The fee is higher if we do not reach our goal.
-   We need to send out perks! There are costs associated with perk production 
     and postage.

Additional money raised (beyond our $5000 goal) will go toward a scholarship fund:
-   Thanks to the generosity of our Vocation Partners and grant funding from
     the Lilly Endowment, every single youth attending YTM already receives
     a $1200 scholarship. This leaves approximately $650 to be covered by
     each youth and their parish/diocese.
-   YTM offers additional scholarships to a limited number of youth each year
     based on financial need.
-   To ensure that the YTM population mirrors the diversity of American Catholicism
     (one of our program goals), we also offer specific scholarships to Hispanic
     youth and persons of color.
-   More scholarship funding means more youth who can participate in YTM.

      The Challenge is On!

      This is a Flexible Funding campaign. That means that even if we don't reach our $5000 goal, we will still receive all donations made through the campaign, but Indiegogo will take a larger cut. However, we are confident that we will reach our goal through your generosity! If every former YTM youth, counselor, and adult mentor donated just $10, we would not only reach our goal, but we would surpass it by over $1500! Please prayerfully consider supporting YTM with a donation today!

      Looking for another way to give? It's easy to make regularly scheduled contributions to YTM! Even $5 a month can add up in the long run--so skip that Starbucks line once a month and support YTM by signing up for automatic monthly, quarterly, or yearly donations at http://dft.ba/-supportYTM.

        Can't donate, but still want to help?

        There are so many ways to support this campaign in addition to making a financial contribution!

        • Pray for our fundraising efforts and for the whole YTM program!
        • Tell your YTM story. Talk to your friends and family members about this campaign and why it matters to you!
        • Share, share, share! Use Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Snapchat,
          e-mail...however you communicate online, you can use it as an opportunity to spread the word about the work God is doing through YTM!

        Thank you for helping us build something beautiful for God!

story:
About Flowers of Battle

Since 2010, Freelance Academy Press has brought readers innovative books, instructional DVDs and rich supporting material in the fields of Historical European Marital Arts. In 2017, we are pleased to introduce our most ambitious project to date:

 

 

This ambitious project goes well beyond anything we have done before: a four (volume set of illustrated, hard-cover books, combining color, 1:1 facsimiles of the master's original manuscripts; professional, annotated translations, and extensive, peer-reviewed essays. With your help, we can produce a fifth volume covering the inheritors of this tradition.

Few historical fencing masters are as dear as Fiore dei Liberi to the heart of the modern Historical European Martial Arts (HEMA) community. Credited by fencing historians as the father of Italian swordsmanship, his magnum opus, il Fior di Bataglia (The Flower of Battle), composed in early 1409, is one of the oldest, most extensive, and most clearly elucidated martial arts treatises from the medieval period.

Four versions of il Fior di Battaglia—the earliest surviving Italian source on the martial arts—survive today and form the basis for the modern study of armizare. Each has important similarities to and differences from each other. The key similarity is the organization of the material, which systematically covers abrazare (wrestling and hand-to-hand fighting),  daga (dagger, with an emphasis on self-defense and armoured combat techniques), spada a un mano (single-handed sword), spada a due mani (two-handed sword), spada in arme (sword used in armour), azza in arme (poleaxe used in armour), lanza in arme (spear used in armour), and finally all weapons a cavallo, or on horseback.  

The key martial techniques, called zoghi or “plays” by Fiore, are identical between manuscripts, but each manuscript contains plays and key information not seen in the others, and each is done in a different artistic style.  


Status: Ready to print. 
Delivery: October 2017

Held by the J. Paul Getty Museum in California, MS. Ludwig XV 13  is the largest and most complete of the four surviving manuscripts. Dedicated to the young, bellicose Niccolò d'Este, Marquis of Ferrara, this edition of Fiore's work details the names of his famous students, the five duels he fought against rival masters, and explains in detail the instructional schema he developed to make the work accessible to students. Beginning with grappling, it progresses through the various sub-systems of armizare, ending with mounted combat.

These details all make the Getty Manuscript the most logical and obvious choice for Volume One, which sets the stage for the entire series. It has 183 pages of cutting-edge research, covering:

  • The life of Fiore dei Liberi, his students, and patrons;
  • Arms and armour in the Getty Manuscript, and their relationship to surviving examples;
  • Dueling and chivalric culture in Italy at the close of the 14th century;
  • A detailed analysis of the manuscripts' use of pedagogy, numbers, and metaphor to teach the Art of Arms;
  • The Flower of Battle's relationship to other medieval combat manuscripts.


Status: Translation and front-matter complete. Layout pending.
Delivery: January 2018

Volume Two presents the most well-known of the dei Liberi manuscripts, held in the private collection of the Pisani-Dossi family in Italy. Published in a detailed facsimile by Francesco Novati in 1902, this work was the principal access to Fiore dei Liberi's work until the late 1990s. While it follows the organization of the Getty Manuscript, it yet has a wholly different artistic style and text in rhyming couplets. Our poetic translation preserves the rhyming scheme of the original Latin and Italian verse, provides a short introduction on the manuscript and its relationship to the other three dei Liberi texts, and includes a full English translation of Novati's original commentary containing extensive research and bibliographic footnotes as an appendix.

Status: Translation in progress, front-matter in progress. Layout pending.
Delivery: May 2018.

Only discovered in the last decade, MS. Latin 11269 or Florius de Arte Luctandi  was hidden in plain sight within the Bibliothèque Nationale in Paris. Likely created in the 1420s after the author's death, it is lavishly illustrated in painted figures and is interesting not only for being an example of reverse translation from a vernacular to Latin, but also as an ennoblement of a practical art in literary verse form. The manuscript also differs from two of its predecessors in beginning with mounted combat and ending with grappling on foot—an organization reflective of the knightly duel.

The introduction to this work looks at the rhetorical flourishes and adaptations to the earlier manuscripts, and what it tells us about Fiore dei Liberi's legacy.

Status: Translation Complete, Front-matter in progress. Layout pending.
Projected Delivery: Late 2018

Created by artists trained in the same school as the Getty Manuscript, the Pierpoint-Morgan MS. is an enigma—incomplete, using similar text to the Getty but the same organizational structure as the Florius, and making no mention at all of Niccolò d'Este. This volume presents the same treatment of complete translation and edition as was done for the previous manuscripts, combined with images and text from late 16th and 17th century editions of Fiore's work (or works derived from it), and a complete concordance of the plays found throughout the four core manuscripts, completing and indexing the entire series.

Where the Money Goes

Like many small presses, we began Freelance using primarily print-on-demand and short-run digital printing. This technology has come a long way, particularly in the realm of black and white and hardcover printing. However, it has its limits, particularly in full-color books. Simply, digital printing is like using a giant laser-printer, laying down toner, rather than ink, which sits on top of the paper. Technological improvements make the quality look much better than previously, but the durability of the book is an issue: deletions (blank spots where the toner was thin) are common, and over time the pages do not age well.

Because of this, the first and foremost cost of this project will be the use of traditional, offset printing for Volume One, which remains the industry standard for doing a high-quality book right. Although the per-book cost is lower, we need to print a minimum of 1000 copies, have them transported and warehoused—and with 8.5 x 11" books that is a lot of space and a lot of weight.

Our second major cost is the 5000 Euro fee owed to the BNF for world-wide permission to use their scans in print, due at the time of publication.

The Good Stuff: Perks

We have some great bonuses built in to the pledge levels. 

  • Supporter - $25: You are a part of bringing this vision to life, and we will make sure everyone knows it! Your name will be listed in the credits of Volume One as a Supporter and you will receive a high-resolution digital download of a unique, high-color Fiore dei Liberi "Sign of the Sword" poster, suitable for framing.
  • Subscriber - $100: Flowers of Battle, Volume One is yours! This perk gets you a hardback edition of Volume One, PLUS two printed color 8.5 x 11" posters: Fiore's "Sign of the Sword" and "I'll Mess You Up: The Sword in One Hand", and listing as a Subscriber in Volume One. All of this for the projected retail cost of Volume One! (Poster ships with the book.)
  • Scolaro d'Arme (Scholar at Arms) - $125: Includes everything at the previous level, plus nine 8.5 x 11" posters of the Nine Masters of the Dagger, suitable for framing. You gain access to a special download: Il Fior di Battaglia: Sala d'Arme Edition, a beautiful, a full-color PDF containing the Getty MS with Tom Leoni's translation in-line. Perfect for tablets! (This PDF will never be commercially available!)
  • Magistro d'Arme (Master at Arms) - $250: For the discerning student of armizare! At this level you get everything from the Scolaro level PLUS a PDF copy of Guy Windsor's Mastering the Art of Arms, Vol I: The Dagger, PLUS a B+W, spiral-bound Sala d'Arme Edition of the Getty MS and a hard-cover of Volume Two: Flos Duellatorum. (Shipped separately.)
  • Rival Masters - $500. Fiore fought five duels against other masters jealous of his secrets. Now you can have them! A simple perk for the simple swordsman: all four volumes PLUS the unlocked fifth volume, PLUS your name as a Subscriber in Volume One.
  • Fiore dei Liberi  -  $600: Our second-highest patronage level gives you all four volumes of the series, including a SIGNED hardback edition of Volume One (replaces the unsigned copy), a color, spiral edition of the Sala d'Arme Edition, and all other $250 level perks.
  • Niccolò d'Este - $1,000: Our top patronage level gives you all volumes autographed by the authors in a slip-case, a unique, case-bound, color edition of Robert N. Charrette's Fiore dei Liberi's Armizare: Chivalric Marital Arts, your name listed in the front matter of Volume One as a series Patron, all other perks, and and a commemorative, inscribed bastoncello (medieval commander's baton).

What if We Don't Reach Full-Funding?

A fair question! We have based our cost estimates on producing the first two volumes, so unless the fund-raiser is a complete bust, we can guarantee that the first volume will come out on time and precisely as promised, albeit without some of the bells and whistles (like the full-color front-matter—see Stretch Goals below). From there, things become more complicated, with each volume's sales having to fund the next in the series. Based on projected sales and past projects, we are fairly confident that the entire project would be completed, but the timeline could take significantly longer, with at least a year between volumes.

Obviously, nothing is without  risks, and we've all backed projects that haven't come to fruition, or have done so veeerrrrryyyy late. Publishing notoriously runs late, and we are a staff of two plus some freelance designers. 

However, we've tried to head off the problems at the pass by doing most of the things that lead to delays BEFORE launching our campaign! Here are a few reasons why we feel confident about this project, and think that you should, too:

  • This isn't our first rodeo. So far, Freelance Academy Press has published 25 unique titles and distributes a dozen more. 
  • We already have the first volume completely finished—all that is missing is adding the pages listing our contributors (you!) and sending the book to press.

Volume Two is already in layout (design) and assuming the fundraising is a success, can be ready to go to print within a few weeks. 

 Volume One  is the largest and most detailed book in the series—over twice the size of following volumes—and serves as a general overview and introduction to Fiore dei Liberi, his work, and his world. Over a decade of research and five years of active writing has gone into refining the extensive essays you will find within. We are quite proud of the finished product and believe readers will be pleased—but it could be even better. Here's how:
 

$12,000—Full-Color Front Matter!
While all of the front matter is HEAVILY illustrated, it would be far more elegant and telling to present Fiore's work alongside full-color exemplars from his contemporaries. Since a picture is worth a thousand words, here are a few examples so you can see for yourself!

B+W:

Color:


B+W:

Color:

 

$16,000—Fifth Volume: Leaves of Battle—Fiore dei Liberi's Martial Heirs and Influence 
At this stretch level we will remove the samples of the related German material from Volume Four...and present it in its entirety in Volume Five. Accompanied by scans from a 17th century, Veronese redaction of Fiore's prologue, a new translation of Fillipo Vadi's De Arte Gladiatoria and an introduction on the last known master of the "Dei Liberi Tradition" and the relationship of his work to the Pisani-Dossi and Florius manuscripts, this volume completes the series by encompassing all of the known material with a clear, lineal connection to Fiore dei Liberi. This automatically upgrades the Rival Masters, Fiore dei Liberi and Niccolo d'Este packages.

$30,000 - Mastering the Art of Arms Series Added to Perks
In our perks structure, everyone at the Magistro level and above gets a digital copy of Mastering the Art of Arms, Volume One: the Dagger, courtesy of renowned armizare researcher and teacher, Guy Windsor. If we reach this goal, that perk will upgrade to all three volumes of the series! Another $40 in freebies and months of training materials, yours free!

$32,000 - See a Swordfight Through Fiore's Eyes.

Inspired by Guy's generosity, renowned historical novelist (and one of our backers!) Christian Cameron thought he'd lend his own talents to help us reach our final goals. Christian  is a devoted practitioner of armizare, so much so that in his novels The Ill-Made Knight, The Longsword, and the about-to-be released The Green Count, a young Fiore himself appears as a companion-at-arms and martial instructor to the series hero, William Gold, and is seen through his eyes. Inspired by Guy Windsor's generosity, Christian has offered to pen a short story from Fiore's point of view. Ever wonder what was going through the master's mind when he fought his five, famed duels? This is the closest we'll ever get to finding out.

We hope you are as excited about this project as we are, and are eager to support it. Of course, you may be excited but unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  

  • Crowd-Funding is driven by word of mouth. If you find this project worthy, please help us get the word out by sharing this campaign page.
  • Indiegogo makes this even easier via its share tools! Check them out!

We have based our cost estimates on producing the first two volumes, so unless the fund-raiser is a complete bust, we can guarantee that the first volume will come out on time and precisely as promised, albeit without some of the bells and whistles (like the full-color front-matter—see Stretch Goals below). From there, things become more complicated, with each volume's sales having to fund the next in the series. Based on projected sales and past projects, we are fairly confident that the entire project would be completed, but the timeline could take significantly longer, with at least a year between volumes.


Obviously, nothing is without  risks, and we've all backed projects that haven't come to fruition, or have done so veeerrrrryyyy late. Publishing notoriously runs late, and we are a staff of two plus some freelance designers. However, we've tried to head off the problems at the pass by doing most of the things that lead to delays BEFORE launching our campaign! Here are a few reasons why we feel confident about this project, and think that you should, too:

This isn't our first rodeo. So far, Freelance Academy Press has published 25 unique titles and distributes a dozen more. 
We already have the first volume completely finished—all that is missing is adding the pages listing our contributors (you!) and sending the book to press.

Volume Two is already in layout (design) and assuming the fundraising is a success, can be ready to go to print within a few weeks. 


 Volume One  is the largest and most detailed book in the series—over twice the size of following volumes—and serves as a general overview and introduction to Fiore dei Liberi, his work, and his world. Over a decade of research and five years of active writing has gone into refining the extensive essays you will find within. We are quite proud of the finished product and believe readers will be pleased—but it could be even better. Here's how: 
$12,000—Full-Color Front Matter!While all of the front matter is HEAVILY illustrated, it would be far more elegant and telling to present Fiore's work alongside full-color exemplars from his contemporaries. Since a picture is worth a thousand words, here are a few examples so you can see for yourself!
B+W:Color:
B+W:Color: 
$16,000—Fifth Volume: Leaves of Battle—Fiore dei Liberi's Martial Heirs and Influence At this stretch level we will remove the samples of the related German material from Volume Four...and present it in its entirety in Volume Five. Accompanied by scans from a 17th century, Veronese redaction of Fiore's prologue, a new translation of Fillipo Vadi's De Arte Gladiatoria and an introduction on the last known master of the "Dei Liberi Tradition" and the relationship of his work to the Pisani-Dossi and Florius manuscripts, this volume completes the series by encompassing all of the known material with a clear, lineal connection to Fiore dei Liberi. This automatically upgrades the Rival Masters, Fiore dei Liberi and Niccolo d'Este packages.
$30,000 - Mastering the Art of Arms Series Added to PerksIn our perks structure, everyone at the Magistro level and above gets a digital copy of Mastering the Art of Arms, Volume One: the Dagger, courtesy of renowned armizare researcher and teacher, Guy Windsor. If we reach this goal, that perk will upgrade to all three volumes of the series! Another $40 in freebies and months of training materials, yours free!
$32,000 - See a Swordfight Through Fiore's Eyes.
Inspired by Guy's generosity, renowned historical novelist (and one of our backers!) Christian Cameron thought he'd lend his own talents to help us reach our final goals. Christian  is a devoted practitioner of armizare, so much so that in his novels The Ill-Made Knight, The Longsword, and the about-to-be released The Green Count, a young Fiore himself appears as a companion-at-arms and martial instructor to the series hero, William Gold, and is seen through his eyes. Inspired by Guy Windsor's generosity, Christian has offered to pen a short story from Fiore's point of view. Ever wonder what was going through the master's mind when he fought his five, famed duels? This is the closest we'll ever get to finding out.

We hope you are as excited about this project as we are, and are eager to support it. Of course, you may be excited but unable to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  
Crowd-Funding is driven by word of mouth. If you find this project worthy, please help us get the word out by sharing this campaign page.
Indiegogo makes this even easier via its share tools! Check them out!

story:
Have you ever wondered how the information collected in Australia’s five yearly Census is used?

The truth is that governments and planning bodies make all sorts of planning and funding decisions based on how Australians answer the Census questions.

That’s why I’m worried about the question about religion in the next Census, coming up in August of this year.

To my mind, just because someone was baptised or brought up in a certain religion a long time ago doesn’t necessarily mean that their church is somehow entitled to something more from the average taxpayer.

Put simply, just because you were born into a religion, that doesn't mean you have to tick that religion on the 2016 Census.

Do you agree?

How you can help...

We need your support in an awareness campaign to promote the consideration and importance of marking 'No religion' on the 2016 census. We hope to get a better and more accurate representation of how religious Australia is.

  • We are looking to raise $25,000 to put towards buying media so that we can get the message out too all Australian adults.
  • We have already engaged the services of professional communications experts in both PR and Marketing
  • The AFA is already investing in creating a clear and non biased marketing campaign supported by a strategic PR and media plan.

The Impact

After successful campaigns in New Zealand and England/Wales, those countries now report a population with nearly 50% of the population identifying as non religious. This is an increase of nearly 25% over the last 5 years.

Your donation today will help Australia get a more accurate representation of how religious the population is. And this will have impact on the future decisions of our politicians and policy makers.


Together we can reach all Australians

With your support this campaign can make it into every Australian home. By getting the message across our cities and towns we'll create a conversation that everyone can be part of. Billboards, Facebook, newspapers and on TV.

We have recruited leading Creative and PR agencies to help create a campaign that will get a great return on your investment and great results. 


Other Ways You Can Help

We'll be keeping you in the loop! So when the campaign goes live you can share it with your friends and family too!


Thank you for all your support.

Keep in touch, check your emails and follow us on twitter and facebook. Soon you will be a part of history!  For more information you can visit censusnoreligion.org.au 

#Census2016 and #MarkNoReligion

story:
Short Summary

I got into an exclusive writer's workshop run by Middlebury College called Bread Loaf. It is in Sicily. Although I received a generous partial scholarship from the program, I am still responsible for the remainder of tuition and my own airfare. I am so excited about this opportunity but I need your help to get me there. Only six writers were accepted into my workshop with Jay Parini. You can read more about the conference here. Please feel free to google Bread Loaf and see why I am so excited! 

Who I Am?

I write short fiction for adults and book length fiction for middle-grade children. My work for adults is character driven. I mostly focus on issues of good and evil (as moral ambivalence), contemporary expressions of classical archetypes, and explorations of alternate normative environments (like prison, refugee camps, ghettos, mental illness and addiction).

The Impact

I want to build a community of peers who examine my work with rigorous honesty. I want to make connections with other writers who I can trust implicitly. The intensive nature of the Bread Loaf in Sicily program fosters these kinds of connections, which I hope will last well into my professional career. 

I try to walk the fine line between artifice and exactitude, between lushness and tightly controlled imagery. I am a slow writer and pay close attention to the words. I hope to find mentors to both encourage my own process and also shake up my routines; mentors who are unequivocal in their ruthless dedication to improving the craft of my writing. I hope the mentor and peer relationships that I form at the Bread Loaf Conference in Sicily will help me moving forward to make better writing decisions.

I know that there are so many good causes and great projects out there. Asking for what I need in this way is a real stretch for me, but I am trying to learn to be comfortable putting myself out there. Thank you for letting me grow in this way!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and help explain how powerful even a small contribution can be. I am so very very grateful for this opportunity. 

Lots of Love,

Tamara

story:
Short Summary

 I AM SO EXCITED! 

Greetings, Beloveds!

I'm Claudia, and I was recently selected to participate as a writing fellow in the Lambda Literary Foundation Writers Retreat for Emerging LGBT Voices!  How sensational is that!  When Nik Nicholson, my beloved friend, called to inform me about the LLF opportunity, I began an exhilarating race with the clock to complete the application.  An artist all my life, I scintillated with light as I wrapped up the application process.  Then a while later, I received my acceptance email.  I was ecstatic! 

To attend LLF writers retreat is a "dream come true" for me!  It is just what my Spirit needs, the community of other writers and time to workshop my writing to make it the best that it can possibly be.  I can already feel the vibrations of wonder coursing through me just to meet mystery writer, workshop leader, Elizabeth Sims, and have her share what she has learned about being a writer of note in the publishing arena!

Yes, my goal is to immerse myself in Sims' Genre Fiction workshop, but my goal is also to have a polished manuscript in hand.  I'm flying out with my manuscript, NOT WITHOUT PASSION.  I will hone it, revise it, proofread it and receive feedback from other writers on it.  And when the intensive week comes to an end, I will have my manuscript ready to be published as an eBook and a softcover book.  Please note my Pretty Perks to learn how I intend to share my gift with YOU!  Yes, yes, yes!  I can't do this without you!


THE BREAKDOWN:

Although I am working within a very tight turnaround, I am excited and faithful that we can accomplish this together.  My goal is to raise $3350.00.  This is how the funds will be allocated:

  • Though I was awarded an $800 scholarship, I yet have the writers retreat balance to pay before July 25, 2014.      $1000
  • My round-trip airfare (the sooner I can buy the ticket, the better)   $1000
  • My transportation to and from the airport            $200
  • Editing                                                                           $400
  • Formatting for eBook and softcover                      $400
  • ISBN number acquisition and copyright               $350


THE VISION

Your contribution will definitely make a difference.  It will mean you lending your support to the writing community, when you assist me as an emerging writer, seeking the community of other artists.  I intend to walk away from the Lambda Literary Foundation Writers Retreat with a fully workshop-ed manuscript, my artistic voice, an offering to the world!

My vision is to rewrite my third novel, Not Without Passion, from a fresh perspective.  Right now, it is a luscious, contemporary romance involving protagonist Moon Renfro and a lovely cast of ladies.  I think it is a many splendid thing, but it can yet be tweaked!  It tackles Moon’s family woes, her love life and delve into what happens when we walk away from it all, just take the plunge and rise shivering from the cold.  Will she possess the chutzpah to rise like a Phoenix from the ashes? 


THIS IS WHAT THE LAMBDA LITERARY FOUNDATION says about the WRITERS RETREAT:


THE WRITERS RETREAT FOR EMERGING LGBT VOICES

"By far one of the most important initiatives the Lambda Literary Foundation undertakes is to support up-and-coming writers. In the long run, maybe it’s LLF's most important job. The Foundation does so through The Writers Retreat for Emerging LGBT Voices – this year in Los Angeles, August 3 - August 10. After 5 years of existence, the Retreat has earned a sterling reputation, and for good reason.

The Retreat is unlike any other writing program in the world. It’s the only residency established specifically for promising LGBT writers. Classes are taught by a brilliant and diverse faculty, themselves all successful LGBT writers. The sad truth is, many who want to come to the Retreat just can’t afford it. Though some scholarship money is offered, it does not cover all costs to ensure the very best aspiring lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender writers can attend. They need your support today. Your contribution to help send a talented emerging writer to Los Angeles this summer is critical.

The “Retreat” – a misnomer, really, since one former student delighted in calling it a “queer writers’ boot camp” – gathers LGBT writers from every walk of life for one rigorous, immerse week. Lives are changed. Students arrive with manuscripts in hand, a novel or short story collection, a book of poetry or a memoir, a mystery or young adult novel that will soon extend the fabric of our literature. At “boot camp” they polish their craft. They work on plot, develop more convincing characters and explore their own distinctive voices. Teaching is personalized. They gain a better understanding of what works and what might need re-working. Besides one-on-one instruction, students forge connections to publishing industry professionals, and most importantly, build a community of peers on whom they’ll depend for years of encouragement, inspiration and friendship.

A writer’s life is full of challenges. Lambda’s emerging voices Fellows come from big cities and rural towns all over America. In many of these places the LGBT community is still under a lot of pressure, subtle and not-so-subtle. When a writer is committed to our queer literary traditions – to stories of unconventional lives and social struggle, to girl-meets-girl and first gay love – work becomes so much harder in isolation. Your gift today will give a talented LGBT writer a real chance for professional growth and personal achievement. Our Lambda Fellows go on to achieve an impressive record of publication and community involvement. They are both prolific artists and ambassadors of the literary arts."



WAYS TO HELP SHARE THE LOVE!

SPREAD THE WORD:  Please share my campaign with family and friends. There is power in the word, so use those web links to get it out!  Everyone can help in some way!  Remember, Indigogo has share tools, too!

DONATE:  Any donation is sincerely appreciated, for no donation is too small.  It is ever and always the thought behind it that speaks volumes.

I THANK YOU WITH ALL MY HEART!

story:
Have you ever thought how many crazy things people do just to meet their Master of the Nightmare? Someone hid in the backstage, someone waited near the exit, someone chased him during his tour. Someone was inspired by him, and began his own career as a singer/band.
I am a fan of Alice Cooper and I am writing a book about his fans. The book is called "We love you, Alice Cooper!" I am collecting these funny and inspiring stories and I am writing them in a humorous way. My friend makes illustrations for the book. 
I need funds to publish this book - to pay translators because stories are in different languages, I am collecting them from the whole world. Of course I will be happy to send a copy of the book for each person who will donate and help me publish this book!

Above is the actual 2008 Securities Exchange Commission filing at the core of this story which deserves close examination. Buca Inc has exhibited criminal contempt of court, conspiracy, insider trading and fraud.. these offences hidden from the public sector and a federal court judge in Pittsburgh by disbarred and disgraced lawyer Lois E Glanby. While I am myself Pro Se by nature, I am now Pro Se from a legal standpoint having been personally involved with the court system. I speak now on behalf of those intentionally misled Buca investors who owned shares of this stock between the years of 2007& 2010. In retrospect I should have made this public in 2007, but refused out of consideration for the employer. That has all changed, the respect I once had has long ago evaporated. The public should consider me a good old-fashioned  whistle blower. This story actually begins in 2003, with blatant violations of Federal Labor and Immigration Laws having occurred and witnessed in the (re)-hiring of a previously deported illegal immigrant. A letter of complaint (c) 2010 is drafted August 4 2003 and distributed to management and co-workers at the Robinson Township Pennsylvania location. Constructive termination / retaliation is the end result  for this author and his co worker teenage son. Beginning as an employment issue in the Pa UC with perjured testimony having been given under oath, I then proceed to the PHRC in 2004. Armed with collected documentation of the past and conflicting statements having been made by Buca, I eventually enter the Western District of Pennsylvania Federal Court in 2007. Civil Action # 2:07-cv-00242TFM is filed late February and not by coincidence, multi million dollar restaurant chain Buca Inc (BUCA) NASDAQ stock values begin to fall. They continue to do so unchecked until an August 5 2008 press release to the public announced an entry into "a direct financial obligation and plan of merger, and believe it or not, one month later in September 08 this "Plan" is finalized with "Planet Hollywood International Inc, a Delaware corporation" (PHWDQ.PK) This is birthplace of Buca Financing LLC, which allows for the continued operation of the restaurant chain Buca Di Beppo. How was this possible, and why was it done while the corporation was Defendant in an ongoing private federal civil matter? Answer: Buca expecting to be found guilty at trial, the fallibility/transparency of internet, incriminating documents and last but not least disbarred lawyer Lois E Glanby, who did in fact effectively place a gag upon me (us) and conceal the true Buca story from the public sector with an electronically filed and never agreed to "settlement". Pro Se case 2:12-cv-1748 was filed and has served to make that agreement worthless. Gross Misconduct and Negligence has proven to serve as inspiration for the 2012-2013 actions of Edwin G Hose Pro Se in the Western District of Pennsylvania federal court. Potential readers of this story will be inspired to be self representative in all matters of life. We all strive to possess a clear conscience. This author wishes to teach others how to be Pro Se in today's internet age. An experienced based self help Pro Se website is hoped for in the next year. Your employment based case has just been ended electronically within the court, behind your back, as you prepared to pose some very difficult questions to the "defendant" who already had plenty to answer. Who would you complain to, what would you do? The defendant has intentionally buried the stock portion of the company because of this action and while actively present in court with a fired worker who was personally involved and an informed investor, witness to the scheme. Under these circumstances how would I manage to find closure? Sue the lawyer? She effectively served as roadblock in between myself and the defendant. Would you or could you, accept it gracefully having been tricked legally by someone you trusted and psychologically violated on this many levels and be able to "forget it"? No, and neither could I. Since this miscarriage of justice took place, I have refused to carry this living nightmare to my grave, and chose instead to go Pro Se. I chose to do it myself.   His eyes opened and beheld a sapphire blue sky. Thoughts which came to him in the initial moments of consciousness inspired him to consider the possibility that he was perhaps about to meet God. He turned his head to see the motorcycle he had been riding lying as motionless on the ground as he now was. Gathering awareness and balance, he rose to his feet to assess the situation. Replace the jumped chain and make a quick trip back to the trailer. Upon further inspection it was soon discovered that a vital part had been damaged. It was the main shaft, and is exactly what the title describes. Part number one… the entire motorcycle begins here. As with everything else he owns, the motorcycle was used, aged and parts were no longer readily available. The usual response to inquiries concerning parts was, more often than not, “it has been discontinued” or “is no longer available”. In this instance part number one needed to be found, but where do you find such an obsolete item? 

  His two young sons were eight years apart in age. As part of their school curriculum they had each had the opportunity to attend classes to learn of the newly introduced computer and internet that had in recent years been made available to the public. One day, a computer ended up in the kitchen. His initial opinion was that there was no real use for it, and to remove it. As he watched his eight year old cruise in cyberspace he became a little bit jealous. There seemed to be an awful lot to learn to be able to use this device. It was at that moment that the personal computer became important for the writer. He remembered hearing on many occasions that “you can find anything on the internet”. The time had come for him to test that stated theory for himself, and be required to learn a thing or two about the computer along the way. One day a search began with the author typing the words and clicking the mouse. And so it went for six months, searching for the critical part and learning, until success was realized. After his first electronic transaction with a small salvage yard in the state of Georgia, the main shaft was shipped and the motorcycle was once again transporting one of the three male family members into the solitude and serenity of the wooded trails. 

  He now sat at the computer with nothing to do, nothing interesting to search for. He had been impressed by the power and scope of the computer and internet. He had indeed found something previously thought to be impossible to find. The question he asked himself at this point in time was, “what can I research now?”  The unemployment compensation matter soon came to mind. After several years it had transformed into a federal civil action in the Western District of Pennsylvania. The defendant in the case was his former employer, a major restaurant chain. What had begun as a simple job issue in 2003 had, quite deliberately, found its way here. With conflicting statements having been made on record by the employer, and incriminating documentation including corporate illegal immigrant tax forms having been gathered in the past years, two thoughts came to his mind. The first being the excitement of having such evidence to present in court that would shine a spotlight on the immigration problem, and the second was, how the corporation would conduct themselves on Wall Street and before the public during the lawsuit. There had been several past occasions at which time the right thing could have been done by Buca, but never was. At age 55 the future in stock he had planned for himself ten years ago has been taken from him and his sleep remains disturbed. He will no longer be able to trust very well, especially when it comes to lawyers and employers. But more importantly remains the fact that had it not been for the blessing of sobriety, he would never have blossomed into the recognized plaintiff pro se that he has become today. He remains proud yet humble, grateful to God and giving in nature. In all reality he is self described as being “krill in the sea of life”, but his heart is pure. In daily life he works 25 hours per week in the personal employ of one man and his family. Not one day has passed without his receiving at least verbal appreciation of his service. There is more contentment to be found here than is possible in most workplaces. Employee stock purchase programs offered by certain corporations would now appear to be for suckers, from his experience. America has always been the land of opportunity, and it is upon this distinction that he has written this story. If there is a future outside of poverty left for him to earn, it will be a product of this work and his dedication to standing in defense of his principles, and the laws of this country through his actions. For now he enjoys and is thankful for, Gods providence.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Our Story

My name is Rob Merlino and I am The Hotdogman. For six wonderful years, I owned and operated a hot dog truck (aptly called The Hot Dog Truck). In 2009 I had some health issues that forced me to sell my truck, so I went back to school to get a Master's Degree and a Teaching license. During my new found role as a student, I began expanding on another website I created called Hot Dog Stories.


Hot Dog Stories is a website that features photos and videos of my visits to different hot dog establishments in Maine, Florida, Montreal, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, and Nevada (so far). In July of 2011, I gained national attention for my hot dog eating "tour." I ate a hot dog a day at a different venue every day in July 2011 to celebrate National Hot Dog Month. My "quest" was featured in The Boston Globe, The Metrowest Daily News, The Fall River Herald, WZLX Radio (Boston's Classic Rock), NECN TV, WCVB TV, UPI, NPR and countless other print, radio and electronic media. National Hot Dog Month 2011 was a huge success.

In 2012, the Hotdogman's National Hot Dog Month Tour will be bigger and better. I want to expand the geographic footprint of the tour in search of hot dog joints of all kinds, from the iconic to the smallest cart at the side of the road in Somewhere Town, USA. 

This year, in addition to the daily videos and photo spreads shot at each venue, I want to produce a 60-90 minute video documentary of the journey and write a book about it. The book will feature more in depth interviews with each owner and customer and more photos of the tour. I want to make this a yearly event as well.

The Impact

As the saying goes, the show will go on with or without full funding. Last year my wife and I financed this venture out of our own pockets which limited the scope and production values. Even so, it was a success; we just want a better, more professional product this year. The closer we get to our goal, the further we will be able to travel.

Some people may think this is a silly idea, but hot dogs are a big part of American culture. The little hot dog cart at the side of the road is something many people simply cannot resist. Each hot dog cart operator is a business person with a story to tell. Hot dog cart operators represent what is best about America: independence, autonomy, individualism, and the spirit of hope. I want to delve into the circumstances that brought each small vendor into the hot dog business. There are/will be many tales of corporate downsizing and people in search of their own piece of the American Dream.

The older, iconic establishments (one has been in business since 1890) we'll visit represent a fading past that it equally important on the American landscape. In this era of big box stores and chain restaurants, the hot dog joint remains a largely independent, local enterprise. This is due to regional tastes and the allure of things from our past. The owner of George's Coney Island in Worcester, Massachusetts- an establishment in business since 1918- said it best: "we represent a sense of familiarity and stability in an ever changing world." That's poetic. These iconic businesses show what can be done to create success in an independent business and how the American Dream manifests itself over several generations.

We will endeavor to capture the spirit of the hot dog joint and what it represents to American culture in each video, the documentary film, and the book. We will have fun doing it too. The most funny and poignant moments from each visit usually come from customers- I always like to catch people in the act of being themselves.

We will also talk about the hot dogs. Me and my team will sample hot dogs at each place and offer our frank opinion on the culinary uniqueness of each hot dog eaten. Different hot dog brands, interesting toppings, preparation methods and regional tastes will be examined and each joint will be hoping for the Hotdogman's seal of approval-"two thumbs up."

When woven into a 60-90 minute film and a book, our goal is to offer a fun but insightful look at Americana through the eyes of hot dog lovers everywhere.

There will be at least two additional short videos associated with this year's quest as well: a "bloopers and out takes" video and a video where I collect answers to the age old question: "do you put ketchup on your hot dogs?"

What We Need & What You Get

On the 2011 tour, we were limited to visiting hot dog joints fairly close to home (greater Boston). We want to expand the geographic footprint of the tour further up and down the east coast this year to get a broader epicurean and cultural cross section for the film and book. More travel means more expenses. We'll need a lot of money for gas, tolls, meals and lodging as we meander through the back roads and broad boulevards of small towns and big cities.

We also need to drastically upgrade our video cameras, microphones, editing software, and editing computers to complete the job properly. We will need the services of a professional production editor to oversee putting the individual episodes and film together. For the final cut, we will need money to pay for music and archival material rights as well. There will also be marketing and production costs for producing a CD of the documentary. The book will require cover design, layout assistance, and a marketing budget.

We'll need money for promotional items for the tour- tee shirts, hats, free products etc. and for buying hot dogs at each establishment for ourselves and participating patrons. There will be legal fees, accounting costs and the inevitable "unforeseen expenses."

What the funder will get, besides an expanded knowledge of where to find the best hot dogs in a given region, is a host of perks, exposure and goodies. This is a great vehicle for a sponsor to gain a big bang for their marketing buck. Daily news stories on radio, TV and in newspapers plus two blog posts per day guarantee a sponsor will get tons of visibility for their brand. If you have a product or service that appeals to hot dog lovers or hot dog vendors, supporting this project will put you in front of that audience for an entire month at a fraction of the cost of any other marketing endeavor. What would it cost for a daily newspaper, radio AND TV ad for an entire month? Much more than any of the sponsorship options to the right, that's for sure. 


Our goal with this project is that it will be the first in a series of video documentaries that catalog, document and celebrate the all American Hot Dog Joint. Future plans include regional tours in different cities around the country where we seek out the most iconic and funky hot dog joints. Certainly being a part of a project that celebrates the hot dog and Americana is something many people will want to get involved in, but extra incentives aren't bad either! See the perks for more info.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even a dollar or two will help get us to our goal, but if you can't give a lot you can help us by spreading the word. Post this page on your facebook wall, tweet about it, blog about it. tell a friend in the news media, talk about it at a party- just spread the word!

story:
In the midst of beautiful demands of community advocacy work and motherhood, I chose to try for the opportunity to take my writing to the next level, submitting a ‘poetry manuscript’  I have been sitting on since early 2012 (edited first and adding a few new ones) to VONA/VOICES., the only multi-genre workshop for writers of color in the nation.  VONA takes writers of color from the margins to a community where their work is centralized and honored.  In mid-April I got the news that I was accepted to the poetry workshop with Ruth Forman that will take place in Miami from June 21st to June 27th. This is my first, ever, writing specific workshop. 

The week I received the news, I was in the middle of planning a few events for work, and like other creative parents in the sweet whirls of parenting my pre-teen while writing a poem here and there before bed for my own eyes.  Quoting other artists, living life has been the creative pursuit; my poetry. Being Amaya’s mother, advocacy work, my relationship to myself and my loved ones, transforming nostalgia, fears, and anxieties all that juggle, the poetry. As I sat with the news, consulting with a few deciding that the price to make it to Miami, would not be a deterrent, it will cost me $2,000.  $1350 is room/board and tuition, while the rest is flight and other travel expenses.  Whether if it be audacious to workshop, to take my poetry/writing to the next level.  This is when I decided that, I would turn to my community to help me make one of my dreams a reality.

Centering my poetry has been uncomfortable. Though I have written a ton on pieces of paper and blogs, since becoming Amaya’s mother (at 23 years old) submitting to a few anthologies,  periodic contributor to make/shift magazine and work. Prioritizing other people, their needs, my community, being a mother, and supporting other people’s art has been more natural to me, many of us come from communities that not only do this, but is encouraged and through this kinship we've survived.  I am moved to anchor and live my grandmother’s words and mother’s in my life, experience my dreams, of also centering poetry and invest in it, furthering my commitment as a community poet. Create poetry to heal, heal my lineage, in my family and community.  The only way this is possible at this time, is to have my community’s support.

Taking my poetry to the next level is part of my path, while being Amaya’s mother, and community health care advocate and community based researcher, is to live my life, how I want and how my ancestor’s envisioned.  Carving my own path, honoring those writers that have contributed my inspiration (Suheir Hammad, Ana Castillo, Toni Morrison,  Rebecca Walker, Sonia Sanchez, Esmeralda Santiago to name a few), my ancestors with their sacrifices – being audacious to live my dreams, while on this journey.

To quote Nayyirah Waheed, and become more: ‘always be the woman of my  dreams’ a vivid reality.

Thank you for being part of this process, and ahead of time for reading my statement until now.

Looking forward to sharing my experience and poetry along side you. 

Sincerely,

Fabiola Sandoval
