story:
The New House is a fictional paranormal romance novel, the first of two, set in modern day Old Town Santa Barbara.



"The New House

Chapter 01

Keith jumped as he woke from a dead sleep. He heard a noise that sounded like someone was crying or screaming. It was faint but loud enough to wake him. He looked around the dark room and saw nothing that would have made that sound. The clock said three AM. He wiped beads of sweat from his forehead and slowly laid his head back on the pillow. He heard the sound again, this time louder but not loud enough for him to make out where it was coming from or exactly what it was. He closed his eyes once again, as he pulled the covers up to his chin. It was oddly cold for August.

The noise rang out again. This time it was very loud and he listened closely. It sounded as though it was in his bedroom, but he knew no one could get past his alarm system. He began to tremble, could someone have broken in? He reached over to the night-stand, opened the drawer, removed a handgun and sat up on the edge of the bed. The light on the table was still on, so he searched the large room, again but could see no signs of an intruder. He got out of bed, still carrying his gun and walked into the master bathroom, flipping on the light on as his feet found the cold marble tile.

He continued to hear the noise. Could someone actually be in the house? After relieving himself, he returned to the bedroom. The small light on his night-stand cast a shadow on the walls that danced as he walked over to the window. He peered out at the street, which was pitch dark. There were no signs of life at any of his neighbors' houses."




This intriguing story combines a love story as well as a terrifying darkened abyss of an evil entity who craves a human soul.

Keith is an aging rock star, who is on the verge of a comeback. The final chapter in his professional career and his life. He has to make this one perfect in every way. For years, he fronted one of the largest rock bands in history, but he broke away to embark on a very successful solo career. Although he is a native of Los Angeles, he decides he needs a quiet place to write, some place where he can retire in peace. He chooses a prime piece of property in Old Town Santa Barbara and builds a sprawling mansion. Keith always enjoyed his visits to Santa Barbara. He was very pleased that he was able to walk around freely without any hassles from the fans. He knew that once the new album came out, he would be hounded wherever he was, except Old Town. The mostly older residents seemed more interested in keeping to themselves than to stalking a rock icon.

As soon as he moves into the house, he notices small, unexplained things. His keys would be moved or the lights would suddenly come on or go off. He would smell strange smells in the house and hear faint voices when no one was there. He thought them odd but he never believed in the supernatural, so he just ignored them. That is, until he could no longer ignore them.

Keith meets Sara. He is immediately drawn to her beauty and wit. Upon their first date, he learns that she moonlights as a ghost investigator and he mentions the unexplained things that were occurring in his home. Together they search for an answer to the unexplained happenings and what they unearth is truly terrifying and they are in a race against time to banish the evilness and save Keith’s soul.


Who’s the audience?

This novel can appeal to anyone who enjoys a good ghost and love story. It’s filled with mystery and intrigue that leaves the readers on the edge of their seat. This is truly a hard-to-put-down thriller.

The end will leave the reader wanting more, as the couple embarks the journey of a lifetime, as they battle evil and fall deeply in love.

Why the campaign?

I am raising money to help supplement the production costs of publishing this book.

• Artwork: For the cover.

• Professional editing: It is a must to have your work professional edited and flawless as you submit it to the publisher or agent.

• Marketing: There are a lot of free or low cost ways that I can use to market my novel (Social Media, for example), but many activities cost money, which includes creating signs, adding a website and many other marketing materials. I would use any extra money to travel around the country to promote the book at several different venues as well as hosting readings. If this book launch is successful, the revenue from its sales will enable me to cover the costs of producing the second book. By supporting this campaign, you are making an investment in my work and helping me get started on a new journey and a new chapter in my life.

Other ways you can help:

If you can't make a financial contribution but wish to support this campaign then “Like” my Facebook page (The New House) and share it on your social media pages.

story:
Native Israelites of the Americas


For over three thousand years wars have been fought, religions have been created, and nations and peoples have attempted to control the masses by misusing the writings of some of the most famous personages of history: the people known as the Israelites.

But through all of the conflict, lies, and passages of time, very few of those who descend from the conquering invaders hardly paused to ask themselves what happened to the descendants of the original peoples they know as the Israelites, and even fewer ever stopped to consider if what they had been been taught about these lands of the Americas and about the writings they've used to create their religions, was or is true or not.

  • Would you like to finally learn what the word "Bible" really means?
  • Would you like to learn the truth about the copper serpent and its true significance? That infamous "serpent" is connected to these ancient Americas, and to the peoples who are the true natives and owners of these lands, and the truth involves a lot more than serpents with wings and a name called Amaracu.
  • Would you like to know the real truth about Abel and Cain and the hidden details concerning Abel's death and Cain's "mark"?
  • Are you curious to know what is truly meant by the expression "The Apple of My Eye"?
  • Or did you know that the ancient Hebrew word for the moon is called the Sahn, and that many peoples of the past were actually worshipers of the moon and of the people who are called by that name?
  • Or perhaps you would like to know the truth about Joseph's multicolored coat?
  • This campaign was established to answer your questions and to tell you and others the truth about the so-called Bible and its writings, as well as provide insights on the descendants of the people who penned the pages of one of the most influential and controversial compilations in existence.

On the pages of this anthology you will discover the never-before-seen answers to these questions, and many more.

What You Get

One illustrated high quality paperback anthology containing long-waited-for explanations of ancient Israelite parables, prophecies, and explanations of symbolic language, plus an ancient Hebrew language bonus and an illustrated children's paperback. The price of the anthology ($28.00) covers shipping and handling to anywhere in the continental US.


Other Ways You Can Help

Purchase of this anthology will add a rare and valuable study-aid to your personal library, and please spread the word about it so others will have the chance to finally learn the long-hidden truths of the Bible and about the descendants of its authors.

When you spread the word about our campaign also consider using the Indiegogo share tools. We are very appreciative of your support. Thank you.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Nancy Stohlman, author of the flash fiction collection The Vixen Scream and Other Bible Stories (Pure Slush Press, 2014), the novels The Monster Opera (Bartleby Snopes Press, 2013),  and Searching for Suzi: a flash novel (Monkey Puzzle Press, 2009),  and four anthologies including Fast Forward: The Mix Tape  (Fast Forward Press, 2010) which was a finalist for a 2011 Colorado Book Award. I am the creator and curator of the Fbomb Flash Fiction Reading Series in Denver and one of my stories was recently called one of “our favorite recent pieces of flash fiction" by the Huffington Post. Yay! My official website

The Vixen Scream and Other Bible Stories (published by Pure Slush Press) is my my first solo flash fiction collection and also my calling card to spread Flash Fiction to new writers and new audiences.

This is the first time that I have had a publisher, Pure Slush Press, offer me the opportunity to join on a multi-city book tour including New York, Boston, Baltimore, San Francisco and Berlin! I will be finishing up as guest of the 6th annual Seattle Lit Crawl in October. Each one of these readings is an amazing opportunity for me to reach bigger audiences and expose more people to not only what I do but also the literary movement that is flash fiction.

Find out more about the Pure Slush Reading Tour

Find out more about the Seattle Lit Crawl


What I Need & What You Get

I'm raising the money for the travel expenses-plane tickets, lodging and meals/incidentals. 

(On that note, I am also quite open to donations of frequent flier miles as well!)

Independent publisher Pure Slush published my book The Vixen Scream and other Bible Stories in late 2014, and I will join other writers published by Pure Slush as the tour crosses the Atlantic and winds its way across the US. My final stop will be to join the 6th annual Seattle Lit Crawl in late October. In addition I have also been approached by promoters who are on board and excited to publicize the US dates and generate continuing interest and media coverage.

MY PROPOSED ITINERARY
August 1--

Berlin, Germany

August 29--Boston, MA

September 4--New York City, NY

September 11--

Baltimore, MD

September 26--

San Francisco, CA

October 22--

Seattle, WA 

Estimated travel, lodging, and meals (conservative)

Berlin--1500

Boston--600

NYC--600

Baltimore--600

San Francisco--600

Seattle--600

Promotion--500

If I don't reach my entire goal I will prioritize cities. I will go to as many cities as I can fund!

The Impact

I love indie publishers, and I have been publishing books with Indie Publishers since 2003--the only drawback is that funding for promotion and promotional events comes out of my own pocket. As you might recall, I have traveled and done readings for all my former books, and much of this has been on my own initiative and always on my own dollar.

Over the last 12 years I have traveled as much as my budget has allowed me, including New York, Chicago (twice), Portland (twice), Santa Fe, Minneapolis, Omaha, Salt Lake City, and the Aspen Lit Fest as a panelist, not to mention all along the front range. I donate as much of my time as possible because I believe in my work and want to expose it to the greatest audience possible.  Here I am reading in Santa Fe in January of this year:


Risks & Challenges

Stepping out and asking for support is always a risk, and I appreciate your consideration! That said, I will not buy plane tickets or make travel arrangements until I know how much is funded, so there will be no risk that I will receive monies and not show up. at promised events. I will keep everyone posted as the monies come in and as I secure travel plans. My biggest challenge is making sure I don't wait too long and pay higher than normal plane ticket fees, so that is why I am creating the campaign now!

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you have frequent flier miles? Hotel vouchers? I would be thrilled to accept these as donations as well.

Come and see me at any of these book tour dates! I would love to give you a hug.

And I would love your help in getting the word out and making some noise for me. You can use the awesome Indiegogo share tools on this page to post to your social media sites, websites, or emails. Thank you so much in advance!

story:
My name is Charise Flowers and I have been writing for over 20 years and have observed my writing styles evolve as I have matured. I learned to read and write at an early age... between age 4 and 6. I learned to love paper and stationary and utilize and accumulate lots of it!!

I believe I wrote my 1st poem at age 15 and continued to write sporatically during times of significant changes in my life. Good, bad, happy or sad I found writing to be a source of relief and release. I evolved from just brainstorming in a diary, to writing backwards so my mother couldnt understand it, to practicing writing metaphorical poetry.

I believe writing as well as listening to music is a sort of healing for the soul. If young people listened to more soulful music, kept diaries or journals more etc; I believe there would be a lot less "depressed teens" and/or teen suicides. 

I hope to envoke thought, creativity and enlightening thoughts of positivity and inspire more people to self expression through the writing of this book.

As this is my first time attempting to publish a book I am ver anxious about the process and success of it. I am hoping to raise enough funding to jumpstart the publication process and get my book into print.

Any dollar amount is greatly appreciated; the more the merrier... this fundraising goal is set to run for 60 days and I know this can be done! Every ounce of help marketing this project is appreciated. Please feel free to add the link your your social networking pages and websites!

Thank you for your support,

Charise M. Flowers & Marketing Team

story:
What it's about

I believe that we are in a war. Life is not a game, it's a series of battles that we must endure. But what is the best way to live life? I believe that living a lifestyle of love is imperative to not only surviving the war but winning it as well.

What I need & what you get

Now I am working hard and putting all my extra cash into this project but for me to get it done in a timely manner I need your help because of the amount of doctor bills I continue to face with my health problems. I'm asking you to support me by praying. I've lived long enough to know that I can't get through this life without the power of prayer. If you feel led I would greatly appreciate your financial support in this endeavor.


I will need an estimated $4000 just to start to cover the costs to pay for:

  • $2000 to pay my videographer for helping me with this fundraising video and then to cover the cost to shoot a high quality professional commercial to be shared on websites and hopefully even TV
  • $250 to cover the cost to buy two ISBN numbers, one for physical copy of the book and the other for E-book version
  • $1000 to pay my editor
  • $600 to help pay for rewards
  • $150 to ship rewards and distribute books

Anything above this $4000 will help pay for the cost to print books, and help me start a highly interactive website with videos for each chapter, ways to connect to important organizations, and other resources to help build community.
I've got loads of perks that you can take advantage of for supporting me. At every level you get the perks of the previous level.

    $5 or less thank you
    $10 free eBook
    $20 free physical copy of book
    $30 free spoken word sampler
    $50 free limited edition shirt
    $75 free poster
    $100 your full name in thank you section 
    $500 be in a promo video (must be local) 
    $1000 get the promo pack full of goodies
    $4000 I will come visit you wherever you are and take you and a friend out to a really nice restaurant

*If I can get this fully funded by the end of the campaign I am hoping to ship perks and books in time for Christmas, if not, the estimated ship date on perks will be late January/early February


What difference will this make?

This is the culmination of a year of hard work and all the prayers that have been said over my life. I truly believe that anyone who reads this book will be encouraged to be a better person, fight harder, and love God more. 

I know reading is something that people are doing less and less so I made sure to write shorter chapters with short sections to keep the book going fast paced. I've written this in a conversational style to make it easy to read for younger and older audiences.  I firmly believe that anyone can read this book and it will change their life. have a unique marketing strategy in mind to help get this in both physical and online bookstores as well as other avenues.

I totally understand if you can't give money. We all have a lot of bills, responsibilities, and things we are called to. Whether you can give or not, the only way I will be able to fulfill this campaign is by your help. So how can you help if you can't give?

  • Pray
  • Share this campaign on your favorite social media Indiegogo has their own share tools as well
  • Run down the streets frantically yelling at people, pleading for them to give...Ok, maybe don't do that, people might be a little freaked out by that.

story:
This is really a book for all of us and I need your help to complete it.  Please feel free to check it out at https://sites.google.com/site/52letters2mysons/. 

I began writing this book around the first of the year.  What I didn’t expect at the time was how God would use this process to speak to me in such dynamic and powerful ways.  It’s as if every time I sit down to write, God shows up and amazes me!  He takes control and writes through me and to me.  So many of the lessons I write about aren’t just lessons for my sons.  They’re lessons for me as well.  

From the very first day I realized these little “lessons” could be helpful for others, too.  As such, I began to share them via email with a small group of friends and colleagues.  That group of “readers” began to grow to the point that I eventually decided to develop a “blog” site (the website shown above) to get the letters out there.

Other than the desire to share these biblical principles and spiritual truths with my sons, it’s my sincere desire, my hope, to share these letters, these little life lessons, with others in order to point them to Christ and to help them as they live their lives.  Although I know in our world today there are numerous options for obtaining and reading (or even listening to) books electronically, I also realize there are certain circumstances where the actual hard copy is necessary. 

So, I’m moving forward with the completion of my book for those folks that might want, or need, a copy someday – folks that serve our country on foreign soil as soldiers, marines, sailors and aviators; folks that may not have the availability or the inclination to own a computer, a tablet or a cell phone; or folks that might find themselves in the unfortunate position of serving time in prison.  There are also a lot of us that just enjoy holding an actual book in our hands as we read it.  

Since I work full time in another profession and since I still need to maintain my responsibilities as a father and a husband, I’m only able to complete a letter every week or two.  It’s been a slow, yet rewarding, process.  My goal, though, is to finish the book this year, preferably by Thanksgiving.  However, after talking to some self-published authors, I’ve discovered that probably won’t happen given my current pace and all that needs to be done to edit the book, get it into the proper format and get it published.  What I’m hearing is that process often takes a lot longer than the time it takes just to write a book.  

That’s why the thought for this “campaign” came about.  I feel a sense of urgency to complete the book as soon as possible.  I think there are a lot of people out there in some of those “certain circumstances” I mentioned earlier that could benefit from reading this book sooner than later.  And I think I’ve come up with a plan to make that happen.  I just need your help.  If you’d be willing to join me in this effort by pre-purchasing the book and/or making a pledge for a larger contribution with additional perks, if I can reach the goal I’ve set, or, at least, get close to that goal, I can take some time off work to finish writing the book and get it published.  Please consider helping at one of the levels listed here.  

Thanks so much!

In Him,

Jerry

P.S. - Here are the links for some of the Perk items:

1) From the "Jam Session" Perk - www.walkingwaterband.com, www.afteredenband.com, and www.stevenybarra.com. 

2) From the Silver Level Supporter Perk - http://sarahwitenhafer.com/.

3) From the Gold Level Supporter Perk - https://sites.ggogle.com/site/drawdox/home and http://www.brianweavermusic.com.  (The link for Kyle's CD is the same as the one for the Walking Water Band above.  After Eden's website link is listed above as well.)

story:
Why this project?

The Other Mermaid is a funny fable about a prince, a witch & what happens when they get their wishes! By donating 20% of the sales to Seattle Children’s Psychiatry Unit we are shining a light on childhood mental illness, an issue too often kept secret and stigmatized.

Our goal is to raise acceptance, to end the isolation families experience because of this tragic disease, and to bring laughter to those children marginalized by the seriousness of it

 

Why pediatric psychiatry?

Childhood mental illness has directly impacted my family; first with my brother, and now with my only child. In a period of four months, my son went from the top 10% of his freshman class to bedridden and suicidal. We were shocked and devastated by this downfall.

I have seen, first-hand, how childhood mental illness consumes a family’s focus, how it isolates, how emotionally exhausting it is. Childhood mental illness causes an extra layer of conflict and tension, for it is easily dismissed by others – even from within the family – because the damage isn’t on the outside. It isn’t visible to the untrained eye, so that when a crisis erupts it is confusing and frightening. I've had friends abandon me due to the fear and stigmas still attached to the disease of mental illness.

I am compelled to change the world. Other families are hurting, other children are left behind. Childhood mental illness is not contagious. It’s nobody’s fault. It has nothing to do with ethics or morals or being a good person. It is simply a disease, like any other.

Volunteerism and philanthropy have been a part of my life since early childhood. I am deeply honored, humbled, and forever grateful to use the platform of The Other Mermaid for the greater good.

 

Why now?

I spent many years managing doctors, therapists, and endless crises. I supplemented part-time work with commission-based direct sales. I’d been in survival mode for so long that when asked what I did really well … well, I couldn’t remember. So, when a challenge arose from eWomenNetwork to do something uniquely me, I grabbed ahold of it like a lifeline.

That was nearly 8 months ago. Miraculously, The Other Mermaid was just sent to the printers!

 

How will this help others?

The easy answer is money:  20% of all profits go directly to the Psychiatry & Behavioral Medicine Unit of Seattle Children’s. Moreover, the long-term goal is to open a dialogue between the public, mental health professionals, and the families who live with this disease.

There was a time when blindness, autism, or Down syndrome was not brought up in general conversation, when those afflicted children were shunned or hidden or worse. Today, thankfully, the civilized world recognizes this as barbaric treatment. Childhood mental illness is no different. It is time to bring it to light.

 

Why a "funny fable"?

Bringing laughter to a serious conversation not only lessens anxiety, it also reminds us of why we fight for each day, each moment, and every memory. Life is good.

Storytelling has been a lifelong dream. From the first time a tale was read to me, I wanted to write my own stories. There are books in my head; it's time to set them free.

My favorite part of this journey has been taking The Other Mermaid to hospitals and sharing it with the kids. Shifting their focus – even for a minute – from the seriousness of their illness and allowing them be silly for a while, this is joyful.

By openly declaring this purpose on the book’s cover, we believe a conversation is started. It is our greatest hope that this will be only the beginning.

 

What are our future plans?

The Other Mermaid is the first book in a series. I am already working on book two, The Other Lily Pad, and have begun the outline for book three, The Other Slipper. All will be a part of the bigger project connected to pediatric psychiatry.

My amazing son is now 22 years old, and on disability. This project gives him hope and purpose, as he contributes to our family by helping with the multimedia. He has a wicked sense of humor; some of the best punch lines are his.

An offshoot of this project has blossomed into workshops with interned children so they can write their own imaginative tales! This incredible process has become so much bigger than my story. It has become Everyone’s story. It has brought joy, hope and a fuller meaning to my life. And it is my sincerest desire to bring that joy and hope to others.

 

How can YOU get involved?

Become part of this growing community! By sharing my story with others, you will encourage an open dialogue on childhood mental illness. By donating what you can, large or small, your generosity will ensure The Other Mermaid gets printed. Your money will promote the fall fundraiser at Seattle Children's, which in turn, will lay the groundwork for 'The Mermaid Guild', a non-profit launching at the hospital in the Spring of 2018. You are invited to help keep this conversation going; please, contact me directly if you would like to share your own story. I look forward to hearing from you.

Share this Project! Donate today!

 

 

How will your money be used?

 

$20,000. This is where your money will go.

Here are the basic estimations on how I will use your generosity to change lives.

 

Philanthropy – $4,000 (20%)

Twenty percent of net profit from book sales will go directly to the Pediatric Psychiatric Wing of Seattle Children’s. The initial $5,000 dollar donation (20% of the proposed campaign) will finance a book launch and fundraiser through the hospital.

Childhood mental health issues are too often ‘secret problems,’ frequently stigmatized by a moral construct, as if the parent—or worse, the child—has done something wrong to be afflicted. Seattle Children’s is leading the charge in changing this insidious misconception.

Our goal is to make the public more aware of this problem and help them become more accepting of those afflicted with childhood mental illness, to end the isolation families experience because of this tragic disease, and to bring laughter to those children marginalized by the seriousness of it.

 

Publishing – $12,500 (63%)

Publishing the book utilizes the lion’s share of the donation. A print run of 1,000 books, including bindery and shipping, has an estimated cost of $12,500.

 

Travel – $1,250 (6%)

The Other Mermaid will be debuted at the eWomenNetwork Conference in Dallas on August 3-5, 2017. The following 12 months will include speaking engagements and book signings in the western United States. The $2,500 expenditure will finance travel expenses, lodging, conference fees, and food.

 

Perks – $1,250 (6%)

You love getting perks and we love giving them! The printing and shipping of T-shirts, bookmarks, mousepads & high quality art prints will cost $2,500.

 

IndieGogo fees – $1,000 (5%)

Indiegogo charges a straight 4% of total funds raised. $1,000 is 5% of our stated goal.

 

~~~~~~~~~~

 

We thank you and Seattle Children’s Hospital thanks you. Without your help, this project could not happen.

Because of you, my lifelong dream of writing & illustrating children’s books becomes a reality. Because of your support, this mother’s purpose to bring awareness to pediatric mental illness gets a platform. And because of you and your generosity, the kids who face this illness daily have one more reason to smile. Donate now!

story:
I'm best-known for my two books on the lowbrow / pop surrealist art movement: WEIRDO DELUXE (2005) and WEIRDO NOIR (2010). Both have done very well and gotten great reviews. I love the "weirdo" books and the lowbrow art movement. I feel that lowbrow / pop surrealist art liberates our imagination and thinking. I hope my books do that for us too. (For more about me and my books, here's a link to my author's page on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Matt-Dukes-Jordan/e/B001K8B7R6 )

 

My current project — WEIRDO CARNIVAL WORLDWIDE (2013 - projected) — is intended to accomplish some things I haven't done in my previous two books on lowbrow / pop surrealist art. For one thing, I want to explore how lowbrow / pop surrealist art has become a worldwide phenomenon and why. I want to show how there are some local variations and place-specific cultural influences on the art, but also how there are underlying similarities worldwide. I'm also interested in highlighting the amazing draftsmanship of a lot of lowbrow artists — something I've done in a limited way in my other books, but want to do much more with this one. And — I'd like to explore in more depth the idea of the carnivalesque. The Russian critic Mikhail Bakhtin first wrote extensively about this, and his ideas seem to me to be a key to understanding the entire movement. Again, I've done this in my previous two books, but want to go further.

 

So, overall, this book will have longer essays in it than in my past books. I feel that the lowbrow/pop surrealist movement has been written about mostly in one might call a "journalistic" way, and even my past books were, admittedly, designed primarily for a general audience. I'd like to explore ideas, history, and the scope and impact of this kind of art in more depth. This almost seems like the job for a tenured professor on a sabbatical, but I have no such backing. On the other hand, I have, perhaps, more freedom. I can write to satisfy myself and my ideal audience.

 

I also plan to make some short videos and perhaps eventually a feature-length documentary on the material I cover in the book. I attended the San Francisco Art Institute in filmmaking, but also studied art history at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, and I have taken art classes at other colleges. I'd love to make a feature film someday, perhaps a film about lowbrow artists rushng around in custom cars on the streets of L.A. (Any takers? Note: I've written some screenplays, including one about some burlesque dancers and guys driving hot rods.) In the meantime, I've made some short films. You can see my short videos on youTube, Vimeo, and Funny or Die. One short video on Robert Williams is pretty popular. ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K-XjcE4vd0I ) Miami street art and Bukowski have been subjects, but I've also make videos about farting. Anything that makes me laugh makes me happy.

 

Back to the subject of the writing of the book. There are many people who are writing about this art movement, but I feel that I'm well qualified for a number of reasons. I love humor and quirky, transgressive, subversive, indie-style art, whether a film by Jim Jarmusch featuring Steve Buscemi or a painting by Glenn Barr spoofing the Betty Rubble of the TV show "The Flintstones." Most humor is based on some kind of reversal of expectations, and that tends to make us think of alternatives and step outside of the predictable and ordinary — thus much humor is, to some extent, subversive or transgressive. I think that my love of humor is a significant part of why the whole lowbrow / pop surrealist art movement appeals to me so much. I also love cartoons, animation, and comics, and drawing.

 

Here's a little more about my qualifications. I taught the first-ever class on lowbrow art history at the college level at Otis College of Art and Design in L.A. I've shown art in galleries in L.A., New Orleans, Miami, and Key West. I've published well over 1,000 articles and been a full-time staff journalist on a newspaper. My book about Charles Bukowski (a guy with a great sense of humor) called BUKOWSKI'S LA (2008) has been enjoyed by many Bukowski fans.

 

The book I'm planning now will be bigger and, I hope, better than the ones I've done before. It's financially difficult to create a book like this on my own. I had help from friends and family with my last three books, and I had the support of a major publisher on the two WEIRDO books. Chronicle Books generously provided an advance which helped with my cost of living while I wrote the books and they did the design work and supplied an expert copy editor to edit the book — and a project editor to offer support with the overall process of creating the books. They gave me considerable creative freedom so the key elements of the books were what I had in mind. Yet the wonderful people at Chronicle created an environment of support and encouragement that was very helpful at every stage of the creation, publication, and promotion of those books.

 

Funding for WEIRDO CARNIVAL WORLDWIDE will help me with the book in the following areas:

 

Research — This involves a lot of legwork and if I had an assistant, that would be awesome. Perhaps I can employ a few people in different roles, even part time, on this book.

Writing — This takes time, but the right equipment helps too. My last laptop finally fell apart: some of the the keys literally broke off the keyboard and other features of the computer failed.

Production work — All work related to gathering materials (like photos) and formatting the book for publication is a considerable effort. 

Design — I'd love to hire a designer, though I did, long ago, work in book publishing and designed some books. (But I know some book designers who could use some work and would do a great job.)

Publication support — This book will be a print-on-demand book just like BUKOWSKI'S LA, but there are costs involved in moving the book from manuscript to finished books.

Promotion support — Getting the word out is a big job! What a dream to imagine hiring even a part-time publicist! (Chronicle had great people on their staff for this.)

 

Funding will help with the videos as well, and in the same areas (with the exception of "publication"). Replacing outdated equipment would be a welcome luxury.

 

With more funds, I can be more ambitious and productive in all the areas listed!

 

I hope you find the idea of another cool "weirdo" book exciting. Your help is much appreciated.

 

PERKS

 

As for the perks, I'll thank everyone who contributes right in the book itself. I'll also be e-mailing everyone a newsletter every few months about progress on the book and videos.

 

Books are great perks! At the 25-dollar level of support, I offer the option of picking one of my books (either WEIRDO DELUXE or WEIRDO CARNIVAL WORLDWIDE), or if you help a bit more, you get both!

 

As you move up in helping out with this project, art is available as perks along with the books! My art is evolving. I have done literally thousands of fast sketches over the years. I've been painting on and off for many years. In 2001, I showed at the superb Lucky Street Gallery in Key West under the name of R. Mutt — wooden constructions of various kinds. I've show at Barrister's Gallery in New Orleans in a show of feminist art. I've been a regular at Hyaena Gallery in Los Angeles for years. I also showed at Monkey House Toys in Los Angeles. And I've had a couple of brief pop-up shows at Harold Golen Gallery in Miami when I was there to lecture on lowbrow / pop surrealism.

 

So— my art is fun, funny, and somewhat "outsider" in nature. I will soon provide a link to my own art site, but for now you can see examples of my art on the Hyaena Gallery website, here:

 

http://www.hyaenagallery.com/mattdukesjordansold.html

 

I will be making new cool art as perks for this book! If you like the style of some of the work you see on the Hyaena site, I can work in that style. Lately, I've been doing more work on paper but also doing more blending and shading of figures. But as you can see, the heart of my art is drawing and cartooning!

 

A big way to help this book and video project is to share links to it and let people know about it!!

 

Hope to be in touch with you and be a partner in the book.
story_txt:
I'm best-known for my two books on the lowbrow / pop surrealist art movement: WEIRDO DELUXE (2005) and WEIRDO NOIR (2010). Both have done very well and gotten great reviews. I love the "weirdo" books and the lowbrow art movement. I feel that lowbrow / pop surrealist art liberates our imagination and thinking. I hope my books do that for us too. (For more about me and my books, here's a link to my author's page on Amazon: http://www.amazon.com/Matt-Dukes-Jordan/e/B001K8B7R6 )
 
My current project — WEIRDO CARNIVAL WORLDWIDE (2013 - projected) — is intended to accomplish some things I haven't done in my previous two books on lowbrow / pop surrealist art. For one thing, I want to explore how lowbrow / pop surrealist art has become a worldwide phenomenon and why. I want to show how there are some local variations and place-specific cultural influences on the art, but also how there are underlying similarities worldwide. I'm also interested in highlighting the amazing draftsmanship of a lot of lowbrow artists — something I've done in a limited way in my other books, but want to do much more with this one. And — I'd like to explore in more depth the idea of the carnivalesque. The Russian critic Mikhail Bakhtin first wrote extensively about this, and his ideas seem to me to be a key to understanding the entire movement. Again, I've done this in my previous two books, but want to go further.
 
So, overall, this book will have longer essays in it than in my past books. I feel that the lowbrow/pop surrealist movement has been written about mostly in one might call a "journalistic" way, and even my past books were, admittedly, designed primarily for a general audience. I'd like to explore ideas, history, and the scope and impact of this kind of art in more depth. This almost seems like the job for a tenured professor on a sabbatical, but I have no such backing. On the other hand, I have, perhaps, more freedom. I can write to satisfy myself and my ideal audience.
 
I also plan to make some short videos and perhaps eventually a feature-length documentary on the material I cover in the book. I attended the San Francisco Art Institute in filmmaking, but also studied art history at the University of Wisconsin, Madison, and I have taken art classes at other colleges. I'd love to make a feature film someday, perhaps a film about lowbrow artists rushng around in custom cars on the streets of L.A. (Any takers? Note: I've written some screenplays, including one about some burlesque dancers and guys driving hot rods.) In the meantime, I've made some short films. You can see my short videos on youTube, Vimeo, and Funny or Die. One short video on Robert Williams is pretty popular. ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K-XjcE4vd0I ) Miami street art and Bukowski have been subjects, but I've also make videos about farting. Anything that makes me laugh makes me happy.
 
Back to the subject of the writing of the book. There are many people who are writing about this art movement, but I feel that I'm well qualified for a number of reasons. I love humor and quirky, transgressive, subversive, indie-style art, whether a film by Jim Jarmusch featuring Steve Buscemi or a painting by Glenn Barr spoofing the Betty Rubble of the TV show "The Flintstones." Most humor is based on some kind of reversal of expectations, and that tends to make us think of alternatives and step outside of the predictable and ordinary — thus much humor is, to some extent, subversive or transgressive. I think that my love of humor is a significant part of why the whole lowbrow / pop surrealist art movement appeals to me so much. I also love cartoons, animation, and comics, and drawing.

I've shown art in galleries in L.A., New Orleans, Miami, and Key West. I've published well over 1,000 articles and been a full-time staff journalist on a newspaper. My book about Charles Bukowski (a guy with a great sense of humor) called BUKOWSKI'S LA (2008) has been enjoyed by many Bukowski fans.

story:
Misty’s Fight


I don’t think that Hollywood could have come up with a better story than that of Misty and I.  As many of you know, I went through a long, bitter divorce that was final in 2005.  Since then, I had relationships that all failed in one way or another – most ended in train wrecks!  I had just about given up on finding a relationship that would make me happy.  Then Misty came into my life.

I’ve known Misty for over 10 years.  She had been a friend, and I never saw her as more than that.  She had her share of issues that she went through, and about three years ago, we decided to date.  It was fantastic, as I saw that she was an amazing woman, and she made me very happy.  However, between her three kids (ages 7-15), my two (14 & 18), my business, and all the things that life throws in our paths, we never seemed to have any time for “us”.  We stopped trying, and drifted apart.  Then, back in late November 2012, she called me to see what I was up to.  We started talking and soon we were dating, as if no time had slipped by.  We “clicked” at once.  She made me feel very comfortable and happy, without even trying.  All the cares of the world slipped away when I was with her.

  I did not know I was going to marry her at the time, but I knew she was special, and I knew I wanted her to be a part of my life, so in early March, I brought her to meet my parents.  While there, she started to have lower back pain.  She called her doctor, who thought it was kidney stones.  He prescribed some medication that was supposed to dissolve them, but after a week, she was still in intense pain.  He brought her in for an examination, and instead of kidney stones, he found abnormal tissue.  A biopsy was done, and they started her on interferon before the results even came back.  She has Renal Cell Carcinoma, kidney cancer.

 This was the absolute worst time for this to happen.  Misty has no insurance, and my divorce, and the subsequent economic downturn, left me with few assets – my building and home are worth less than the mortgages (as with most of America).  I have a small CPA practice, and have always believed in charging what I feel is a fair price, and I have always done business with a handshake.  That has come to sting me in this economy as well.  I have had several clients close or go out of business owing me thousands of dollars. 

The doctors were going to remove her cancerous kidney.  While she was in the hospital for some pre-surgical testing, the doctors discovered that her cancer had spread to her liver, and that she was Stage 4.  Her numbers were too high for the doctors to remove her kidney.  Misty was immediately started on an aggressive chemo and fusion program, with the goal of encapsulating the kidney, and getting her levels low enough for them to remove the kidney. 

Soon after, my son, Misty and I went to Texas Roadhouse, my son’s favorite restaurant, for dinner.  I had talked to my son first, and he was excited.  As we were waiting for dinner, I pulled out a ring and proposed to Misty.  She was in total shock, but she said yes!  That alone made me the luckiest guy in the world!  No one should go through a fight like this alone, and I knew I loved Misty, and wanted to have her in my life for as long as she had, which I prayed was 50 or more years!  We were married a few weeks later.

On Friday, June 7, 2013, the doctors told us that in spite of the aggressive chemo, her levels were not dropping fast enough.  Misty had about two months left, unless she went through some expensive treatments.  Until you have been through it, you don’t know how it feels to hear that your wife, the one that you love so much and makes you so happy, has such a short time left.  It tore my heart right out!  I told the doctor we would do the shots.  The shots were very expensive (almost $14,000 per round of four shots, she needed three rounds) and they were extremely painful, and made her very sick.  We came up with the funds, with the help of some family members.  She took the shots once a week, on Friday, and was sick until the following Tuesday.  She continued with the daily chemo and fusion treatments even through the shots.  In the end, her levels dropped significantly.  The shots were well worth the cost!

Since the final shots, however, there has been one complication after another that has delayed removing the cancerous kidney.  First, she had an infection that delayed it a couple weeks.  Because of the daily chemo, her immune system is almost destroyed, so she is very susceptible to infections and illnesses.  Then the ports in her abdomen (two tubes through which they give her chemo) failed a couple times and had to be replaced.  Then they got infected.

In early December, we got another scare.  Her neck started hurting, and she developed two large bumps on the side of her neck.  At a meeting with the doctor, he told us that the bumps were her lymph glands, and they were inflamed.  He said it was one of two reasons – either she was fighting an infection or virus, or that the cancer had spread to her neck.  Since cancer usually spreads from organ to organ, if the cancer had spread from her kidney and liver all the way to her neck, she was probably full of cancer, and there would not be much that they could do.  He prescribed some powerful antibiotics, and gave her five days to see improvement before he biopsied the lymph glands.  The next day, Sunday, I was out with my son, and she was visiting relatives, when I got a call from a number I did not recognize.  It was my wife, calling from a local hospital’s ER!  I flew out there, and found her holding an ice pack to her neck.  She handed me the clip board with the papers showing her diagnosis.  It said “Severe shingles”.  I yelled “Thank God!”  The doctor came in and said it was the first time he had heard someone happy with a shingles diagnosis, as it was such a painful disease.  I told him I was not happy with what it was, I was grateful for what it wasn’t.  If it was shingles, that means it was not cancer!

The shingles regime took many weeks to clear up, then her port had an infection, which brings her to where we are now. Her levels have been going up, which is not good.  Last Tuesday, the doctor told her she needed another round of those very expensive shot treatments.  She responded so well to the first set, he feels that another round or two of them will bring her levels back down to the point where they can remove her kidney.  She told the doctor we could not afford another round of shots, what were her alternatives.  He said if we did not get the shots, they would keep her comfortable for however long she has left, which he says is about six months.

I am not ready to give up on her!  I love her, she is my life!  She is young, she has three kids that need her, and my son needs her too! I need her!  I will not give up without a fight.  She has been a fighter so far, she has been fantastic!  She has gone through unbelievable pain and sickness, and is still willing to fight!  I need help with this fight.  We need to raise enough for her to have the one, possibly two more rounds of these shots.  The doctors feel that with them, she has a good chance of survival.  Without them, she does not.

So I am asking your help!  Please donate whatever you can!  I have set the goal low on these fundraising websites to ensure that we reach our goal.  I am hoping to raise over $30,000 so that she can get the shots she needs to survive.  The doctors say at least one series, last time it took three.  You will forever have our grateful thanks!

story:
Underdog Revolution is advocacy for underdogs and underserved communities around the world. It’s also a call for large aid organizations and decision-makers to redefine innovation and social change. It argues for a world where underdogs and underserved communities are not seen as a burden, rather an untapped opportunity. In writing this book, I aim to invite the world to see us (the poor), the (undeserved) as co-creators, co-researchers, co-leaders, and not as data providers nor as a laboratory only for scientific study on poverty. Underdog Revolution is filled with examples and stories of local innovators who are moving the human race forward in the dark. My book will publish in April of 2020, just before my 31st birthday, so as it’s in my "bucket list", I will be a Published published Author at 30. :-)
 

This is just a Mockup, you will help me choose my real book cover

Story of My Book


Underdog Revolution is a new lens through which we can see poverty, innovation, and social change if we want to empower the 3.5 billion people living at the bottom of the pyramid.

My name is Pierre Stanley Baptiste and I am the author of "Underdog Revolution".

I hope in reading this book, you will discover how to empower underdogs in your immediate circle and unleash innovation at the bottom of the pyramid. Much like in the story of David and Goliath. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the non-obvious winners (the David's of the world who can beat Goliath ) in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you recognize your underdogs' bias, do better charity work, a guide to discover tools and ways to enact social change that put the human at the center of the change you want to make, and overall how to apply underdog revolution in schools, churches, entrepreneurship and in your own life.

In this book, you'll learn about the link between creativity and scarcity, the reason why the top-down approach to innovation is wrong and discover how and why we need a new type of innovation if we want the 3.5 billion people living at the base of the pyramid (BOP) to thrive.

Did you know there are specific circumstances in which we support underdogs and most of them have little to do with the underdogs? Through the underdog revolution, you will learn the psychological reasons, bias, and fallacies that push us to support the underdog.

Based on my experiences working with underdogs and underserved communities in Haiti for the past 9 years, I offer you some practical ideas on how to even the playing field to allow underserved communities to thrive. Did you know Haiti doesn’t have access to Paypal and Stripe?

You will learn about the story of a man who spends two decades of his life cutting a path through a mountain. Stories of amazing leaders/changemakers such as Guerrier Hovard, Louino Robillard, Daniel Tilias, Katherine Hoke, Daquan Olivier, Nzingah Oniwosan and many more will inspire you and teach you about willpower, effort, the value of mentoring, giving back and the power of seeing what others cannot see.

You will love this book if you are interested in transforming lives at the bottom of the pyramid, if you want to see underserved communities and underdogs in a new light and if you actively looking for new ways to engage the people you seek to serve.

Underdog Revolution is a non-fiction book that speaks to international aid agencies’ experts, community leaders and any individuals who are interested in poverty alleviation, social change, innovation and who want to empower those who are seemed at a disadvantage.

 

The Book - Underdog Innovation

This book follows the three-act structure as in the War Of Art of Steven Pressfield. Each part brings you on this different adventure while staying consistent with the general theme.

Part 1
How does the first black nation in the world become the poorest country in the western hemisphere? Section 1 starts with a story dear to my heart and that most convey the revolution carried by underdogs.

I also map out the advantages and challenges of the bottom of the pyramid, tackle the limitations of the top-down innovation approach and the value of creative constraints using scientific evidence and my personal story on how I manage to open Impact Hub Port-au-Prince with only 20% of the budget, without employees and with all the challenges that came with it. You will also learn about some new concepts such as "toolbox fallacy: and the "savior complex".

Part 2
How what was once a gang-infested neighborhood is creating change for a whole country and region? Part two dives into this great social change started at a community level and is carried by underdogs. You will also learn about some new ways to drive innovation, do research and create companies take the human element into account. You will learn about the power of second chance through an organization that’s empowering ex-criminals to become an entrepreneur and how some of them are thriving. I share personal ideas on how to turn ghettos into innovation lab and different types of labs we could set up in underserved communities to bring forth local innovation. The underdog advantage, the 7 strengths of an underdog.


Part 3
In part 3 I talk about the path forward and how we can build a better world through the bottom-up innovation approach. The steps (based on my experiences and research) to unleash innovation at the bottom of the pyramid and to replicate stories of creative-problem-solving, like the boy who harnessed the wind whom I met in 2014. You learn about scientific evidence about the correlation between GDP growth and inequality. You will also learn how the balance of these 3 elements environment, resource and pressure can make or break an underdog. Sprinkled with more than a dozen inspiring stories of individuals and organizations, part 3 paints the way forward on how to replicate underdog revolution in different types of organizations and how I envision a future when underserved communities and underdogs are empowered to solve their problems and to inspire more people to create change.

 

How you can help me in this journey

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this coming spring

  • My travels and lodging for the book signing event.

About the Author

StartingBloc fellow and Honorary Citizen of Wausau, Pierre Stanley Baptiste dances at the crossroads of unrealistic aspirations, creativity, and social impact. Pierre has a breadth of experience in public speaking, social entrepreneurship, and social media. He also has a not-so-secret love affair with writing, coffee, cooking, hiking, and red wine.

He was named among the 10 Haitians (Social Influencers) to follow on the web and also received the Haiti Numerique Youth Technology Leadership Award of Excellence in 2017. Pierre is currently the co-founder & managing director of Impact Hub Port-au-Prince, a local hub with a global community of more than 16,000 members.

As a Clinton Global Initiative University Fellow, Pierre founded Impact Ayiti, an initiative that teaches entrepreneurship to disadvantaged high school students in Haiti and has received a Volunteer Award from President Obama for his volunteer work in the United States.

It all started on the Sunday of June 7, 1998, when I read a passage of the bible for my first communion day celebration. They had to put two bricks under my feet so people could see my face reading. This moment became a determining factor in my life. I was 8 years old.

After I finished reading, something strange happened; the church gave me a standing ovation. At that very moment, something in me was born and I knew I had a special gift to share with the world. Since that Sunday, I never stopped on my quest to become a better human being and to improve my surroundings.

This passion for bettering myself and people around me led to teaching, creative writing, blogging, podcasting, social entrepreneurship, personal development, philosophy, technology, event designing, and youth empowerment.

In 2014 I launched my personal blog pierrestanleybaptiste.com to share 20% of information that can have the highest impact on someone’s life. My contents were in English, but In 2016 I felt the urge to communicate with my community. So, I started writing in Haitian Creole for the very first time. People who speak creole in a professional setting are seen as non-educated while it’s the language of the majority. As of today, I have published over 100 blog posts on productivity, cognitive biases, learning techniques, branding, tech and other topics around professional development. My blog has become a reference and learning platform for dozens of young Haitians looking to better themselves.

 

My love for writing led me to write for the HuffingtonPost (English is my 3rd language), Pursuit and self-published my books. In December 2016, I published REVEY (ebook) to help people wake the genie up and discover the work they were born to do. In 2017, my second ebook KALIFYE came out. Kalifye introduces young people to 107 free digital tools they can use to create, learn and find a better for their smartphones and computers. This book is a direct response to the telecommunication companies in Haiti promoting the internet as a tool for social media use only. In this book, I opened readers' eyes to the endless possibilities the internet offers.

I desperately want to leave a legacy of helping the weakest ones thrive whether it means raising money to help 200 farmers after Hurricane Matthew, providing school supplies to over 2000 students as well as developing an entrepreneurship education program for disadvantaged high school students.

In 2016 after a hard break up and a depression, I purchased a one-way ticket to go to the USA and to never come back to Haiti. Little did I know, this trip would lead to the biggest project I have undertaken in my entire life. After spending 3 months in the US, I decided to come back to launch Impact Hub Port-au-Prince, the first local hub and co-working space in Haiti with a global imprint.

As part of our programs, we recently hosted the 4th edition of StartupWeek, the largest and most inclusive entrepreneurial event in Port-au-Prince, welcoming more than 1500 attendees, 65 speakers, and 50 volunteers. Our space has become a community where coders, leaders, creators, designers meet, network and create amazing ventures with the aim to make a social impact.

Now, I am working on the first Haitian Creole media platform for entrepreneurs, a co-creating space to creative professionals, and this book which has been in my mind for 7 years. My larger vision can be summarized in three simple words “Empowering Non-obvious Winners”. I hope to be able to live to that aspiration.

spierrejb@gmail.com
LinkedIn | Twitter | Instagram | Facebook

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

3 Other Ways You Can Help

You can still be part of the journey if you cannot contribute to the campaign.

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #UnderdogRevolution and tag me @pierresbaptiste as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Underdog Revolution is advocacy for underdogs and underserved communities around the world. It’s also a call for large aid organizations and decision-makers to redefine innovation and social change. It argues for a world where underdogs and underserved communities are not seen as a burden, rather an untapped opportunity. In writing this book, I aim to invite the world to see us (the poor), the (undeserved) as co-creators, co-researchers, co-leaders, and not as data providers nor as a laboratory only for scientific study on poverty. Underdog Revolution is filled with examples and stories of local innovators who are moving the human race forward in the dark. My book will publish in April of 2020, just before my 31st birthday, so as it’s in my "bucket list", I will be a Published published Author at 30. :-)
 

This is just a Mockup, you will help me choose my real book cover
Story of My Book
Underdog Revolution is a new lens through which we can see poverty, innovation, and social change if we want to empower the 3.5 billion people living at the bottom of the pyramid.
My name is Pierre Stanley Baptiste and I am the author of "Underdog Revolution".
I hope in reading this book, you will discover how to empower underdogs in your immediate circle and unleash innovation at the bottom of the pyramid. Much like in the story of David and Goliath. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the non-obvious winners (the David's of the world who can beat Goliath ) in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you recognize your underdogs' bias, do better charity work, a guide to discover tools and ways to enact social change that put the human at the center of the change you want to make, and overall how to apply underdog revolution in schools, churches, entrepreneurship and in your own life.
In this book, you'll learn about the link between creativity and scarcity, the reason why the top-down approach to innovation is wrong and discover how and why we need a new type of innovation if we want the 3.5 billion people living at the base of the pyramid (BOP) to thrive.
Did you know there are specific circumstances in which we support underdogs and most of them have little to do with the underdogs? Through the underdog revolution, you will learn the psychological reasons, bias, and fallacies that push us to support the underdog.
Based on my experiences working with underdogs and underserved communities in Haiti for the past 9 years, I offer you some practical ideas on how to even the playing field to allow underserved communities to thrive. Did you know Haiti doesn’t have access to Paypal and Stripe?
You will learn about the story of a man who spends two decades of his life cutting a path through a mountain. Stories of amazing leaders/changemakers such as Guerrier Hovard, Louino Robillard, Daniel Tilias, Katherine Hoke, Daquan Olivier, Nzingah Oniwosan and many more will inspire you and teach you about willpower, effort, the value of mentoring, giving back and the power of seeing what others cannot see.
You will love this book if you are interested in transforming lives at the bottom of the pyramid, if you want to see underserved communities and underdogs in a new light and if you actively looking for new ways to engage the people you seek to serve.
Underdog Revolution is a non-fiction book that speaks to international aid agencies’ experts, community leaders and any individuals who are interested in poverty alleviation, social change, innovation and who want to empower those who are seemed at a disadvantage.
 
The Book - Underdog Innovation
This book follows the three-act structure as in the War Of Art of Steven Pressfield. Each part brings you on this different adventure while staying consistent with the general theme.
Part 1How does the first black nation in the world become the poorest country in the western hemisphere? Section 1 starts with a story dear to my heart and that most convey the revolution carried by underdogs.
I also map out the advantages and challenges of the bottom of the pyramid, tackle the limitations of the top-down innovation approach and the value of creative constraints using scientific evidence and my personal story on how I manage to open Impact Hub Port-au-Prince with only 20% of the budget, without employees and with all the challenges that came with it. You will also learn about some new concepts such as "toolbox fallacy: and the "savior complex".
Part 2How what was once a gang-infested neighborhood is creating change for a whole country and region? Part two dives into this great social change started at a community level and is carried by underdogs. You will also learn about some new ways to drive innovation, do research and create companies take the human element into account. You will learn about the power of second chance through an organization that’s empowering ex-criminals to become an entrepreneur and how some of them are thriving. I share personal ideas on how to turn ghettos into innovation lab and different types of labs we could set up in underserved communities to bring forth local innovation. The underdog advantage, the 7 strengths of an underdog.
Part 3In part 3 I talk about the path forward and how we can build a better world through the bottom-up innovation approach. The steps (based on my experiences and research) to unleash innovation at the bottom of the pyramid and to replicate stories of creative-problem-solving, like the boy who harnessed the wind whom I met in 2014. Sprinkled with more than a dozen inspiring stories of individuals and organizations, part 3 paints the way forward on how to replicate underdog revolution in different types of organizations and how I envision a future when underserved communities and underdogs are empowered to solve their problems and to inspire more people to create change.

I am trying to get my book "The Powered" self-published. 

The book is about the first person in the world with a super power. 

The book is a coming of age story of Gavin Daniels who on his 15th birthday develops a power. He soon learns that his power is meant to find others with powers. 

What does this mean for Gavin, the government, and the world! 

Gavin's best friend Nate will be by his side at the way, no matter what comes. 

 

Please watch the video and if you have any questions PLEASE feel free to e-mail me

story:
A Gen Z 2020 - Girlboss, Gatekeep, Gaslight

A Gen Z 2020 is the riveting tale of a curious girl who falls victim to existentialism and the charm of Chad from Sigma Apple Pie. 

My name is Olivia Stevermer and I am the author of A Gen Z 2020. I worked with older adult writers who were interested in my generation’s line of thinking and believed there needs to be accounts of 2020 from all perspectives.

You will love this book if you are a Gen Z between the ages of 16-23; a lover of coming of age novels; or a parent interested in learning more about their Gen Z children. 

A Gen Z 2020 speaks to Gen Z and their parents who want to grapple with coming of age and college in a new way, through funny and relatable anecdotes from my life during a global pandemic. 

Ultimately, I hope that A Gen Z 2020 inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • What is the relationship between hyperawareness and insignificance? 
  • How does Gen Z operate on a less statistical level? 
  • What do Gen Z’s habits mean for the future? 

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers!

What We Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish and a handwritten thank-you note.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and some excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Olivia Stevermer is a rising junior at Washington University in St. Louis, she worked on the Cori Bush Campaign and ran a small apparel business during the pandemic. 

Olivia worked with a group of older adult writers who were very intrigued by her Gen Z perspective. She hopes to provide that insight and show what it’s like to be a college student during the pandemic. 

She watched Hannah Montana when she was younger and convinced herself that she was meant to be a star, which heavily influenced her to write a memoir at nineteen. 

For more information, you can connect with Olivia Stevermer at ostever123@gmail.com, @olivia.stevermer on Instagram, and @oliviastevermer on TikTok.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please do the following:
  • Identify the perk that interests you, e.g. 1 or 2 paperbacks
  • Select the pink "Back it" button to "Make a contribution" for the same amount (this choice bypasses the shipping address page)
  • Use this form to share your mailing address, so I can calculate the international shipping costs and invoice you for that amount via PayPal/Venmo

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can support, but that doesn't mean you can't get something out of it!
I will reward the top 3 people who refer the most backers at the end of the campaign (30 days). Here's how:

At the top of the campaign page, you will see the "share" buttons. Click on the "chain" icon to get a custom link just for you. (Note: don't use the URL in the browser window as it won't work to track referrals and you won't get credit ?)

Copy that link and paste it on your social media, email it to a friend, or text a fellow book lover.

When someone clicks on that link and backs the book, you get 1 entry! 

Please use #girlboss111 and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts!
Tag: 
Instragram - olivia.stevermer / @newdegreepress

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Olivia Stevermer

story:
Hi, we’re sharing details about an enthralling new book by author Larry Alexander. Larry’s narrative shares the passion of a heart-wrenching, real-life missed romantic encounter; in his experience, a genuine and incredible love at first site episode.

This is why Larry is seeking your financial support and your good wishes to help publish his new work, and yes, Larry is seeking your help in finding his lost Princess.  She is the muse who stirred this beautiful project. The sub title of Larry’s book, “Can You Help Me Find Her?” is a genuine, almost fairytale like, plea for crowdsourced help in locating his long lost princess.

The script shares the story of an astonishing love at first sight episode, an event that ultimately unfolded as a missed romantic encounter. The work will no doubt capture the hearts, the minds, and the imagination of every soul who’s ever wished for or experienced a true love encounter.

The effortless but captivating read documents the incredible phenomenon with the voice of an, “I lived this event,” authority, and follows with the exact same sentiment in possibly the most passionate and compelling seven-to-nine line poetry ever composed for a missed romantic encounter.

The transition from prose to poetry is seamless but is awaited with anticipation. Few will read the pages of this unique story or drink in the contemporary heart drops (the matchless poetry) contained therein and not reciprocate gratitude with tears.

Join Larry in this earnest, heart warming, thirty-five year old search for his mystical princess. Help him overcome the anxiety of isolation; help him quench his many sweet and ardent hopes, his darling dreams, and his heartfelt wishes. Help him find a positive end and closure for both he and his princess.

The book launch will feature a strategy never before attempted in the field of publishing; a real time, live, internet search game and a world wide Hash Tag campaign designed to find his princess.

The marvelous and magical event portrayed in this spellbinding book occurred at the Texas Renaissance Festival, located in Todd Mission, Texas. The Texas Renaissance Festival is co-marketing this publication and the book launch. The book signing will take place at the faire on opening day, October 11, 2014, during the 40th anniversary celebration of the festival.

Sixty Ways to Lament, Cherish and Glorify a Lost Princess, Can You Help Me Find Her? is of coffee table quality. The book measures approximately 8 1/2” by 14”, has just over one hundred pages and features an attractive full color Olde English themed hard cover.

Please support this deserving campaign with a generous financial investment and by sharing awareness among your family members and friends.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Missed romantic connections occur every day at the Texas Renaissance Festival. The romantic and magical ambience here “The Kingdom” lends itself to numinous flights of the imagination and opens one’s being up to enchanting possibilities.

But I was astonished when I learned of the Sixty Ways, Princess encounter, and the authors thirty-five search to reconnect with the girl of his dreams.

Never before has a story been told with such passion and sincerity. Larry’s honesty in sharing a deeply personal experience is incredible. Interspersed among his delights and his expectations, raw emotion reveals his pain and lamentation.

The chronicle is heartwarming and heartbreaking. It’s the kind of story that invades your being, absorbs your psyche, touches your very soul, and becomes your own personal experience.

Live this uncanny, but breathtaking event with Larry as he narrates his precious recall in candid prose and poignant poetic verses.

                                                                                     Cory Brock

                                                                                     Director of Marketing

                                                                                     The Texas Renaissance Festival 

Budget:

Web Site:  Construction, maintenance, and hosting (one year)  $1,400.00

Book:  Printing, binding, freight, and e-book formats:

Initial 250 hard copies, thank you gifts and pre-launch orders.    4,740.00

Production:  Video trailers, audio tags for Renaissance Festival   

radio and TV spots, CD of selected poetry, and t-shirts

to be used as thank you gifts.      2,200.00

Marketing:  Audio tags for Renaissance Festival radio and TV spots,

live tags on NPR (Publicity for book launch/signing

  during the 40th anniversary celebration of the Texas 

  Renaissance Festival), and thank you gifts to facilitate the

  princess search game.        2,300.00

Reserve:  To secure regular print on demand orders, to finance buy back

contract with national book sellers, and other contingencies.    4,300.00

Total Budget:   $ 14,940.00
