obsession over the years.  It is a love that has never faded, and perhaps has only become stronger with time. I started writing "Hunger" in 2006, completely out of the blue (I hadn't written much of anything since my 20s).  My main character Kain just popped right into my head and I knew I would be writing a romance story about him.  Then came Autumn, his love interest, though she wasn't as strong as Kain was at first.  I struggled with their story, writing about eight poorly written chapters with no real plot.  I would become discouraged with it and file the story away, only to come back to it another year and refine it some, then shelve it again.  I never had even half a story or a real plot for years, until January 2014 when the story suddenly came to me, fully formed, with all of its characters and plot, all of its subplots and antagonists.  It was literally "downloaded" into me.  I have no other way to describe it.So I wrote with a fervor all through 2014, burning with this book in my brain - which I soon came to realize was actually a trilogy - unable to write fast enough in my limited free time to get the story out onto paper (or the computer screen, as it were).   This book, this trilogy, this story has completely consumed my life.  I adore my characters and their story, and they are alive in my head.  I have so much to tell!  "Hunger" is only the beginning of it, and I am currently well into writing the sequel (which is more like the continuation), "Heat".I have finally completed the long process of publishing, and now my book is a reality thanks to everyone who helped make it possible!About The BookHunger is a dark, paranormal romance bordering on the erotic (this is a mature, adult romance novel on the spicy side.  Meaning there is graphic sex scenes and profanities used.  Ohhh myyy!  18+ please!).  It is based on my werewolf race I have been developing for decades, the Kierrn, and is full of wildness, passion, eroticism, and darkness.  Yet there is also humor, moments of tenderness, joy, and genuine love and caring between the two main characters.  I hope that this will not be just another run-of-the-mill romance novel in a genre that is now over-saturated with werewolves, vampires, and other paranormal creatures.  Hopefully Hunger will stand out above the crowd.  Please read the plot summary below, and if you are curious, I have made the first two chapters available to read for free to help you decide it you like my style, and my story.  If you are intrigued by the characters and want to read more, please consider contributing to this campaign!  I am offering all formats of the book and some fun perks for your contribution.  While the book is currently available via Amazon.com and other online sources, these perks are only available through this campaign.Plot SummarySupernatural abilities, arcane magic, killer good looks, animalistic allure… what’s not to love about being a werewolf?  Kain Ulmer wouldn’t change what he is for the world. He lives a carefree transient life where the only thing that matters is the next woman, the next conquest, the next thrill.  The Hunger is the price he pays, the curse that demands he make a human kill every three moons or risk madness.  Yet he considers the cost worth the rewards of ultimate power and freedom.  Kain has everything he could want—until fate brings him to her...Autumn Sullivan has the perfect life. She lives in the most beautiful place in the world, a cottage nestled in the sanctuary of an ancient redwood forest.  She has realized her dream of owning a beautiful little coffee shop in the quiet Northern California town where she grew up, and her life is free from the complications of men and relationships. Just her and her friends, her shop, her redwoods, and her safe, simple life—until a dark, dangerous stranger disrupts her world and send her passions flaming.Kain is determined to win this guarded creature, but he cannot know the wild desires they will awaken in one another, nor the danger he will bring to her doorstep. An evil even Kain cannot fathom targets Autumn, and they both must race to find answers, and a safe haven, before the Hunger catches up to them both.Read the first two chapters for free on my website!FormatsHunger is currently available as an eBook for all readers and devices.It is also available as a 5" X 8" Trade paperback that is 327 pages.Hunger will be available as a 6" X 9" hardcover with cloth binding and a dust jacket.  It is 340 pages.  What is special about the hardcover edition is that it features exclusive drawings I have done throughout the book, and in a "sketchbook" in the back. It also features maps and other design elements. The full spread of the dust jacket:The title page from the hardcover interior.The first hardcover proof in my hot little hands!Hunger has been extensively edited by a professional editor, and the print books have been designed to all current industry standards with a professional look and feel.ReviewsHunger is already getting rave reviews on Amazon and Goodreads."LOVED this book! The author is amazing and I love her take on werewolves! I am familiar with her creativity in artwork, but with this book I could get the story behind an amazing piece! I could not put this down, stayed up all night to read it, and cannot wait to get my hardcover in hand to read and read again!" - Amazon Customer"This is truly a werewolf series I can get into! I adore the author's creative world surrounding these vivid characters. If you are a true paranormal fan, you have to get this book!! Now hungry for the hardback version!" - Kathryn H. on Amazon"I loved it! I finished it way more quickly than expected, partially because I couldn't put it down! The characters are well put together and believable. I need to like, highlight that and underline it. Believable people....The story line was compelling and I was surprised to see more good story underlining the romance. It's not just about the bow chica! Though those bits are well written as well." - NanhyBug on Amazon"Went over my expectations, and has almost everything I'd want in a werewolf novel, and there are some pretty hot scenes *wink wink* as well as a great underlying story line and interesting world. I'm eagerly awaiting book #2" - Lunafox on Amazon"If you love werewolves, sexy times and just a damn good story with all the right amounts of excitement, magic and mystery then pick up this book and get to it." - Sarzcoo on Goodreads"I always consider a book that i cant put down (and one that i blow off chores for) to be a good one and in my opinion this one was amazing." - Daniel Bayliss on GoodreadsPerksWhen you purchase your copy through this campaign, you will receive some exclusive perks available nowhere else!All print books will be signed, and come with this two-sided bookmark of the main (male) character, Kain in his human and werewolf forms.The hardcover will be signed and come with the Kain bookmark, and the Dragonfly Coffee & Espresso vinyl sticker. 
$55 - Paperpack Plus.  You will relieve the signed paperback, the Kain bookmark, the dragonfly sticker, and and a t-shirt of your choice from my art website at www.goldenwolfen.com (Calling the Storm tee pictured)  This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International contributors please add an additional $10 for shipping. 
$70 - Hardcover Plus.  You will receive the signed, illustrated hardcover, the Kain bookmark, the dragonfly sticker, and a t-shirt of your choice from my art website at www.goldenwolfen.com (Calling the Storm tee pictured).  This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International contributors please add an additional $20 for shipping.
$80 - Shift Happens.  You will receive the signed, illustrated hardcover, the Kain bookmark, the dragonfly sticker, a t-shirt of your choice from my website, a "Shift Happens" sticker, and a little extra surprise! This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International contributors please add an additional $10 for shipping.

$100 - Snarley Goodness.  You will receive the signed, illustrated hardcover, the Kain bookmark, the dragonfly sticker, a "Shift Happens" sticker, and I will draw a werewolf for you on the inside cover of the book.  This drawing will be exclusively yours and no two drawings will be alike! This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) within the US.  International contributors please add an additional $15 for shipping.ShippingAlthough I have set a tentative date for shipping to be in June 2015 I really cannot guarantee that.  Since the novel has yet to be edited, and thus finished, I cannot guarantee and absolute definitive release date.  It may take more editing and rewrites than I think to polish, and finish, this book.  I will keep everyone updated on the progress of the editing, and further updates on when I will have the book in my hot little hands.All perks include shipping within the US via USPS Priority Mail.  International orders will ship via USPS First Class mail.  International please add the extra amount required to cover the additional cost of shipping outside the US.Stretch GoalsIf we should raise more than the initial $4,000, stretch goals will be announced.  Please keep watching this campaign, or follow the books Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/sate.your.hunger or you can check out my website at http://www.christygrandjean.comOther ways you can helpIf you would like to contribute just to help out (you don't necessarily want anything in return) you can do so at the top of the page where the bright pink button says "Contribute Now".  All you'll get is my heartfelt thanks! I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!  You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my book! Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!

story:
UPDATE: Only ten days into the campaign, we have already reached our initial $10k goal! Every dollar raised from now forward will contribute to the future health and continued growth of the VIDA Count. 

Thanks to everyone who supports VIDA and the work of the VIDA Count!

--

VIDA was founded to cut through the bull. People had this intuitive sense that the literary culture was unbalanced, that women were being systematically excluded. But we needed to be sure. We needed to know, not guess.

That’s why the VIDA Count is so important. It gives us a concrete number. It makes things clear.

The disparity revealed in that first VIDA Count was actually worse than we guessed it would be. But since then, a number journals have improved, while others have pledged to do so.

Every year, the VIDA Count gets bigger. It takes thousands of hours for thirty counters to compile and double-check these numbers. It’s a huge job. Right now, all of that work is done by volunteers, which means some people aren't able to participate. Plenty of smart, committed people who would like to volunteer just can’t afford to.

That’s not just VIDA’s loss. It is also VIDA’s problem to address. We believe that people should be paid for their work. And by paying the counters for their work, we hopes to make the VIDA community more inclusive. 

That’s why we’re raising a fund to pay our counters: this is a job, and these people deserve to be paid.

So now we need your help. To keep growing, to keep having an impact, to include more journals and see the problem more clearly. VIDA counts, because you count. Help us continue this important work by making a donation today.


The 2014 VIDA Count is coming soon. Check out the 2013 numbers:

story:
*****

UPDATE - This campaign is now closed. Please visit www.tuskbooks.com to purchase copies of Billie and Ella.

*****

Do you want to help raise awareness about the many issues facing dolphins around the world?

Is there someone in your life who would love to receive a beautiful children’s picture book? Then read on …

At a glance overview

  • Billie is a captivating children's picture book that tells the story of Billie the dolphin’s search for the biggest wave. In her travels she saves new friends in dire circumstances.
  • Our aim is to help the next generation of animal lovers and eco-warriors grow up with stories and characters they adore that also happen to highlight real issues.
  • Your help is needed to contribute to the printing costs by pre-ordering the book. You can do this by choosing a perk that best suits you from the list on the right hand side of the page. You can buy more than one perk.
  • Your support will help raise awareness about issues experienced by ocean wildlife.
  • Billie follows on from Tusk Books’ hugely successful picture book, Ella.
  • All prices are in Australian dollars (AUD).
  • Billie will be available in July 2018.
  • The crowdfunding campaign finishes on 15 May 2018.
  • Contact hello@tuskbooks.com with any question

About the book

Billie is a 25cm x 26cm hard cover children's picture book written by Nicole Godwin and illustrated by Demelsa Haughton. Billie tells the story of a dolphin who is searching for the biggest wave. Billie navigates the oceans, saving new friends in dire circumstances.

This eye-opening story draws attention to the human-made perils for dolphins and other marine wildlife. Following the story we have included a double page of facts about the many issues facing dolphins.

Billie is Tusk Books’ second picture book. Founded by Nicole Godwin, Tusk Books is an animal rights publisher who is on a mission to give a voice to those who roar, yelp, moo, oink, squeak and trumpet.

Our successful first book, Ella, was also funded through an Indiegogo crowdfunding campaign. Ella tells the story of a baby elephant who was taken from her mum and put to work entertaining tourists. Ella makes a grand escape and sets off in search of her mum. Billie includes many heartfelt moments, but it is not as sad as our first picture book, Ella.

Billie is suitable for anyone aged from one month to 100+ years, but readers aged from three to eight years will find themselves reading it again and again and again.

The book uses paper sourced under ISO 1 4001 guidelines from sustainably managed plantations, and has been printed using environmentally friendly soy-based inks.

Take a look for yourself ...

We’ve included a few double pages from Billie below so you can get a feel for the book. Don’t worry we aren’t giving too much of the story away!

How will the money be used?

Funds will be distributed as follows.

As a small publishing company the printing costs are by far the biggest expense. Your support will help us print 2500 copies of the book, which will be sold through select book stores, online and at various markets and festivals.

Timing

The book will be in your hands in July 2018.

After the crowdfunding campaign ends, we’ll send you regular updates to keep you in the loop with the book production and printing schedule.

How does this help dolphins?

By supporting the creation of Billie, you are taking the first step to help dolphins around the world by raising awareness. Together, we can help dolphins and other ocean wildlife by making sure that people know about the issues they face.

What happens if we exceed the goal amount?

Additional funds will be used to print extra copies of Billie and for other direct business costs such as printing promotional products.

Donated books

Two of the perks listed on the right hand side of this page involve donating books.

If you select the option to buy a book and donate a book, the donated books will be shared between:

  • Sea Shepherd Australia for fundraising and promotional activities
  • Empty the Tanks for educational programs.

If you choose the library love perk, three books will be donated to school and public libraries across Australia. If you have a specific library that you would like the books donated to, please contact hello@tuskbooks.com.

Video

Check out the video at the top of the page for more information. If the quality isn't clear, adjust the playback settings by clicking on the gear icon - ⚙.

A word on postage ...

Within Australia

To minimise postage within Australia as much as possible, we have averaged the costs over various locations. We also plan to get a trusted helper to hand-deliver all books within Canberra which allows us to offer low Australia-wide postage and packaging rates ($5 AUD for one book, $8 AUD for two books and $10 AUD for five books).

A Billie greeting card will be included with all purchases to offset the postage costs.

And for our Kiwi friends supporting Billie, you will see that the same postage rates as Australia apply.

Outside Australia

Australia is so far away from everyone! Finding economical international postage rates is a challenge for Australian businesses. Tusk Books has worked hard to keep postage as low as possible, however please note that costs increase considerably with heavier items. Therefore, the perk for five books might not be an economical choice for people outside of Australia. Refer to the postage prices listed for each perk.

Please remember that postage prices are in Australian dollars (AUD), For example, international postage for one book ($10AUD) will be approximately $7.90 USD in the United States, €6.40 EUR within Europe and £5.60 GBP in Great Britain.

One last request ...

We’d be eternally grateful if you could help make some noise about Billie online. Please share the crowd funding link www.igg.me/at/billiepicturebook and information about Billie with your contacts.

The sharing icons at the top of the page make sharing super-easy.

Thank you so much for your generous support.

Nicole Godwin

Author of Billie and Ella and founder of Tusk Books

nicole@tuskbooks.com

www.tuskbooks.com

 

Image credit: All illustrations used in this crowdfunding campaign are illustrations from Billie and are created by the talented Demelsa Haughton.

story:
The Norwich Radical are hosting their fourth progressive media conference in March 2019.

Our media is dominated by right wing voices, from Tory tabloids to Blairite broadsheets. Big business holds huge sway in broadcast, print and online journalism. It perpetuates the reactionary messages we hear and receive, making it complicit in the rise of a louder, powerful, regressive, conservative movement across the globe.

We're bringing people together from across the arts, academia, media, politics and activism to discuss, debate and enlighten on how we can build a better media and a more progressive society.

To do this, we need to pay for a number of things — from publicity to expenses and from equipment hire to signage. So that's where you come in!

What your money could go towards:

£5 would allow us to print 250 fliers
£10 would allow us to print 50 posters
£30 would allow us to reimburse one speaker's transport expenses
£100 would allow us to fund a panel of speakers, including all transport expenses

In previous years we've had speakers and panels including Natalie Bennett, Michelle Stanistreet, Ben Chacko, Keri-Anne Mendoza, OpenDemocracy, the English Collective of Prostitutes, Travellers Times, European Roma Rights Centre, and the New Internationalist. Last year's highlights included David Breakspear, Pro Wrestling Eve, Novara Media, Red Pepper, and YouTubers Ellen Jones, Rowan Ellis, and Anna May Fox. We'll be announcing this year's lineup and speakers in the near future!

To find out more, head to www.warofwordsconference.com or www.thenorwichradical.com. 

 

The Norwich Radical is a publication established for the purpose of providing progressive analysis of politics and the arts. We are a broad coalition of activists, writers, students and workers coming from an array of political backgrounds. The Norwich Radical is non-profit and run by volunteers.

story:
Help a young writer go to university to pursue further education, while fulfilling his dream of writing a book!

----------------------------------------

Short Summary

I am Colten Dom, a seventeen year old living in Vancouver, B.C., and my dream is a career in literature, philosophy and writing. I have been accepted into the University of Victoria's renowned Writing Program; however, the fees of living on my own and actually attending university are very costly.
Writing has always been a great passion of mine, and in light of my recent accolades (I was awarded the Grade 12 English Scholarship at my school, as well as exhilaratingly high grades in Literature and AP English), I now possess the confidence to write a book!
 
The funds received from the project will go to furthering my education and help complete The Eight-Moon Night.

What You Get

The largest prize for the funder is the actual book, The Eight-Moon Night, which apart from the donation is included in every perk; as well as the satisfaction of knowing that you helped a budding author on his road to knowledge and becoming published.
 
I pride myself on being well-versed in the fine-arts; all artwork, graphical design and video editing in this project have been done by myself. It is in this way that I can offer the $500 Mystical Muse perk, which offers an original, unique art piece created by myself. I am presently interested in acrylic paints, but you may receive something of a different medium instead.
 
Also, the 2 T-shirt designs are also created by myself, and will reflect on important, but slightly comedic themes from within the book. The choices will be advertised once the designs themselves are completed.

The Book Itself

"The Eight-Moon Night, Colten Dom's anticipated novel, tells the story of an ageless battle waged by Humanity at various points in Time; of Death itself, the force that waits hungrily at the end of each life; and of the fall of society as hysteria shakes the Modern Earth. The theme is one of futility and omnipresence, as the heroes of Man fight something that cannot be destroyed- mortality itself."
 
Throughout the book, I explore people's personalities and relationships with one another in the face of looming danger, and how heightened circumstances of passion and action at times accentuate the inherent nature of an individual. As the world around him changes, the protagonist Bill Carrawind is forced into a game of love and hate, happiness and misery as the Earth falls apart around him. The book is also designed to investigate the multi-layered wants, needs and emotions of a human, and how factions are formed and torn down as people aid and destroy one another; all in the face of a seemingly inescapable demise, which truly leads the reader to question, and later, to find the answer to why we live at all.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spreading my campaign in any way you can is fantastic, and your support is welcome!

Post to Facebook, or talk to people about The Eight-Moon Night.

The easy to use Indiegogo share tools are handy for quickly helping out!
 
Spread the word!

----------------------------------------

Message me at any time on Twitter: https://twitter.com/ColtenDom

Or send me an email at: theeightmoonnight@gmail.com

I pride myself on being well-versed in the fine-arts; all artwork, graphical design and video editing in this project have been done by myself. It is in this way that I can offer the $500 Mystical Muse perk, which offers an original, unique art piece created by myself. I am presently interested in acrylic paints, but you may receive something of a different medium instead.
 
Also, the 2 T-shirt designs are also created by myself, and will reflect on important, but slightly comedic themes from within the book. The choices will be advertised once the designs themselves are completed.

The Book Itself
"The Eight-Moon Night, Colten Dom's anticipated novel, tells the story of an ageless battle waged by Humanity at various points in Time; of Death itself, the force that waits hungrily at the end of each life; and of the fall of society as hysteria shakes the Modern Earth. The theme is one of futility and omnipresence, as the heroes of Man fight something that cannot be destroyed- mortality itself."
 
Throughout the book, I explore people's personalities and relationships with one another in the face of looming danger, and how heightened circumstances of passion and action at times accentuate the inherent nature of an individual. As the world around him changes, the protagonist Bill Carrawind is forced into a game of love and hate, happiness and misery as the Earth falls apart around him. The book is also designed to investigate the multi-layered wants, needs and emotions of a human, and how factions are formed and torn down as people aid and destroy one another; all in the face of a seemingly inescapable demise, which truly leads the reader to question, and later, to find the answer to why we live at all.

Other Ways You Can Help
Spreading my campaign in any way you can is fantastic, and your support is welcome!
Post to Facebook, or talk to people about The Eight-Moon Night.
The easy to use Indiegogo share tools are handy for quickly helping out!
 
Spread the word!
----------------------------------------
Message me at any time on Twitter: https://twitter.com/ColtenDom
Or send me an email at: theeightmoonnight@gmail.com

story:
I Bet You're All Wondering Why You're Here

Going back to school seemed like a good idea.  Neither of us was having any luck finding a job of any kind.  I would be working towards a degree that would mean, in theory at least, a better chance at getting a good job after graduating.  And we'd have "income" from the student loans.

My first year back in school, the good spouse (TGS) still never found a job, but did write a novel: Death in All Its Forms.  We're currently shopping for an agent to represent it.  Another novel, Fairy War Hound, is in the embryonic stage:  bits and pieces, notes and an outline.  All it needs is a laptop, some good tunes in the background, and a closed door to keep the rest of the world out.  And for the author to feel able to write.

Unfortunately, student loans only stretch so far, and that's not really far enough to keep a family of six solvent.  With no regular income for about a year and a half now, we find ourselves in dire financial straits.  We're still applying for jobs and not getting hired.  Our savings are completely wiped out.  Things are looking very bad, indeed.  Worries about money are keeping TGS from relaxing enough to work on this next novel.

This is where you come in.  If we can take a few steps toward financial stability, that door can be closed, the music turned on . . . and the writing can commence.

What can we do with $4,000?  Quite a bit.

For starters, we can:

  • Bring our mortgage up to date.  It hasn't been paid since April.  The monthly payment is $654, so that's $1,962.
  • Pay for the license plate sticker for my car (currently expired).  $130.00.
  • Repair or replace our broken hot water heater.  I'm not sure about labor costs, but the appliance itself runs anywhere from about $300 to $800.
  • Bring (or keep) our bills up to date.  Gas, electric, water, cellphone, internet, and monthly medical bills all told should be about $1,200.
  • Other important things as they come up.
As we receive contributions, they will be applied to the above expenses in the order of what is most important right now:  May's mortgage payment, water heater, license plate sticker, June's mortgage, past due bills, current bills and July mortgage.  That order may change, if something becomes more urgent.  But this way, if we don't reach our goal, we won't have paid the mortgage through July, and then not have the money for the license plate sticker.

In case you didn't know, TGS isn't the only creative one in the family, and we're all helping out with perks. 

The first one hundred contributors of any amount will receive a handwritten thank you card printed with artwork from one of our kids.  Other perks will include naming rights for a character in the book, original artwork from Caitlin and Carl, bookmarks from Zoë and Fiona, and a lap blanket or shawl, designed and hand knit by Mona. And all contributors will be listed on a thank you page on Writing Worth Reading, our WordPress blog, and on our Writing Worth Reading Facebook page.

If we raise more money than our goal, those funds would be used to pay for August's expenses while TGS is writing and the fall semester starts, and also things like gas money, the license plate sticker for the minivan (expires July 31, 2014), new shoes for the kids for school, plumbing and electrical repairs the house needs, routine maintenance for the cars.

We have no credit cards, and no old credit card debt.  We own both of our cars, free and clear.  We haven't gone on vacation since 1999.  We haven't even been out of Illinois since 2005, when we took a day trip to Lake Geneva, Wisconsin.  We aren't looking for luxuries.  We just need subsistence.


This Is Writing that Deserves To Be Read

I have been reading TGS's work for years.  I know how good it is, and I think it's a shame that other people don't get the opportunity to read it.  Although sometimes they do.  TGS and I took part in a writing contest on LiveJournal several years ago.  You got about one week to write to a prompt.  All of the submissions were posted anonymously, and then the community voted on them, with the winners moving on to the next week and the next prompt.  Naturally, TGS's submissions did quite well, ending up in fourth place for the entire "season" of the competition.  One of the best of those is republished here.  TGS writes mostly urban (sometimes rural is more accurate) fantasy and magic realism, but as you can see from "Anticipation," that's only the beginning.


Risks & Challenges

We know that finishing a novel doesn't turn you into an overnight success.  In fact, most "overnight successes" really aren't.  It takes hard work, and time, to find someone willing to take a chance on an unknown author.

We are both looking for regular employment, also.  It would be great to have a big publishing house pick up the book, with a $20,000 advance, and a contract for five more books, but if we plan on that, we'd be like that woman waiting for a letter from Ed McMahon so that she can buy her luxury dream house.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you'd like to help, but you can't contribute right now, please spread the word about our campaign!  (Use the Indiegogo sharing tools to make it easier for yourself.)

Keep an eye on Writing Worth Reading for news and glimpses into the family life of a writer.

Visit the Wild Talents Designs pattern store on Ravelry, for Mona's knitting patterns.

Thank you!

story:
"Look deep into Nature, and then you will understand everything better." 

- Albert Einstein


WHERE CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO

The book itself is almost complete, all that is needed are funds for the last stages of: writing, editing, publishing, and building a platform for the story to reach the world (including a website, graphic design, video content, and social media). 

I have graphic designers and web designers and communications professionals ready to go - all I need is this final push!!

Contributions will directly support a self-published first run of the book, and you all will be my first readers!! The longer term vision is to complete a book proposal and secure a book deal for wider distribution. I am also working in collaboration on an awesome children's book concept, as well as a front lawn gardening campaign, which I will be able to move forward as this project develops! And I can't do it without you!


THE STORY

This is my whole heart's journey into the interconnectedness of all things. I'm telling the story of how to heal the planet by healing ourselves, by understanding the role of microscopic life in the soil and our bodies. 

It's a story about how my path to following my calling, my search for meaning, and healing my soul has led me to the keys to reversing climate change, ocean acidification, desertification, and biodiversity loss in our lifetime. It's a story about how these problems are actually all the same problem, interwoven through our most fundamental earth systems. And interwoven, of course, through our own bodies and our own spirits.

I argue in this book that there is a way forward, there are solutions to the daunting challenges we face, and I explain what we all can do in simple terms. I also tell you how healing the soil has everything to do with healthy drinking water, nutrition in our food, and even our own digestion and overall health. 

I explain how it all works and how to take action. I take a stand for what's possible.

I started this project almost exactly a year ago, and I've carried it as far as I can on my own with my own money and support from my family. I've been working behind the scenes for a long time, and it's time to take this thing public and share with the world what I have learned!


JOIN ME IN TAKING A STAND FOR WHAT'S POSSIBLE

I would be so profoundly grateful for any and all support in completing the book and taking it to the next level, whether it's a hug, a share, a few dollars, or your good word. This project is my heart and soul. 

I've included craniosacral therapy in the perks, as my journey in the healing arts is closely intertwined with my journey around healing the soil. I'm so grateful to be able to share these gifts with you.


THANK YOU FROM THE BOTTOM OF MY HEART

A special thank you to Sophia Savage for making this video and being an all around champion, soul sister, and boss; to Thomas Brodahl for his consistent encouragement, guidance, and collaborative support; to David Sloane, my mentor and friend; to my crazy friends at Kiss the Ground, where this all started; and to my unbelievable friends and family who I will be thanking individually. You are the world to me.

Thank you, thank you from my heart to yours. Thank you for believing in me, and for believing in my work. I could not be more humbled by the support you've already given me along the way. Thank you.

story:
Welcome to the Sensible BC campaign for  a marijuana referendum - the largest marijuana reform effort ever in Canadian history.

 Our campaign aims to have a vote to decriminalize marijuana in British Columbia.  We've written a law, called the Sensible Policing Act, which uses provincial jurisdiction over policing to stop all searches and arrests for marijuana possession in BC, as the first step towards full legalization.  Now we're collecting the signatures we need to put this law to a public vote.

I'm Dana Larsen, founder of the Sensible BC campaign. I have devoted my life to marijuana law reform. I served as editor of Cannabis Culture Magazine for ten years, working closely with publisher Marc Emery, who has been serving a five year sentence in Yazoo, Mississippi.

This campaign puts decriminalization within reach of British Columbians.

We have thousands of volunteers all over the province that are working hard to make decriminalization a reality. From Quesnel to Cranbrook, Prince Rupert to Sooke, our dedicated signature collectors are doing the work to make this happen, conversation by conversation, signature by signature.

But we need your help. Our volunteers are busily out in their community getting the job done, but they need the printing, signage, buttons and campaign materials to get it done.

Canada is ripe for marijuana law reform, but we need a trigger to make change actually happen. Like many parts of the world, the Canadian people are ahead of their politicians on this issue. This is why we need to put this to a referendum.

BC is the only Canadian province with a referendum system. But it's difficult to get on the ballot here. We have 90 days to collect about half a million signatures from all across the province to qualify for a public vote on this issue. We started on September 9, and so far we have over 2500 canvassers in place, collecting signatures in every corner of the province.

This campaign has been remarkably successful so far. We have been featured in well over 200 newspaper and media articles. Our efforts have been endorsed by every major newspaper in the province, as well as a wide number of public health and social policy organizations.

However, we need more funding for this campaign to succeed. Even the printing costs will be phenomenal, in the range of $40,000 just for flyers, stickers and petition forms.

 The referendum victories in Colorado and Washington are still new and fragile. A referendum victory across the border in BC will help to solidify those victories and ensure there is no turning back.

 All donations that we receive are being matched by a generous donor named Bob Erb. Bob is a BC marijuana enthusiast who won the lottery last year, and has pledged to match every single donation we get. What easier way to double your money and support a good cause?

Thank you for all that you do. Together, we will decriminalize marijuana in BC.

story:
101 Movie Pitches 

For well over two years I've made casual progress on this book. Now I'm ready to get it out there. So I'm raising funds to:

  • Pay an editor.
  • Pay a graphic designer (someone other than myself) to put their creative mark on the layout, cover and etc.
  • Pay some final draft proofreaders.

101 Movie Pitches contains some hilarious movie ideas that I want to world to read.

However much is raised, this will get published.

$500 was the minimum I could list for this project.

  • Essentially you're pre-ordering the book.
  • Why buy a "thank you" note for $80 when you could pre-order this book for $15 - and get the actual finished product!!
  • I'm resourceful. Even if the full goal is not met, I will find a way to get this done.

Past Projects

I have completed the following with ZERO crowd-funding:

  • How to Lose Your Virginity (...and how not to) - available on Amazon. I self-funded multiple road trips across the U.S. and personally interviewed 1,000 people about their first time. I was inspired to complete this project after seeing a German film at the Cleveland International Film Festival (ask me about it!).
  • Haiku Circus - available on Amazon. I drew these comic strips to give my mind a more instantly gratifying project while I was interviewing, cataloging, transcribing and editing 1,000 virginity stories. Haiku Circus appeared in over 30 newspapers worldwide (and in one Canadian Lit. Textbook).
  • Bad Theater Fest* - hope to see you there. Oct 2013!
  • Bad Film Fest* - Bad Theater's little sibling. 
So... as soon as my wandering mind zeroes in on a project, I do get it done.
101 Movie Pitches just needs a slight push.

*co-founded by Starr Kendall and Michael McFarland.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Blog about it.
  • FB and Twitter about.
  • Talk about it.

- Much thanks!
;)

story:
Ever wonder if Dante Alighieri had any descendants?

Short Summary

I am first a dad and a husband. Secondly, I'm a writer who created the character of Haven for the graphic novel that released in 2010 as a response to the assault that my wife experienced many years ago.

By retaining the prose rights to the Haven universe, I'm able to bring you Haven of Dante: The Staff of Moshe which answers the question of where Haven was during the two years she had disappeared from this Earth and launch a series of novels that will bring a deeper understanding to readers of the characters in this world while bringing a ray of hope to those who have suffered the same atrocious violation.

What We Need 

Our needs are simple:

Editing, Production and Distribution

The editing cost is the bulk of the expense and for a full-length novel that can be quite expensive. Production includes formatting into E-books for Kindle, Nook, and iPad among others. We'll also need physical copies for libraries and schools.


What You Get

CONTRIBUTE $1 

Anyone pledging $1.00 (one dollar) or above will have their name listed in the "thank you" section and our sincerest heartfelt thanks.


CONTRIBUTE $10 

Your name in the "thank you section"

Anyone pledging $10.00 will receive a pdf copy of The Jupiter Chronicles AND Haven of Dante upon release. We hope that you'll spread the word about each.


CONTRIBUTE $25.00 

Your name in the "thank you section"

A donor preferred link on Leonardoverse website for one month, a PDF copy of The Jupiter Chronicles and a PDF copy of Haven of Dante upon completion.

CONTRIBUTE $150 
Your name in the "thank you" section. 
Donor preferred link on website for six months. 
PDF of Haven the Graphic Novel 
PDF of Haven of Dante prose novel upon completion.                              PDF copy of The Jupiter Chronicles.

Signed FIRST RUN copy of Haven of Dante upon completion

 

What if You Pass Your Goal?

Any funds raised over and above the amount will be used for marketing Haven of Dante, attending shows (like GMX in Nashville)  and producing sequels. 

So you see, not a penny will be wasted. All of it will be put to good use and I'll use any profit from any book to put out a new one! Help me get this ball rolling because there's plenty to put out!

 

It's Not Just About a Novel!

Many years ago my wife was assaulted at gunpoint. She did survive but there was a long road to healing. This is touched on in the book and my wish is to bring hope to those who have shared this horrifying experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise!

Please be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much!

So you see, not a penny will be wasted. All of it will be put to good use and I'll use any profit from any book to put out a new one! Help me get this ball rolling because there's plenty to put out!
 
It's Not Just About a Novel!


Many years ago my wife was assaulted at gunpoint. She did survive but there was a long road to healing. This is touched on in the book and my wish is to bring hope to those who have shared this horrifying experience.


Other Ways You Can Help
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise!
Please be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much!

story:
Summary

            In The Moment is a collection of twenty-three poems, inspired by experiences, which capture important moments of people’s lives. The poems are about courage, heartache and love. Written from the heart, read between the lines and gain a new perspective on life through words that are soothing to the soul, unsettling to the narrow minded and a breath of fresh air to the conscious.

The Impact

Poetry is a vehicle to inspire. With your help, I hope to encourage others to chase their dreams by fulfilling my own. Currently, my team and I are looking to officially release the book in May. The book is in it's final stage of production. We hope to reach a larger audience through promotional material, book signings, book fairs and performances with your support it's possible.

                                                         What We Need & What You Get

      A substantial amount has already been invested. The two thousand five hundred dollars, we hope to raise, will help us pay for the stuff that goes into publishing and marketing a book: cover art, Copyright, ISBN number, Editing, proof reading copies, book signing costs, book fairs fees, promotional material, vendor permits, postage and supplies necessary to mail everything and a initial order of books.  We offer great perks --- a Special Shout out on all social media outlets that RashaunEnterprises or Rashaun Allen is a member of, a signed copy of In The Moment or a signed copy of In The Moment and A Walk Through Brooklyn,  acknowledgment within In The Moment, event host, group book giveaway and/or apperance.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Spread the Word
  • Share us on social media sites
  • Join our Facebook group page RashaunEnterprises
  • Join our team--- Email Rashaunterprises@gmail.com with an inquiry about how you can help.
  • Follow on twitter @RashaunJAllen

                                        About The Author

  • A SUNY Albany Alum (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m0R6r5fn7m8)
  • A College of Saint Rose Alum
  • The author of “A Walk Through Brooklyn” (http://www.lulu.com/spotlight/rashaunenterprises)
  • A Brother of Phi Beta Sigma Fraternity Inc.

***Book Orders will be fulfilled within approximately two weeks after fund raiser ends. Please keep in mind delviery time may vary due to unforeseen circumstances.

****All Perks that contain Acknowledgment specific perk needs to be made by 4/20/12.

Perks that require travel, if destination is over 50 miles of home address and/or overnight stay additional considerations may apply.

*****Perks can be claimed by individuals or organizations.

Thank You for taking the time to come on this page, whether you donated or not, your time is appreciated.

story:
Accelerate has already been successfully funded through KS. But, we wanted to be able to continue to offer the chance to pick up a copy to those that missed out on KickStarter, until the book goes to print middle of July.

Thank you for checking out our project! Accelerate is the ultimate guide to startup accelerator programs. Our goal is for Accelerate to become the go-to-source for information on accelerators, incubators and their graduates. 

Over the past 7 months we have interviewed more than 150 founders that have taken their company through an accelerator program, created an accelerator program or successfully raised funding. Some of the accelerator programs who's graduates feature in Accelerate from America are Y combinator, TechStars, 500 Startups, Angel Pad, Launchpad LA and DreamIt. While internationally, we feature startups from programs like SpringBoard in London England (now TechStars London), StartUpBootCamp and RockStart in Amsterdam, Startup Sauna in Finland, FounderFund in Canada, StartMate in Australia, China Accelerator in Dalian China, and iAccelerate in India. 

In the book, the founders discuss their accelerator experiences, fundraising, starting a company, generating early users, marketing strategies, product sourcing and many other interesting topics. We also feature a breakdown of more than 135 accelerator programs from around the world along with a mix of illustrations and infographics that highlight information on the startup and accelerator environment.

Foreword by Brad Feld, Foundry Group managing director and TechStars co-founder.

If you would like to follow the books progress, check us out on Twitter.

story:
Please take a look at this great project from my friend Peter Skagen.  Great actor and fantastic teacher and coach.  This is really a project that is worth supporting!

LA Casting Director Andy Henry

 

Helps us raise funds to get this amazing book published, one way or the other.

How to Succeed in Hollywood without really Acting.

Already in limited circulation in manscript form, it is on several “most-wanted” lists as a required text at universities, and is a widely supported by actors, peers, teachers and industry professionals.

It blows the doors open and fills you with inspiration.  

And it will save you years of frustration.  

In the Gallery tab you will find the book's table of contents, a sample chapter, videos of what people are saying about Peter Skagen, as well as his professional demo reel, and photos of his on-set experience and class room interactions.   

The goal is to get the book to the North American market through publication, whether  conventional or self-published.   Funds are for a top editor, and a design and marketing campaign including podcast interviews with top industry pros.    

    • $3,000 : a top editor.
    • $3,500 : design, marketing, podcasts. 

 

From Casting Director Deb Green, CSA & CDC (Brokeback Mountain)  

I have read the manuscript. It's brilliant. I like to call it HOW TO BE BRILLIANT IN THE AUDITION ROOM AND GET THE GIG AND THEN BE BRILLIANT ON SET AND GET THE HARDWARE. Go to this link and donate a buck or three and help get this thing published. 

 

From actress Kim Clackson (proof reader).

Here are my thoughts in no particular order: Fabulous, honest, relatable, real, fun, inspiring, useful, SO informative, love the antecdotes/first-hand accounts, cheeky, conversational/easy to read and comprehend, visual, very funny, step-by-step-all-encompassing how-to, entertaining, great behind-the-scenes practical knowledge/tidbits, so funny, brilliant, sassy, commanding, encouraging, creative, empowering. There are thousands of bright-eyed actors all over the world who would benefit tenfold from reading this book.  

From Dr. Reid Spencer, Dept. of Theater, Speech and Music, Mount Royal University

Peter Skagen's manuscript is a winner on so many levels, and should be required reading for any student of acting. While the title implies the craft of film acting, many of the lessons are of universal importance, whether acting for film, stage, or promoting a stand-up act.  When I came back to auditioning for film roles after many years away I took one of Peter's classes, and his no-nonsense approach to the business was in large part responsible for me booking a feature film and a guest role on series television within 2 months of the class.  This book follows that tradition.  It debunks myths, it sets goals, it kicks your butt when needed. I do not book everything--no one does.  But when I do it is Peter's voice in my head that gets me there.  If you cannot actually take class with this man, buy this book.  You will not regret it.

From student Esther Huang

"What I like about Peter's teaching is that is is so straight forward, common sense, and understandable. There are so many teachers who ramble about getting in touch with 'creativity' with lifestyle suggestions, but have no specific or concrete words to offer. The best thing that you could is take Peter's class when you are getting started, and save yourself a lot of confusion and vague platitudes."

Peter Skagen's imdb page

Peter Skagen's website

Peter is the success doctor.  Want some?

And use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!!

story:
INTRODUCTION

“Happy Grey Hair” is a play which gives an in debt insight into the cultures, traditions, norms, values and ups and down as it is peculiar to people on the African continent. In fact to be specific this play informs on the lives of people somewhere in West Africa.

 OBJECTIVES

  Our objective is to create awareness about Africa and their culture to people in continents other than Africa, and at large the world. This play focuses on life in African; this project will shed more light to people in countries other than Africa on the values and traditions on the African continent. As a matter of fact, we traveled to six West African countries to prepare our research. From our research we came up with a lot of information and as such, we decided to put them in a simple play so it can be easily understood by all. It took our research team about 5 years to bring forward this play namely: “Happy Grey Hair”. A play with an ingredient of real and probable situation as it is peculiar to people on the African continent.

  Based on our research, we found out an important problem which faces all rapidly developing countries; the need to preserve good traditions, norms and at the same time graft upon them when and where appropriate. That is one reason why in Africa, there are several cultural organization which encourage not only the local art but also to widen the scope to include the arts of neighboring countries like Europe and other parts of the world.

  But it does not only have to foster the arts which appeal to the eyes or ears but rather take into account that which appeals to the intellect and moral aspect of man.

  To bring this information to all with a taste of pragmatism, we want to dramatize this information. Drama had always been a means in which one can catch the conscience of people and to achieve this, we wrote this play with the intention of dramatizing it such that our audiences will understand the situation in the  play.

AIM

  Our aim is to dramatize this play on African’s soil with characters familiar to the ordinary Africans. This will go a long way to give the true impression that the various West African communities have many problems, feeling and interest in common.“Happy Grey Hair” is designed to achieve this at the primary phase and that is why we are lobbying the general public via indiegogo and through other platforms to help make this a reality because the benefits we stand to derive far outwit its cost.

GOALS

  Our immediate goal is an amount equivalent to $500  and this is intended to be used to kickstart  this project afterwards,we intend to press on so as to reach our long term goal of  $100000 and above. It is our goal to use the money raised to hire  dramatists familiar to the ordinary Africans  as well as dramatists who will dramatize for us on voluntary basis to dramatize this play on African’s soil. Afterward, we also intend to use various media platforms in African to popularize our drama and as such create an awareness campaign globally about the African people.

  It is our intention to foster this educational campaign by creating more plays on the lifestyle, values, norms, people, ups and downs, etc. common to Africans and further in African communities in various parts of the world. (Diaspora communities)

  As our fans, we want to encourage you all to support our campaign in various ways; either online or offline. You can spread the message of our campaign to your friends, colleagues (at school or work), family members, relatives, etc. You can also spread the message of our campaign via various social media platform like face book, twitter, 2go, etc. depending on your preference, doing these will necessitate the success we hope to achieve from this campaign.

GOOD NEWS

  To our esteemed contributors, here is a piece of good news. “Provided you wish not to remain anonymous after making your donations to our campaign, we will with your permission popularize you on our social media platform (our face book fan page) as one of our esteemed supporters and guess what; you also stand a chance to be included as acknowledgements in any other books to be published in the future as far as the current script (VIZ Happy Grey Hair) of which we are lobbying for support from you to dramatize.

SPECIAL OFFER

  To all those with a desire to sponsor this campaign that is, those who are willing to make a very large donation. These will stand the chance of receiving the highest number of perks plus an acknowledgement both online and offline with respect to any project that we intend to undertake plus the current project.

REWARDS/PERKS FOR DONATIONS

  Here are the rewards you stand a chance of receiving for your donations; first and foremost the first level of contributors that is those with a much smaller donation are entitled to an excerpt of the script. They are entitled to a summary/synopsis of the play uploaded to them either via email or as a message via their face book page or both.

  The second level of contributors are entitled to the entire script sent to them either through their email address or as a message via their face book address or both these are for those with a contribution/donation larger than at first level of donation.

  The third level of contributors are entitled to the entire script plus two other books sent to them via their email address or face book address or both. These are contributors with donations greater than that of the first and second level of contributors.

  The fourth level of contributors are referred to as sponsors. These are individuals or other wise with the intention to make very large donations and these are entitled to the largest number of perks. They are entitled to the entire script plus two or more scripts (at their request) sent to them either via their email address or as a message via their face book address or both. This level of contributors stand the chance to be included as acknowledgement both offline and online with respect to any project that we intend to under take as well as current project.

  To our dear contributors please note that since your perks will be delivered to you either as a message via your face book address or email, no shipment or shipment fee is required. And the estimated time of delivery of your perks is only due to lougistics required in the process of sending your perks.

NOTE
To our dear contributors,we want to use this opportunity to inform you that  after making your donation,send us an email indicating your names,amount donated,billing addresss,your Facebook link(if you wish) and perk claimed.Once that is confirmed, your perk will be sent to you via your email address or Facebook link.

SPECIAL PACKAGES

Are you an Indiegogo user? Do you intend to run a campaign on this site? Are you presently running a campaign on this site but not featured yet on their main page? Here is an opportunity to run a successful campaign and they are:

1. If you make a donation of  $30 to our campaign and claim a perk tagged special package 1, LeadwayGroup will donate $15 to your campaign.

2. If you make a donation of  $60 to our campaign and claim a perk tagged special package 2, LeadwayGroup will donate $30 to your campaign

3. If you make a donation of  $120 to our campaign and claim a perk tagged special package 3, LeadwayGroup will donate  $60 to your campaign.

It should be noted that after making your donation and claiming your perk(s),please send us an email indicating your names,amount donated,billing address and campaign link. Once that is confirmed you will receive your perk as a donation to your campaign.

It should also be noted that if you are yet to create a campaign,you are also free to make your donation and claim any of  our packages and thus book for our future support to your campaign. Please do not forget to send us an email indicating your names, amount donated, billing address and campaign link plus a statement indicating you are yet to create a campaign.When you eventually create your campaign,please send us your campaign link and thus receive your perk as a donation to your campaign.

COPYRIGHT OFFER

Are you a publisher, publishing agent, author or anyone with a desire to publish a book and wishes to be granted permission to reproduce or publish our book titled: 'Happy Grey Hair' your way? Are you a film production company, a film producer or a non-governmental organization with the desire to run an educational or awareness campaign about Africa in a creative way through drama? We give you the opportunity and that is why we have designed two perks for these purposes.

These perks are tagged 'Copyright Offer' and they are categorized into two;

1. The 'Copyright Offer' Perk placed at 5000 US dollars is designed for any publisher, publishing agent, author or anyone with the desire to publish a book in any part of the world who wishes to be granted permission to reproduce or republish our book titled: 'Happy Grey Hair'.

2. The 'Copyright Offer' perk placed at 10,000 US dollars is designed for any film production company, film producers or  non-governmental organization in any part of the world with the desire to run an educational or awareness campaign about Africa, its people an culture in a creative way through drama.

Join us in our educational/awareness campaign and let us make that difference together.

This book 'Happy Grey Hair' is amongst  books on Readers' Favorite with reviews ratings of 5-stars. It was reviewed professionally  by Readers' Favorite. This book is also among upcoming award winning books for 2014. Check it out on their website: www.readersfavorite.com

 


For more information and inquiries please email: leadwaygroup@mail.com

story:
Some of my Stories: 

Modern Day Tesla: http://www.dailyillini.com/lifeandculture/aroundcampus/article_ddd5fa52-8882-11e3-908d-001a4bcf6878.html

South African Freedom Day:  http://www.dailyillini.com/lifeandculture/aroundcampus/article_05a91db2-ca81-11e3-a02b-001a4bcf6878.html"

A Revolutionary Fellow:  http://www.dailyillini.com/lifeandculture/aroundcampus/article_5c68fe2e-cff4-11e3-9a8d-001a4bcf6878.html

Sochi LGBT Issues:  http://www.dailyillini.com/lifeandculture/aroundcampus/article_5c68fe2e-cff4-11e3-9a8d-001a4bcf6878.html 

My Pictures: https://www.flickr.com/photos/83621498@N02/


I plan to travel through Mexico, Central America, Cuba and the US from June 2nd through August 10th documenting lives and pursuing the following stories:  

- Los Olivos, a mayan ruin in Guatemala where locals are doing whatever they can to protect this ruin from Guatemalan officials, who are trying to escavate the site and open it up to tourist

- Chichicastenango, small K'iche Mayan town in Guatemala that hosts a colorful textile, handicrafts, and pottery market that is centuries old next to the 400 year old church of  Santo Tomás, a colonial church built by the Spanish, who conquerd the town

- Evolution in the Revolution: 15 years after the Nat Geo article that anticapted a changing tide in Cuba's communist ideas

- Colli-Colli family in the Yucatan 31 years after the Hubert Smith documentary, "The Living Maya" and whether or not they've assimilated into the modern world

- An American family in Oaxaca, Mexico who cultivate oyster mushrooms and sell to communties of indigenous Mazatec, Nahuatl, Mixtec & Chinatec people in their area

- Revisiting the Loneliest road in America, U.S. Route 50 that runs through Nevada, 28 years after the 1986 Life magazine article

- Mexico City: Then and now, a look at contemporary Mexico 

- Drug violence, and how it's affecting the agricultural economy of the Mexican state of Michoacan

- World cup furor in Latin America 

- Permaculture in the Yucatan Penninsula, the growing trend for American ex-pats

These stories will be published online by the Daily Illini (www.dailyillini.com), as well as on an online blog.  

I will be hitting the following countries in this order: Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras, Nicaragua, Cuba, the US.

Most of the money from this campaign will go toward transportation costs and accomadation. I will be departing from Chicago on June 2nd and start off my journey in the Yucatan, making my way up to center of the country before rounding my way down through Latin America by bus. I then plan on flying from Managua to Cancun where I'll be able to make the 1 and 1/2 hour flight to Havana and stay there for about a week before returning to Cancun, where I will be flying back to the states. The final leg of the journey will be  a roadtrip west down through U.S. Route 50, the loneliest road in America. 


The Impact:

With this 'Snapshot of the Americas' project, I hope to establish a bridge between the past and present, allowing people the opportunity to reflect on the changes that have occurred over time in the Americas. And while two months is no where near enough time to get an exhaustive picture this region's present landscape, this project will give me a glimpse into the lives of the people that inhabit these regions and help me highlight a few the faults and virtues of their present state. While financial support is an important part of the project, having a community of readers and supporters is important as well, as it will open up the field for interpretation and allow the readers and external community the opportunity to act accordingly and help promote certain causes I may document. 

What Your Support Means: 

While I would be thrilled if this project were to be fully funded, the project will still take place to a smaller scale if I don't reach my entire goal, where I will be traveling only to Mexico, Guatemala and the United States, hitting less spots along the way. I am committed to this project I and am excited to see it out and the impact it can have on the world. Any donation, in any amount, is greatly appreciated! 

Still, these are hard times and I know not everyone will want to or be able to contribute financially. Regardless of your decision, I value your feedback-- please share this project widely and feel free to contact me about friends in the countries I will be traveling to who might want to speak with me, or ideas you have on how I can make this project better.

story:
DRIFTLESS MAGAZINE

Driftless is a new, ad-free, independent magazine about adventuring in the Midwest. Our quarterly publication introduces readers to the creative and awe-inspiring wonders the Midwest has to offer by way of stories, recipes, guides, essays, and interviews. Driftless is putting the Midwest back on the map as a beautiful place to both live and visit -- we are way more than just flyover territory! We showcase the talent, creativity, and ingenuity that flourishes in our neck of the woods.

Driftless is the type of magazine that you keep on your bedside table for nightly reading, your bookshelf for easy reference, and on your coffee table for showing off your favorite Midwestern inspirations. Issue 1 is 100 perfect-bound pages of gorgeous photographs, beautiful illustrations and clean design from Midwestern artists and makers. 

WHAT WE NEED

The only step we are missing is taking Driftless to the printing press! We are looking to raise funds to help cover printing and distribution costs, so we can get this magazine into places near you! The first $5000 will keep the printing local and the price of the magazine reasonable. We plan to use any extra funds to give back to our wonderful contributors and begin saving for the printing of our fall issue (due out September/October 2014)!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Even if you are unable to donate today, we would really love your support in the form of spreading the word! Any sharing of our campaign via real life interactions with your family and friends, via Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Pinterest -- you name it -- is greatly appreciated! Help us put the Midwest back on the map! 

Here are a few articles and snapshots to look forward to in our first summer issue!

  • A Grand Rapids City Guide
  • Summer Grill Out Recipes
  • A Limestone Quarries Photo Essay
  • An Interview with an Indiana Woodworking Couple
  • Illustrations from Midwestern Artists
  • A Guide to the Cleveland Art Scene
  • and much more!

Thank you SO much for taking the time to check out Driftless!

story:
UPDATE: The book deal is not happening. I decided to not sign the contract.

For those who want refunds, I will honour that.

However, I will keep this fundraiser going. One of the things I'm going to need is a website to promote not only my fiction, but my corporate work, so -- if what's below doesn't come to pass -- certainly, any funding will go either go towards a useful marketing tool, or I will refund it once my funds are in hand. Thanks to all who have contributed so far.

---

I have some exciting news to share -- and I want YOU to be a part of it. :-)

I want to give you some background and talk about something positive that is happening for me, and then I will talk about your potential role in this.

And if you don't want to contribute, that's fine. I totally respect that.

So here's the scoop:

I could very well, by spring 2015, have my debut short story collection, Terrible Things Happen, published by an indie publisher in Texas. Sounds not too bad, right? 

Get this.

It gets better.

I've reached out to a few authors in Canada and America about potential book blurbs, if they like my work.

I can't tell you who I might have lined up, but a few have expressed interest in reading the manuscript. If they like the work, they will blurb it.

None are household names, per se, but they're mid-list authors with books published by major publishers. If I get these blurbs, you might go, "Wow! How did you get so-and-so with major publishing credentials to blurb your book?"

The publisher is looking at 1,000 copies for an initial print run. I'm not making money up front, more on that in a second, but the royalties are very generous.

I've done due diligence on the publisher. I had a friend with some publishing experience do some digging, and she found that this appeared legit. I phoned the publisher, and the publisher picked up the phone at the number that was provided. The site itself retails books, as well as provide ways to order via Amazon and Barnes and Noble.

The publisher has some media clout. The main woman who runs the business was a media spokesperson in a past life. She has a bio in the Internet Movie Database -- granted, you can probably pay to get that, but, still, it's kind of neat. The publisher web site lists "media affiliations", including logos for Fox and MTV, among others. Now, if this publisher didn't have those connections, I would imagine that these media companies -- and there are a few, big and small -- would be on the horn to their lawyer pretty quickly. Maybe these things *can* fly under the radar, but, so far, it's looking like the company is not a scam, per se.

So this is all great, right?

Here's the difficult part.

The publisher is what the industry calls a "hybrid publisher". This means that the publisher shifts the onus of risk from themselves to the author by asking the author to front some of the cost of publishing.

Now, in my mind, this is "pay to play". I'm not the type of person who necessarily agrees with that sentiment, and I feel that money should flow to the author and not the other way around. 

I told the publisher this. 

The publisher then cut me a deal. 

And I have a few thoughts about this, but, first, the deal.

The publisher is willing to produce the collection for a grand total of $1,000 US up front. They have a tier-pay model where you can pay $1,500 to get some things done, and up to $4,000 to get even more in return.

So, basically, the publisher said to me: we like your work, we like your track record, we like your ability to hustle. We will give you the $4,000 package for a quarter of the cost.

So here's what I think.

Publishing is a risk. This is a short story collection, which is harder to sell than novels. Plus, I'm a Canadian dealing with an American market. So that's strike two.

There is no such thing as a "perfect" publishing deal. I'll paint a scenario for you. Say a major publishing house came to me to write a novel, and paid me an advance up front. I write the novel. The publisher then publishes the work and then does zero to market it.

So this is a balance. The publisher is willing to cut a deal, I'll get 500 books (if not more if this is successful), they seem willing to do their share of marketing so long as I do my share on my end, and they're offering pretty good royalties -- so I'll get paid a set amount on each of the individual copies sold.

Naturally, there are still some details to hammer out -- but this seems, so far, like a fair deal, relatively speaking.

My work is a bit out in left field, so this is as good a shot as any. I've tried approaching more traditional publishers, who, incidentally, get their money from grants, and they're not interested in the book just because it's short stories and they feel they can't market that right now. I've gotten very nice rejection letters, but it's "sorry, this is too much of a risk for us."

All of that said: I've really considered this. Yes, there's some risk. But, as I said, there is no such thing as a "perfect" deal. You have to meet people halfway, and, so far, this publisher is willing to negotiate with me. I can respect that. 

Yes, I can self publish. But then I'm shouldering all of the costs myself. Plus, I'm less likely to garner any sort of publicity for the work. Distribution becomes harder. And, truth be told, I'm not the type to haggle over what kind of paper should be used and what kind of ink should be used. I've been there. Not for me.

At least here, there seems to be ways into the American media market. The publisher is going to do the cover art and edit (even though the manuscript is pretty clean, and I have my own editors working on this). So it's a balance.

Here's the deal.

This year was a tough year for me financially. I went into debt after my last contract ended. I really can't afford the $1,000 right now out of my own pocket.

But then I thought: crowdfunding.

If I can get 20 people to kick in $50 US at least, that's all I'd need.

So after all of this blather and preamble, here's what I can offer YOU:

If you kick in $50 US, I will make sure you not only get a copy of the book, signed by me with whatever personal message you want in it, I will also personally thank you in the acknowledgements section. If you ever wanted to see your name in print (spelled correctly; I used to be a journalist after all), here you go. I'm trying to think of other things I can do for you, so I'm also open to suggestions.

What I'm also thinking about is the whole kit and kaboodle. If some generous benefactor wants to put in the full $1,000 US -- here's what I can do.

I'm already working on my second short story collection. If this book is a success, well you know there's a follow-up.

What I'll do, for the full amount, is the following:

Put you as a character in a story, with your name, and build a story around you. I will interview you, find out what you like and don't like (ie. if you don't want to be killed off in a story, I won't do it), and do everything in my power to create a work of art that hopefully fits with the theme of the collection I have in mind.

Hopefully, this sounds copacetic. I'm trying, too, to figure out what I can do for more mid-range donations (ie. $100, $250, and so on). Naturally, I don't have "swag" right now, but I'm open to suggestions -- as long as they are legal, don't go against my integrity and morals, and are doable. :-)

If the book, for whatever reason, doesn't see the light of day, I'll fully refund you. That's the risk I'm willing to take. 

Also, I'm going to need funding fairly quickly. The publisher wants copy finalized by the end of January for a spring publication date.

So, I hope you can help out and that you're willing to become a part of something that's important to me. This is a 15 year dream for me, getting a collection published. I truly believe in my work, a lot of people have said good things about it.

Oh, one of the stories in the collection was nominated for a US Pushcart Prize. And I also received grant money to finish the collection some time ago. So I hope this speaks to the quality of the material. :-)

You can read one of the stories here: http://www.pindeldyboz.com/zhcome.htm

And here's another: http://pantheonmag.com/double-income-no-kids-zachary-houle/

I hope you can help. If you can't, I fully respect that and understand. But, if you can, you will have earned my undying gratitude.

If you want to get in touch, I'm at zacharyhoule@rogers.com.

Best,

Zachary Houle
