Oh,
 one of the stories in the collection was nominated for a US Pushcart 
Prize. And I also received grant money to finish the collection some 
time ago. So I hope this speaks to the quality of the material. :-)
You can read one of the stories here: http://www.pindeldyboz.com/zhcome.htm
And here's another: http://pantheonmag.com/double-income-no-kids-zachary-houle/ 
I
 hope you can help. If you can't, I fully respect that and understand. 
But, if you can, you will have earned my undying gratitude.
If you want to get in touch, I'm at zacharyhoule@rogers.com.
Best,Zachary Houle

story:
Short Summary

     My name is Nazia Islam. I am a soon to be graduate of Syracuse University with a degree in anthropology. I have decided that this would be a good time to  begin working on a memoir. I am creating this campaign to raise funds to start working on a memoir.

        I was born in Bangladesh, but I would come over to the United States when I was one years old with my parents. I have no memory of the place where I was born. This makes me a second generation American of Bengali heritage. Bengali-American (or as I like to call it Ameringali). This memoir is about the hyphen identity I would embrace in college. 

      I never thought I would grow up to want to become a writer. When I was little I wanted be an artist specifically a painter (the future Bob Ross) or a cartoonist. My interests in writing did not manifest until I was about fourteen years old. Up until that point I was an avid reader and a kid who did her homework as soon as she got home so that she could practice her sketching. I spent most of my childhood alone. I was isolated in school and for the most part bullied. Up until middle school I was the only South Asian and only Muslim in my class. My peers misunderstood my background and my parents, first generation immigrants, also had a tough time navigating their surroundings. We lived in a predominantly Italian-American town. There was this "othering" happening from both sides.  For a while I resented my cultural heritage but I never could fit in with everyone else at school. I was a child living in a cultural mish-mosh limbo.(more about that will be in the book)  

          Back to writing. At the age of fifteen, I slipped into depression because of all of this along with family issues that were arising. I began to become conscious of all that was happening in the world. Post 9/11 is the most obvious but even more than that. It was everything that bothered and upset me. Poverty, war, disaster, racism, politics, sexism stereotypes. It would last for two years. It was hard to communicate my feeling. I was confined to bed for many days. My parents had a difficult time with this as well. There was denial about depression or why I was going through it I did not eve know myself but I could not stop the sadness. This was when I channeled everything through poetry. My grandmother, old Bollywood actor and director Guru Dutt, and my religion would be the factors that helped me make sense of my life at that time to my connection to my heritage and myself. This is quite important and I reflected back on this a lot when I began college. I thought it would be a time in my life where I could start over. It would be so much different than what I imagined. I felt that my life was on repeat. Part of that cycle I mentioned above started over again in different ways but in even more complex ways (such as antagonism between people of similar backgrounds), but I would come across very very important life lessons and experiences.

•  This memoir will consist of two parts:
Part 1- My parents story.  Their migration story. My journey in tracing back my ancestry.

Part 2- My story. In this section I will talk about identity, model minority stereotypes, culture, my college experiences, and my faith journey. I might be pulling from various academic sources to support some of my experiences. I will also be including my favorite lessons and quotes.

I would like to turn it into a work of reflective scholarshipthat deals with the theme of migration, identity intersectionality, and the complexities of culture tied to perceptions of the body.

What We Need & What You Get

•  I will need about $5,000 dollars to start this project. 

  •  $2,500 for technology- A better camera for photographs ( I have an old point and shoot right now) to document and archive the places my parents grew up and where I have grown up. A new laptop (my current one is old, has a dead battery, and a malfunctioning screen. I am currently working off a nook which a little inconvenient and frustrating at times) Software for editing photographs and putting the memoir together. Whatever is left over, I will save for publishing fees. Right now my focus is on getting this started and completed for the publishing phase. http://www.coroflot.com/naziaislam/Many-Faiths-One-Humanity  (portfolio of my photography)  Miss Nazia Islam- My blog where I share my poetry, thoughts, and experiences. Much of the content will be in my memoir in greater detail. 

•  $2,500 for travel costs. This will cover one trip to Bangladesh where I will do research and get information/photos for part 1. Road to Ameringali (blog about project specifically part 1 and the research I have been doing for it) 

 The perks for contributions are on the side. 
-$10- A special thank you email
-$25-A homemade thank you card
-$50- Get your name in the finished product thank you section
-$100- A photograph from my project.
-$200- Two photographs and access to a private blog to stay updated on progress.

•  If I can get at least half the money I can start to work on part 2. 

The Impact

This project means a lot to me. More than a lot. This project is not for myself. It is for my family and for my future children and grandchildren. I've had a lot of issues with identity and trying to navigate my world. And there were really no resources for me growing up that was able to help me with my various identities especially my South Asian/Bengali one. This book is not only a reflection but a guide with resource that were hard to find while growing up with stereotypes. (And frankly the stereotypes still continue and I think about it a lot. Kids TV shows still portray them in a gross manner) 

Disclaimer: I'm not here to represent an entire culture.  I am just contributing my story and experiences to expand the narratives in the United States.

Other Ways You Can Help

Monetary help would be greatly appreciated but if that is not possible PLEASE spread the word about AMERINGALI.

THANK YOU

story:
WE REACHED OUR INITIAL GOAL IN UNDER A WEEK!!! THANK YOU AMERICA! Now it is TIME to push this ball up a bigger HILL!!! PLUS we just announced our Global Launch - August 24th - in partnership with the Elisabeth Kubler-Ross Foundation!

Let's Have Dinner And Talk About Death

An uplifting interactive adventure that transforms this seemingly difficult conversation into one of deep engagement and empowerment.

Michael Hebb, interactive firm CIVILIZATION, The University of Washington's Masters of Communication Leadership program, Engage with Grace, the Elisabeth Kubler-Ross Foundation and thirty of the nation's leading health and wellness organizations and individuals are fast at work building this critically important website and transmedia project. We need a critical piece of funding to complete the website and launch. 

Please take a moment to visit our microsite and see the immense amount of work we have already completed @ www.deathoverdinner.org. 

Read more about Michael Hebb: www.tedmed.com/speakers/show?id=62068. 

Civilization: www.wearecivilized.us

UW Leadership in Communication: mcdm.washington.edu

Engage with Grace: www.engagewithgrace.org

Elisabeth Kubler-Ross Foundation: www.ekrfoundation.org

Our remarkable advisors and partners: www.deathoverdinner.org/partners

 

Our Story (from Michael Hebb) 

Hey America - my name is Michael Hebb. And On April 18th I took the mainstage at TEDMED to tell the world about a project called “Let’s Have Dinner and Talk About Death.”

You might be wondering - What the hell is wrong with me? and why I would want to have Americans stop – gather their friends – and have a conversation about how we End our Lives. 

 9 months ago - I was sitting in the dining car of a train – and I started a conversation with two strangers. they were both medical doctors – and shortly into the conversation we began to discuss how messed up our healthcare system is.... 

I learned that End of Life expense was the number 1 reason for bankruptcy in the U.S. and that over 75% of Americans want to die at home and yet only 25% do – half of us are not getting what we want – what we are entitled to - and paying dearly for it. 

I was shocked – but outrage quickly turned to inspiration – and it occurred to me that How We End Our Lives is the most important and costly conversation America isn’t having. We talk about war and the environment – but we don’t talk about Death – of all of these issues that face us – Death is the most certain. 

 In the past 20 years I have found that the dinner table is an immensely powerful place to have difficult conversations – deepen relationships – and begin action. In the next six months – myself and design firm Civilization – will be building a beautiful interactive website and mobile platform to give everyone the tools to stop – set a table – and host a conversation that is definitely not just about our final days – but how we want to live to the fullest – and honor the wishes of those we love most. We have been working with zero budget for the last nine months – thanks to the generosity and support of the University of Washington and Olson Kundig architects. 

We have gathered a rock star advisor board of some of the most influential and brilliant people in Health Care and Wellness – and now we need a little help finishing up the work so that we can share it with the world – and everyone can have access to this life affirming work.

 

What Are You Funding? 

Design firm CIVILIZATION has been working tirelessly on this project for the past nine months without funding or payment. To complete the interactive website in time for our launch on August 24th - we need $10,000. The money will be spent paying engineers and programmers who will work around the clock to ensure our vision is realized. 

Deathoverdinner.org is a 501(c)3 Nonprofit division of Engage With Grace. 

Founder, Michael Hebb, will not be taking a single penny from this project, either in the development phase or during the life of the project. 

 

Our Launch! 

 

Let’s Have Dinner and Talk About Death (LHD) partners with the Elisabeth Kubler-Ross Foundation to launch national discussion about end of life decision making on August 24, 2013

On March 14, 2013, The University of Washington Communication Leadership Program, Michael Hebb and Engage With Grace in partnership with 30 leaders in healthcare and wellness launched the introductory micro-site www.deathoverdinner.org – to raise awareness about the upcoming launch of our full site on August 24. The past three months have brought a significant amount of media coverage, a TEDMED talk, an immensely successful indiegogo campaign, and a dozen new partnerships for the growing project.

In tribute to the groundbreaking work of the late Elisabeth Kubler-Ross – Deathoverdinner.org will partner with the Elisabeth Kubler-Ross Foundation, president Dianne Gray and Elisabeth’s son, Ken Ross – to launch the Let’s Have Dinner (“LHD”) project with a global evening of dinners. “It is our hope to organize dozens if not hundreds of international death dinners on August 24th – to honor Elisabeth on the day she passed away,” said Dianne Gray.  Dinner hosts and guests will be given access to the full version of deathoverdinner.org two weeks before the official launch. The full site will lead individuals and groups through the process of hosting and engaging in thoughtful and meaningful end-of-life decision-making events.

 

 

Early Media Coverage of our Project

The interest in Deathoverdinner.org has been staggering, we are currently in talks with many major news outlets regarding our launch. Here are some examples of early media coverage. 

- 2013 TEDMED Talk from Kennedy Center 

- KUOW/NPR

- Health Care Blog

- Reuters 

- Seattle Times 

- UW TV

- UW Department of Communication

story:
Short Summary

The fate of the struggling American colonies depends on the actions of one man...

Time separates hero from villain and friend from foe. After an act of treason, committed at the request of King George III, Captain Arthur F. Nelson and his crew find themselves the victims of a set-up that leads them straight to the gallows.

As their death sentence is read aloud, the curse of Blood Bones is set in motion once again, transporting them several hundred years in the future.

Captain Nelson leads a group of his loyal comrades on a daunting quest to return back to 1763 to save Benjamin Manry and the remaining crew that were captured by the cutthroat Richard Highmore.

Follow Captain Nelson and his colleagues as they go under ‘pirate’ cover in this exciting and fast-paced story. Will they succeed in the rescue of our young hero? Or will they fail in their efforts? 

The fate of the future United States of America rests in Benjamin Manry’s rescue...

 

My name is Owen Palmiotti. I'm 27 years old. I tend to keep busy: I teach navigation at SUNY Maritime, am a reservist in the US Navy, pursuing my Masters degree, and write short stories/novels/screenplays. Benjamin Manry and the Scarlet Stone is the third novel of an open-ended trilogy. I'd like to do a few more books down the road, but for now it's all about marketing and spreading the word about the Young Adult Fiction series.

The Benjamin Manry series actually started when I was 13 years old. I had this "recurring" dream that literally lasted a month straight. Each night, I added more to it, until finally, I told all my friends and family. They loved it. They pushed me to write, and write I did. That was over half my life ago! Where does time go? Seriously?

My goal is to raise money to cover the expenses of self-publishing. Between publishing costs, editing costs, and all the minor fees that add up, I'd like to attempt to break even upon the release of the book (I wish I thought of using Indiegogo for the first two books!). That would be amazing if WE could accomplish this :)

I use the word WE, because it really is about you and me. Without a reader, my book would sit on a shelf and collect dust. We can't let that happen!

Obviously, raising $2,500 is my initial goal, but I've got my eyes set on bigger and better things: movie deals, book signing tours, etc. I arranged twelve events/signings back in 2012, and am already scheduling a big Summer/Fall tour for 2013. 

What I think separates myself from other authors is that I dress in character. My main character's name is Benjamin Manry. He's this really odd (based off me of course) guy from modern day who discovers a cursed pirate treasure. After being sent back to 1763, he sort of creates a footstep that changes history. 

It's kind of epic, seriously.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the details:

As stated earlier, I would like to raise $2,500 to cover the cost of publishing/editing, as well as schedule a book signing tour. I'd like the tour to cover the globe, but that's pretty ambitious of me. I'll be honest, I love standing in front of people telling them about my characters, my stories, and myself.

If you contribute and become part of the Owen Team, I'll hook you up with an autographed book with a personalized inscription upon its release. Maybe even a photograph of me dressed as Benjamin Manry. I'm also thinking of personalized visits in costume. Schools? Birthday Parties? It doesn't matter :) Those are sort of low-ball things, but if you want to really help me out, I'll even put you in my next book! Imagine...a character with your name, based off you...all because you helped out a little guy like me? If you don't think that's awesome, I am at a loss for words! On a scale of 1 to excited, where are ya?!

 

The Impact

Since I was a kid, I've always had this big dream of walking into a little book store in an airport on the other side of the world. I'd be browsing for some random book waiting on a connection flight...and guess what I see? My book!

I published my first novel in 2008, and have been pursuing the endeavor since. The most memorable thing so far was when I was just arriving at a store for a signing and ACTUALLY bumping into someone I didn't know who was waiting for it to start. There was a family who heard about it through a friend who read my first book, and it was the coolest thing in the world.

Your contribution will make all the difference:

The series tie together many elements that are appealing: history and youthful adventure, time travel, pirates, and a love interest that spans centuries. It makes children, as well as older readers, learn a little bit of the build-up to American Independence, while having fun. I've put my time into the writing and research component of the trilogy, and by combining all of those ingredients, have created an awesome literary recipe!

I've been voted most handsome sailor/writer by my grandmother, so that must count for something!

But in all seriousness, I've always had a gut feeling my writing would go somewhere. No I have the chance. With your help of course!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, don't worry about it!

It'd be awesome if you could spread the word about the upcoming project:

Tell your friends.

Tell your family.

Tell your enemies.

Tell passerbys.

Let's do this :)

-Owen

Imagine...a character with your name, based off you...all because you helped out a little guy like me? If you don't think that's awesome, I am at a loss for words! On a scale of 1 to excited, where are ya?!
 


The Impact
Since I was a kid, I've always had this big dream of walking into a little book store in an airport on the other side of the world. I'd be browsing for some random book waiting on a connection flight...and guess what I see? My book!
I published my first novel in 2008, and have been pursuing the endeavor since. The most memorable thing so far was when I was just arriving at a store for a signing and ACTUALLY bumping into someone I didn't know who was waiting for it to start. There was a family who heard about it through a friend who read my first book, and it was the coolest thing in the world.
Your contribution will make all the difference:
The series tie together many elements that are appealing: history and youthful adventure, time travel, pirates, and a love interest that spans centuries. It makes children, as well as older readers, learn a little bit of the build-up to American Independence, while having fun. I've put my time into the writing and research component of the trilogy, and by combining all of those ingredients, have created an awesome literary recipe!
I've been voted most handsome sailor/writer by my grandmother, so that must count for something!
But in all seriousness, I've always had a gut feeling my writing would go somewhere. No I have the chance. With your help of course!
 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute, don't worry about it!
It'd be awesome if you could spread the word about the upcoming project:
Tell your friends.
Tell your family.
Tell your enemies.
Tell passerbys.

Let's do this :)
-Owen

story:
About

TINY SWEETS is a cookbook written by Kira Sfiligoi.

 The book has the following sections:

Fundamentals:This is where I'll be able to list needed tools for all the adorable desserts, and some new techniques that will help you achieve level of deliciousness you have always dreamed of.

Includes:

  • Tools you'll need or want!
  • Stamping Cookies!
  • Making cupcake wrappers!
  • Filling Cupcakes!
  • The use of luster dust!
  • Cake Truffles!
  • Mini Cakes! (The easy way!)
  • and more!

 

Fresh & Chilled: This chapter focuses on desserts using fresh, healthy ingredients and desserts have been chilled to perfection.

Includes:

  • Balsalmic Strawberries!
  • Fruit Salsa with cinnamon chips!
  • Berry Ice Cream!
  • Kulfi!
  • Apple Pie Ice Cream!
  • and more!

Contained: This chapter is dedicated to desserts presented in cups.

Includes:

  • Breakfast Creme Brulee!
  • Veiled Country Lass! (aka Bondepige med Slør)
  • Apple Crumble!
  • and more!

 

 

Baked: Cake is pretty great, and this chapter is dedicated to creating tiny, delicious morsels of it and other baked goods!

Includes

  • Calfloutis!
  • Vanilla cake!
  • French Toast Cake!
  • Chocolate Cake!
  • Rum cake!
  • Coconut Cake
  • and more!

 

Fillings and Frosting: I'm told you can't have a cake without frosting, so this chapter is dedicated to creating that sweet, sticky goodness.

Includes:

  • Maple Meringue Buttercream!
  • Swiss Meringue Buttercream!
  • Citrus Cream!
  • Royal Icing!
  • and more!

 

If the funding is successful, the book will be published in two formats:

  • A paperback, perfect bound edition for retail distribution

  • A epub edition for Kindle, Kobo, iPad and retail distribution

 

Books will go to printing upon the completion of funding.

 

About Kira

I've loved baking for a long time. As a child, I'd spend my days pouring over recipe books in my grandmother's home or watching her knead dough, cut cookies or glaze a coffeecake. These sweets still remind me of my childhood; whether it be a slice of sweet and tart lemon cake or the silky smooth inside of a butter tart.

 

Now I'm a teacher with an additional fine arts degree and I believe thoroughly in sharing baking success in order to make our own recipes and the recipes of others better. I'd like to share my recipes with you.

 

What I need and What you get

Funding covers the cost of making the recipies, distribution rights, ISBN purchasing, printing, editing, photography and other misc costs related directly to the book.

 

Other ways you can help

  • If you'd love to help, but aren't sure about putting down cold, hard cash you can always tell your loved ones, co-workers, and people you pass by on the street.

  • If you're internet savvy, feel free to share us!

story:
Introduction

Over the last 6 months I've been writing my first book; The Winner's Guide. A book, I wholeheartedly believe can inspire millions of people around the world to break free from a job they don't enjoy to find happiness, contentment and financial freedom doing what they love to do whilst following their dreams.

Using my own personal experience, intertwined with practical advice and knowledge which I've been blessed with along the journey - I have created a book I believe will capture the hearts of it's readers and help them find the belief in themselves to pursue their dreams and find true happiness in their lives.

I want to teach people the following;

  • To think positively and understand the power of their minds.

  • To find and monetize their passion, finding financial freedom from anywhere in the world.

  • To find true love and develop meaningful relationships with friends and family.

  • To find happiness, health and contentment in all aspects of their lives.

  • To wake up every morning, with a sense of excitement and joy for the day ahead.

And much more.

About The Book

AUTHOR

Kyle Hill

ONE-SENTENCE DESCRIPTION

This book offers encouragement and empowers readers to break free from the mundane 9-5 existence, follow their dreams and do what they love to do.

CATEGORY

Self-Help/Personal Development

The Audience

The hundreds of millions of people worldwide who are unhappily working a job they don’t really like, struggling day in and day out to make ends meet - just to pay their ever increasing bills, taxes and debts. The book is primarily targeted towards people in the 18 - 35 age group and is unbiased toward any religion, culture or sex.

Purpose And Need

Everyday there are billions of people across the globe, waking up to do a job they don’t like or want; just to live within their means and live a mediocre life. People are becoming fed up of this way of life, and The Winner’s Guide is the answer to their problems.

The most amazing, talented and gifted people in the world are forgoing a life of unlimited wealth, happiness and success because the economic system we’re all part of has conditioned people to believe that living our dreams is something outwith our ability.

In reality, every single human being on the planet has the ability and opportunity to do something great with their lives, if only they can begin to change their thinking to that of a winner. The Winner’s Guide introduces its readers to a way of thinking that will change their lives forever.

The Winner’s Guide is a beautifully composed inspirational true story of how an unhappy, uneducated young man finds himself stuck in a job he hates, working tirelessly just make ends meet - wondering if life is really worth living? Through an unfortunate chain of events and stroke of luck, he is gifted with knowledge that completely changes his life for the better. Equipped with this new knowledge, he embarks on a breathtaking journey full of exciting twists and turns, romantic encounters, and incredible highs and lows. A journey that would help him discover his purpose, find true love, success and happiness in the process.

This book is written in plain English, designed to appeal to readers from all backgrounds, cultures, religions and experiences. It’s easily accessible to those who don’t know much about the power of their minds, yet the book’s message is solidly evangelical, theologically accurate, and culturally informed. The chapters include contemporary real-life stories and insights from a wide spectrum of scenarios and life lessons.

PROPOSED BLURB


ABOUT THE AUTHOR

Not one for following conventional paths in his young life, Kyle Hill is a born serial entrepreneur with a burning desire to make a positive difference in the world.

Author’s Mission: To inspire and give people the opportunity to find true happiness, living the life of their dreams and doing what they were born to do.

Kyle is a self-made, self-driven success story and has various successful online ventures under his belt. He prides himself in having generated over £500,000 in online sales without any direct advertising spend.

Starting his first online business with meagre 3 figure sum in 2010, Kyle went on to achieve sales in excess of £15,000 per month within 6 months of starting up.

Kyle’s business experience includes, but certainly isn’t limited to, negotiating high value investment deals, launching and marketing innovative products across various media platforms and influencing and inspiring 1000’s of people around the world.

Kyle continues to motivate, inspire and actively encourage others to approach life in a similar manner, regularly coaching and consulting for businesses ranging from start-ups to public traded companies.

Kyle's journey has seen him travel the world, gaining invaluable life experience that has all, in some way, contributed to the creation of what will soon become an international best seller - ‘The Winner’s Guide’.

AUTHOR PROMOTION

Kyle is an Internet marketing expert (6+ years experience, over £500k in sales online) who will proactively promote The Winner’s Guide via various digital channels. As well, the author has created The Winner’s Guide Web site (www.winnersguide.com), which will be home to an influential blog and a wide variety of valuable ‘Self-Help’ content designed to attract high volumes of traffic to the brand.

Kyle is also developing other mass media and e-promotional author promotion strategies that will reach the target audience. For example, Kyle would like to run an advertising campaign on bus, train and underground services in most major cities – targeted at unhappy commuters on their way to work.

What We Need & What You Get

How The Campaign Money Will Be Spent:

  • £2,200 in initial stock to cover contributor rewards and introducing the book to various eBook providers.
  • £1,000 for the development of WinnersGuide.com
  • £800 for professional editing services.
  • £1,000 for miscellaneous legal costs such as campaign funding, trademark protection, ISBN numbers etc.

I feel this financial start would provide a strong launch platform to bring this book to the market successfully. I'm confident with my vast experience in online marketing, combined with the attraction of the book - the business can become self sufficient and I'll be able to reach more people with my message. As I'm self-publishing, the book has to be regarded as a business which must grow in order for the book to reach more people.

Questions

Why Do The Book Perks Seem Expensive?

Not only will you receive one of the very first copies of what I believe will be an international best seller. You'll also be contributing to bringing the idea to reality. In a way, you'll be doing your own piece for changing the world.

What Happens If I Don't Reach My Target?

I'm confident we will reach the target. However, if I don't you will still receive your perk as I'll find alternative funding to cover my costs.

Why I Don't Want To Have It Professionally Published?

Although I've considered this option carefully - I believe the people this book will benefit the most, are the people that wouldn't normally purchase a book or aren't in a position to pay for it. It's my intention to eventually (within 6-12 months) give the Winner's Guide away for free as a Kindle/eBook download, so everyone has the opportunity to benefit from it. Giving a book away for free, isn't something the big publishers are interested in doing.

Will I Profit From The Book?

Writing the Winner's Guide was never about the money. I've reached a point in my life where I'm happy with or without money, and this is part of what I want to share with the world. As you'll learn from the book, I wrote the Winner's Guide as a gift.

Of course, the Winner's Guide brand will generate revenue through the sale of the physical book and advertising on our website (www.winnersguide.com) - but rest assured a significant percentage of this revenue will be reinvested into marketing and distributing the book in different languages to help more people benefit from it.

Which Stage Is The Book At?

The book is approximately 95% complete just now. I've written 170 pages, 53000 words and I estimate there will be 190 -200 pages, 70000 words. I'm in the final process of piecing together my story and would like to write about this fundraising experience within the book, so I can advise others on how to do it when they find their purpose. The book then needs to be professionally edited, proofread and given to a select number of people to gather feedback.

Once I'm satisfied the book is ready, we'll have the first run of copies printed and dispatched to everyone who has contributed to the campaign. We'll then launch the book on our website and Amazon for public sale. 

You can download the introduction chapter as a PDF here.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Like the Facebook page: here.
  • Subscribe to our mailing list here: WinnersGuide.com (no spam guaranteed!)
  • Professional Editor or Influential Person? Get in touch.
  • Buy the book when it goes on sales Summer 2014.

Samples Of My Work

You can download the introduction chapter in PDF format: here.

This following example is taken from my blog:

Moments: How To Live In Them

We’ve all had good and bad times in our lives. Those incredible moments where you find yourself wanting to live forever and those moments where it seems like your world is caving in.

It’s the roller coaster ride of being a human being.

In the context of a roller coaster. Our youth is the beginning of the ride and we shoot off into the unknown. We climb a daunting hill only to reach the peak, pause, reflect, love the thrill of the moment and suddenly we drop into the massive loop of life. Our stomachs churn with terror but it’s fine, we know everything’s going to be OK. We know it’s part of the ride and that we have faith that we’ll reach the end in one piece before we even know it.

The moral of the story. You cannot change the past (you’re already on the ride), you have no control over the future – the only thing that is certain is the end. So instead of worrying about something you cannot change, or something you cannot control – why not focus your entire attention on the ride, the moment. Feel it, enjoy it, know that everything happens for a reason.

Have faith that if you live in and for the moment, the future will take care of itself.

- You may copy and redistribute this article provided you link back to the campaign or winnersguide.com

story:
Who are we? What are we up to?

The Throw! Slam Team is a group of five poets headed to Victoria to represent Montreal at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word (CFSW). We'll be competing against spoken word artists from across Canada in the national poetry slam championships.

What's a poetry slam?! A slam is a performance poetry competition. We compete to make people have feelings. Is it as weird as it sounds? Yes. Is it as awesome as it sounds? Yes. There will be crying. There will be laughing. There will be hugs and magic and some serious poetic debates about just about everything there is to care about in the world right now.

There are slams all over Canada, and CFSW is the gathering ground for the best performance poets in the country. The 2014 Throw! team is made of the top five Montreal poets from this year's slam season. We've been competing, we've been writing, we've been practicing, we've been having important business meetings in each other's living rooms, and we're ready to go! Now we just need to get there.

Why We Need Your Help


Victoria and Montreal are far away. According to google maps, it would take us 903 hours to walk there, and we would probably drown. Donating will help cover the cost of our plane tickets and a room for us to sleep in. If we meet our funding goal, that covers almost two tickets. Or part of a ticket for everyone. Or the whole hotel room!

Why it will be Welllll Worth it...

...For you:

We are all ready to pour our poetic souls into creating great personalized perks for you. Get a free chapbook or poetry CD! Have your adventures immortalized in a ballad! Present your lover/friend/ cat with a haiku all about them and earn their eternal admiration! Cheer yourself up with a love poem dedicated to you and only you by a team member of your choice.

...For us:

Although this is a brand new team, all of us have been writing, performing, and competing for a long time to reach this moment. CFSW 2014 will be an incredible experience where we will have opportunities to grow as poets and share our words with a national audience.

...For everyone else:

Slam makes poetry cool. Poetry is already cool, but a lot people don't notice that until they experience spoken word. Events like the Throw! Slam and CFSW open up the literary world to people who never realized they wanted to be part of it and give a voice to anyone who has something important to say (ie. Everyone). By traveling to Victoria for CFSW, our team will have a chance to connect with the Canadian poetry community and bring what we learn back to Montreal.

Meet the Team:

Rabbit Richards’ performance poetry is written with precision and empathy to reach you at gut level. Her stories invite you to join her in her world and highlight the small details that evoke memory. A native of Brooklyn, New York, she currently calls Montreal home. Rabbit is the 2014 Throw! Slam Champion and Team Captain. She is a member of the Kalmunity Vibe Collective and this will be her second time participating in CFSW.

Contact: chase.runrabbitrun@gmail.com

Web

Halogen aka "Jenny Smart" aka "who's that girl sitting in a tree in a pirate costume and why is she blowing bubbles at us?" is a poet, a performer, and maybe a human (probably not.) This is her second time competing at CFSW and her first time as a member of the Throw! Team. She studies Creative Writing at Concordia University, where she is a poetry editor for Soliloquies Anthology and co-founder of Discordia Poetry Collective. Her work has appeared in print in Headlight Anthology, What If? Magazine, The New Quarterly.Halogen enjoys hugs and talking to plants. She suspects she is the imaginary friend of her own shadow.

Contact: halogen.poetry@gmail.com

Blog (Halogen Anomalies on Wordpress)

Youtube (HalogenGlass)

fisher king is avoiding the name "adam fisher" because there're far too many of those around. he's a south african born and raised, has spent twelve years in israel and is now learning how to apologize in an effort to become a true canadian. his disdain for capital letters, however, is not something he's willing to apologize for. fisher king is a software developer by day and a literature student, a poet and a comic writer by the light of those dimensions that cannot be measured by time. he is thoroughly thrilled to be a part of the throw! team representing his favourite city in the world at cfsw!

https://www.facebook.com/fisher.king.poet

http://www.fisherkingpoet.com

Herie Sun is a first time member of the Throw! Team. He studies Neuroscience at McGill University and couldn't write his own bio because he's taking his MCAT right now.

Ellana Blacher will be heading to CFSW for the first time this year. She enjoys poetry and probably ice cream.

  • Tell your friends! Share our campaign, share our poetry videos, tell fun anecdotes about us at parties, quote us in inspirational speeches...

  • Come to our shows. We'll keep you posted about them HERE. and HERE.

Who are we? What are we up to?

The Throw! Slam Team is a group of five
poets headed to Victoria to represent Montreal at the Canadian
Festival of Spoken Word (CFSW). We'll
be competing against spoken word artists from across Canada in the
national poetry slam championships.

What's a poetry slam?! A slam is a
performance poetry competition. We compete to make people have
feelings. Is it as weird as it sounds? Yes. Is it as awesome as it
sounds? Yes. There will be crying. There will be laughing. There will
be hugs and magic and some serious poetic debates about just about
everything there is to care about in the world right now.

There are slams all over Canada, and
CFSW is the gathering ground for the best performance poets in the
country. The 2014 Throw! team is made of the top five Montreal poets
from this year's slam season. We've been competing, we've been
writing, we've been practicing, we've been having important business
meetings in each other's living rooms, and we're ready to go! Now we
just need to get there.

Why We Need Your Help
Victoria and Montreal are far away.
According to google maps, it would take us 903 hours to walk there,
and we would probably drown.  Donating will help cover the cost of
our plane tickets and a room for us to sleep in. If we meet our
funding goal, that covers almost two tickets. Or part of a ticket for
everyone. Or the whole hotel room!

Why it will be Welllll Worth it...


...For you: 
We are all ready to
pour our poetic souls into creating great personalized perks for you.
Get a free chapbook or poetry CD! Have your adventures immortalized
in a ballad! Present your lover/friend/ cat with a haiku all about

story:
Short Summary

Venus Genius: The Female Prescription for Innovation.

My book will explore the world of innovation, the mysteries of the masculine and feminine brains - if such entities exist - as well as some juicy anecdotes of women’s daily lives in a world designed by men. It ends with a description of the feminine success formula: how to unlock some of your feminine traits to create meaningful and sustainable innovation that emotionally connects with consumers and brings value to the organization.

My name is Fabienne Jacquet and I am the author of Venus Genius: the Female Prescription for Innovation. I wrote this book because, in both my personal and professional life, I felt the need to reconnect to the feminine energy. In my 30+ years of experience in innovation and through research, I observed that creating from our emotions and heart is absolutely critical to create meaningful and sustainable innovation. And it’s not about “touchy-feeling.” It’s about business. Indeed, the female market represents a $20+ trillion opportunity. It’s untapped potential: research shows that most businesses fall short with female consumers because they are not maximizing their emotional bond with them.

So far, innovation has been mostly driven by process and rationale thinking. It’s time for women to have their voice at the innovation table, which has been dominated by the masculine for socio-historical reasons. I also believe that it is time for all innovators, regardless of their gender, to reconnect with their feminine energy to round up their skills profile and create meaningful innovation.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you have latent feminine skills and that, wherever you start in the masculine/feminine spectrum, rebalancing towards the opposite makes you a more centered human being in your personal and professional life. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for “innovation from the heart” in you. Ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand innovation, what makes it connect with people and how you can contribute to it.

In this book, you'll learn about the masculine and feminine brains contribution to innovation and how feminine traits like empathy, nurturing or intuition are key to create sustainable innovation. You'll read about stories including:

  • How a young French chef used this feminine success formula to innovate a male-dominated industry
  • How starting from emotions allowed me to create successful innovation in a mundane category like shower gel
  • How communities of women became the solution to creating sexual toys dedicated to female pleasure.

You will love this book if you are curious about (and maybe intimidated by) innovation, and if you are interested in the masculine/feminine spectrum.

Venus Genius is a non-fiction book that speaks to anybody who wants to tackle innovation under a different angle, regardless of their gender. You can be an innovator in a big company who wants to make a difference, a startup or a small business owner who doesn’t know where to start with innovation, or an HR professional who wants to retain talents by empowering and motivating them.

This book is especially suited for any company (small or big) who sells products targeted to women and wants to reach them more efficiently.

 

The Book - Venus Genius: The Female Prescription for Innovation.

The book is written in 4 Parts....

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1-4. This section is about “How we got here.” You will understand why innovation has been driven by masculine energy so far and why current innovation does not really deliver (hint: what about emotions?). We will try to demystify innovation by defining what it is and giving examples. We will show how both the masculine and feminine energies need to be combined for successful innovation, thanks to a journey into the masculine and feminine brains (if such entities exist).

Part 2 contains Chapters 5-6. This section describes the opportunity for the future of innovation. You will discover how the $20 trillion female market is underserved and why. We will follow a woman in her day in a world designed by men. You will also take a trip in the future, exploring how the next wave of innovation will be female. Women are naturally good at innovation and women entrepreneurs are very successful.

Part 3 contains Chapters 7-13. This is the reveal of the feminine success formula for innovation:


We will detail the 6 traits of the feminine innovator (regardless of gender): empathy, inclusivity, nurturing, intuition, gratitude and collaboration. For each, we will cover what it is not, what it is, why it is important for innovation (with examples and stories), and finally how to practice with 6 tips that will help you in your innovation journey.

Part 4 is Chapter 14. At this point, you are wondering if this famous formula works. You will go through two case studies in very different industries. We will first cover a very successful story describing how applying the feminine success formula for innovation worked. We will then analyze how a big innovation project in the airline industry turned out to be a failure and how having followed the success formula may have saved the project.

And then we will conclude.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

  • The Editor and I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in winter 2020
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Fabienne Jacquet is half-French, half-American, half-scientist and half-marketer… yes, too many halves, but as they say in French: “when you love, you don’t count.”

She holds a PhD in Organic Chemistry and moved to Marketing in the middle of her career. Innovation has been her love for more than 30 years and she has a proven track record in Fortune 500 companies like Colgate-Palmolive. In 2018, she created INNOVEVE®, a consultancy in innovation that helps businesses increase the value of their innovation by rebalancing the feminine and masculine traits.

She wrote this book because a lot of people have a misconception of innovation and don’t know how to tackle it. In addition, after having innovated for more than 31 years in a corporate context, she felt the need to share her knowledge to help any business/individual innovate, especially when it comes to reconnecting to the feminine traits for a more sustainable and meaningful innovation.

This book also describes her personal journey from the masculine to the feminine through lessons learned, people met, and the beautiful wisdom that comes with age.

For more information you can connect with Fabienne Jacquet at contact@innoveve.com and
www.linkedin.com/in/fabienne-jacquet as well as @innovevellc on other social media platforms.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #venusgeniusinnovation and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Fabienne

story:
Story of my Book

In this book, you’ll join me in using language to render distinct aspects of Pilipino culture, history, and the Pilipino-American identity through poems like:

Ferdinand Magellan

Takes readers to a specific moment in elementary school where I was learning about Ferdinand Magellan and a picture of the Philippine islands and the Philippine hero, Lapu-Lapu, appears in the textbook. This was the first and only time I ever saw my culture represented in mainstream education.

Unfortunately, I was singled out in class by my teacher and classmates and was asked why “my people” “murdered” the greatest voyager in history—Ferdinand Magellan.

Hirap Buhay 'Merica - Life is Hard in America

Takes a look at the experiences of immigrants who have just moved to America and the unspoken struggles and realities that family and friends in the motherland don’t hear about.

It takes the reader to a time in my childhood where I’m running late to the bus with my Godmother and we miss it. As we watch the bus speed away, my 3-year-old self lets out a sigh and says, “Hirap buhay 'merica” or “Life is hard in America.”

Halo-Halo

This is a response poem to a boy who called me a "mutt." I use the iconic Pilipino dessert, Halo-Halo, as an overarching metaphor to describe the various cultures that the Philippines has been influenced by.

I love that these poems take a slice from specific moments in my childhood that are not only so familiar and nostalgic to many immigrants and BIPOC, but also teach the reader and myself lessons on Pilipino-American and Philippine history and culture.
 

The Book: Halo-Halo

The book is written into 4 Chapters:

Chapter 1: History contains poems that pertain to the topics of Pilipino history, Pilipino-American history, or American history. I dedicate poems to iconic historical figures and poets such as Jose Rizal, Andres Bonifacio, Maria Lorena Barros, and Dr. Dawn Malabon. I also write poems about the Manongs of the Delano Grape Strike, the International Hotel, and important dates concerning the Filipino-American war, Philippine Independence, American Independence, etc.

Chapter 2: Culture explores Pilipino community conditions such as the glorification of Eurocentric features (skin whitening, "tall" noses, etc.) and notable features of Pilipino culture such as the emphasis on family, faith, generosity, and unity. I celebrate and critique these parts of Pilipino culture and continue to struggle through the ongoing battle of outdated beliefs and key traditions that are essential to Pilipino culture.

Chapter 3: Revolution and Revelation dives deep into politics. From the politics in the Philippines to the current political tensions here in the United States, and the parallels between the two. I write poetry detailing my feelings, thoughts, and perspectives about political leaders and political movements. I explore what it means to advocate and be an activist and what that means in regards to Pilipino culture.

Chapter 4: Identity The last chapter of the book is a self-reflection after learning about my history, culture, and my passion for activism and advocacy. It begins with a childhood experience about my confusion and loss of my cultural identity. As readers go through the chapter, however, there is more clarity, resilience, and pride about my identity as a Pilipino-American.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. Part of our agreement is to host a pre-order campaign that will cover the costs of publishing, which include:

My wonderful Editors that revise my manuscript to be published in April 2021.

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Spring, 2021

Indiegogo allows me to safely collect everybody's payment information and addresses. Pre-sale buyers will get all the perks as promised AND will get a copy of Halo-Halo before post-sale buyers.

About the Author

Justine Ramos is a first-generation Pilipinx immigrant and recent UCLA Alumna (C/O 2020) with degrees in English, Human Biology and Society, and Global Health. She is an aspiring occupational therapist, currently works at the Children's Hospital Los Angeles, and is looking forward to completing her higher degrees on the East Coast.

She has performed, competed, and judged in the Slam Poetry/Spoken Word world throughout high school and college. She has been able to coach her own slam team, mentor young poets, found UCLA's only slam poetry organization, win awards with the LA Youth Poet Laureate Program and later become published with WriteGirl, Teen Ink Literary Magazine, and Cornell University's literary magazine, Rainy Day.

She was inspired to write this book because she felt the need to tell the stories of her community, country, people, and family that often go untold and ignored. She hopes to share these stories to remind people that they aren’t alone in these experiences of struggle and their exploration of identity.

She despises talking about herself in the third person and is an avid quarantine baker. To quote her high school teacher, she is "intellectually engaging, fearless and fun, though occasionally snarky and unapologetically blunt." She is an expert in having too many hobbies and has an intense obsession with One Direction and Avatar Kiyoshi from Avatar: The Last Air Bender. In her free time, she bonds with her three dogs and pesters her little brother when she is in need of attention.

For more information, you can connect with Justine at halohalo.poetry@gmail.com and @halohalo.poetry or @justiney.r on Instagram.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #HaloHaloPoetry and tag me as well as my publisher, #NewDegreePress, so we can help amplify our efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Maraming Salamat! (Thank you very much!) 
Justine Ramos
story_txt:
Story of my Book
In this book, you’ll join me in using language to render distinct aspects of Pilipino culture, history, and the Pilipino-American identity through poems like:
Ferdinand Magellan
Takes readers to a specific moment in elementary school where I was learning about Ferdinand Magellan and a picture of the Philippine islands and the Philippine hero, Lapu-Lapu, appears in the textbook. This was the first and only time I ever saw my culture represented in mainstream education.
Unfortunately, I was singled out in class by my teacher and classmates and was asked why “my people” “murdered” the greatest voyager in history—Ferdinand Magellan.
Hirap Buhay 'Merica - Life is Hard in America
Takes a look at the experiences of immigrants who have just moved to America and the unspoken struggles and realities that family and friends in the motherland don’t hear about.
It takes the reader to a time in my childhood where I’m running late to the bus with my Godmother and we miss it. As we watch the bus speed away, my 3-year-old self lets out a sigh and says, “Hirap buhay 'merica” or “Life is hard in America.”
Halo-Halo
This is a response poem to a boy who called me a "mutt." I use the iconic Pilipino dessert, Halo-Halo, as an overarching metaphor to describe the various cultures that the Philippines has been influenced by.I love that these poems take a slice from specific moments in my childhood that are not only so familiar and nostalgic to many immigrants and BIPOC, but also teach the reader and myself lessons on Pilipino-American and Philippine history and culture. The Book: Halo-Halo
The book is written into 4 Chapters:Chapter 1: History contains poems that pertain to the topics of Pilipino history, Pilipino-American history, or American history. I dedicate poems to iconic historical figures and poets such as Jose Rizal, Andres Bonifacio, Maria Lorena Barros, and Dr. Dawn Malabon. I also write poems about the Manongs of the Delano Grape Strike, the International Hotel, and important dates concerning the Filipino-American war, Philippine Independence, American Independence, etc.Chapter 2: Culture explores Pilipino community conditions such as the glorification of Eurocentric features (skin whitening, "tall" noses, etc.) and notable features of Pilipino culture such as the emphasis on family, faith, generosity, and unity. I celebrate and critique these parts of Pilipino culture and continue to struggle through the ongoing battle of outdated beliefs and key traditions that are essential to Pilipino culture.Chapter 3: Revolution and Revelation dives deep into politics. From the politics in the Philippines to the current political tensions here in the United States, and the parallels between the two. I write poetry detailing my feelings, thoughts, and perspectives about political leaders and political movements. I explore what it means to advocate and be an activist and what that means in regards to Pilipino culture.Chapter 4: Identity The last chapter of the book is a self-reflection after learning about my history, culture, and my passion for activism and advocacy. It begins with a childhood experience about my confusion and loss of my cultural identity. As readers go through the chapter, however, there is more clarity, resilience, and pride about my identity as a Pilipino-American.
What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. Part of our agreement is to host a pre-order campaign that will cover the costs of publishing, which include:
My wonderful Editors that revise my manuscript to be published in April 2021.
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The Copyediting for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book when I ultimately publish in Spring, 2021

story:
It's Not Too Late!

Thanks to the generous support of backers like you, we reached our minimum goal of $2,000! The crowdfunder is still live, so you can still pre-order your Legacy Edition hardcover of Maximus while supplies last! Select any perk from the right to increase the impact of Maximus.

 

Book Summary

It's 64 A.D. at the height of the Roman Empire. Maximus is rising through the ranks of the wealthy class when the Great Fire of Rome threatens to bring his estate – and betrothed marriage – to ruins. Emperor Nero is intent on crushing Paulus and a mysterious group called The Way. Maximus must risk everything when he embraces the faith he swore to destroy.  Maximus: The Quest for Greatness is an adventure-filled novel that brings the sweeping drama of first century Christianity to life!

The theme of Maximus is discovering the path to true greatness and embracing humility in the service of Christ. It explores the frailty of pagan philosophies, the power of the gospel to save sinners, and what it means to suffer for the sake of Christ.

 

About the Author & the Campaign

My name is Shane Eash. I'm from Lancaster County, PA, and I'm the author of Maximus: The Quest for Greatness. History fascinates me! I love reading about interesting people and places, and bringing them alive through storytelling. I'm passionate about using the medium of historical fiction to give teens a love for history and a deeper faith in the One Who authored it.

Maximus is my first historical novel, and it's getting published! While my publisher will do what they can to market the book, publishers these days (even the large ones) expect authors to help get the word out. That's where I need your help. Your participation will extend the reach of Maximus and enable me to get this Christ-honoring story into the hands of more readers. As a thank-you for your contribution, we have some really cool perks, including an autographed, hardback collector's edition of the book, which you'll receive months before the wide release of Maximus next spring! Read on to learn more!

 

 

  Author, Douglas Bond,
  highly recommends Maximus!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Like I explained above, we need your help to extend the reach of Maximus to as many readers as possible. The support you provide will allow us to do the following:

  • Marketing: We will use the funds for advertising on the web, social media, and e-mail marketing. Every dollar you give will help us reach more young people with this Christ-honoring story!
  • Audio Book: We will hire a professional voice actor to record the audio book version. [10/30/20 Update: the voice actor has been hired and he has already made good progress on recording the audio book!]

 

What are the perks?

There are many cool perks like a digital poster download, e-book, Legacy Edition hardcover, and more! Details about each perk are listed in the column to the right. Click on each reward to see what perks are included at each level. I've highlighted a few of the benefits below:

 

Collector's Edition Hardcover

The mass-market paperback version of Maximus will be released in spring 2021, but you - as a VIP backer at the $40 level and up - will get the Legacy Edition Hardcover (complete with cloth-bound cover and dust jacket), months before Maximus is available in stores! The Legacy Edition Hardcover will be a true collector's item - only a limited number of copies are being printed. Once they're gone, they're gone forever!

 

Maximus Audio Book

I'm hiring a professional voice actor to record the unabridged audio book. This audio book will be a great supplement to the printed book for those on-the-go moments when reading isn't possible.

 

For the Temple

G.A. Henty was a master of historical fiction! My all-time favorite Henty book is For the Temple, which is set in a similar time period to Maximus. Through a special arrangement with my publisher, we are able to offer For the Temple as a great companion to Maximus!

For the Temple tells the stirring tale of the last days of the Temple at Jerusalem when under siege by the Roman army in A.D. 70.

 

Stretch Goal

If we can surpass our base goal of $2000, we can have an even greater impact. Anything above our minimum goal we will use in further marketing. You have our promise, not a dollar will be wasted.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

   Historian, Bill Potter, endorses Maximus!

 

 

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign will enable us to:

  • Increase the spread of this uplifting message
  • Enhance the quality of the audio book production
  • Bless and encourage more readers

But remember, you're not just helping us, you'll get awesome rewards in exchange for your support.

 

Risks & Challenges

You exercise very little risk supporting this project. The hardcover is already at the printers, and we are moving forward quickly with all the other perks. However, there is always some risk that unforeseen circumstances could prevent us from delivering some of the perks.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support us with your dollars, we appreciate a quick share on social media. The more this campaign gets shared, the more people can be impacted by the story of Maximus!

  • Make some noise about this campaign on social platforms.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to make it easier!



I’m thrilled to be able to share
this story with you.
Thank you for spreading the word about Maximus: The Quest for Greatness!

story:
For years I put mental and creative pursuits way above the body. Then my body started to give out, first in mostly manageable ways—occasional injuries, osteopenia, immune disorders—and then in one big crash when my poor right hip finally refused to support me.

While I pride myself on my athletic ability, stamina, will power, and knowledge of anatomy, nothing I did could save me from the inevitable: I was going to need a Total Hip Replacement, and fast, because within 2 years I went from acrobat to cripple.

I never wanted to be the Poster Girl for Hip Problems, but this story has just bubbled up from inside me and I have to get it out there. Not because you will (hopefully) ever need hip surgery, but because everyone goes through something. We all have stories of injuries, illnesses, breakups, layoffs, losses of all stripes, and I’m here to tell you that with the right dose of help from all quarters, a sense of humor, and the will to go on, you can get through anything, and come out shining!

My path was messy, full of little setbacks and dark days. But if a broken-down person like me can do it, so can you! Hip Op is not a slick, magical self-help program that you can copy. It’s the story of how one individual used whatever she had on hand—and that means family, friends, good insurance, fantastic doctors, topnotch post-op care, optimism and humor galore—to get to the other side.

I was lucky to be restored to my full strength, flexibility, and stamina. But what I really learned along the way was that that was peanuts—where this really all led
was to my becoming a better person. I ‘m more patient. I’m more generous with my time and expertise when I see anyone in need. I’m less rigid about what I think I need to do and who to be in order to be happy. I’m finally ready to join the human
race—humbly, gratefully, and joyfully.

If I don’t tell my story, no one else can. And then many people facing adversity
may just get discouraged, give up, quit—and worst of all think they are the only ones going through something. A huge part of Hip Op will be online posting of your stories. We need a web of experience, wisdom, and hope to share with all.

I’ve spent the last 20 years teaching yoga and teaching teachers all over the globe (including 16 trips to China!). I run a weekly free/donation injury clinic where I’ve
helped gobs of people work through injuries, eliminate pain, and get back in the
game with nothing more high-tech than my own hands-on work, yoga blocks, straps
and mats. I’ve seen what’s possible, and it’s often within reach.

I work full-time at my teaching and writing, and there’s no way this book is going to
see the light of day unless I can buy a little time to finish writing it and collect some
money to get it published (money goes into editing, design, formatting, and other expenses involved in self-publishing). This is truly a grassroots project, bypassing traditional publishers (too slow), and supported only by the
“angels” who get that this story is real, relevant, and important.

I hope you’re moved to help get this off the ground. Here are 3 ways you can help:

1. Donate! No amount too small, and lots of cool thank-you
gifts await you!

2. Use the indiegogo share tools to get the word out to your people—we all need a bigger web, and who knows whom you might help by sharing the word!

3. Add your own story to my online, ever expanding collection on: http://www.loisnesbittyoga.com/tell-your-story/ Click on the Tell Your Story button and get a free copy of my e-book as a reward!

Thank you!

story:
Qué es #SuperHeroes16

#SuperHeroes16 es un evento en el que los autónomos, pymes y emprendedores del mercado canario aprenden y comparten sinergias. Descubre las motivaciones del evento en nuestra página web.

Durante la jornada del viernes 16 de septiembre tendrán lugar diferentes tipos de actividades:

  • PowerClass: charlas de 15 minutos en las que diferentes profesionales darán los puntos clave de sus temas estrella. En total contaremos con 24 PowerClass.
  • FastPowers: presentaciones de 5 minutos a modo de elevator pitch en las que las empresas y los profesionales muestran sus productos y servicios a los asistentes. El evento contará con 12 FastPowers.
  • Market Place: varias empresas y emprendedores mostrarán productos de interés para otras empresas y emprendedores durante todo el día.
  • Exposición: una selección de viñetas del humorista gráfico Morgan acompañarán el evento durante toda la jornada.
  • Meeting Point: el evento cuenta con un punto de encuentro muy especial en el que los mecenas pueden organizar reuniones y generar proyectos.
  • Networking: a lo largo del evento se destinarán varios momentos del día para favorecer el intercambio de experiencias entre los asistentes.
  • DJ: la jornada terminará con Manel Ruiz 'El Especialista', que amenizará la sesión de beerworking, como colofón final de #SuperHéroes16.

El evento está organizado por NemeSys e Hypergeek, dos de las comunidades de networking más activas en el mercado digital canario.

Cómo Colaborar

Puedes colaborar de dos formas diferentes en #SuperHéroes16: comprando tu entrada o a través de patrocinio. Estas son las diferentes recompensas que hemos creado para el evento:

Entrada SH16 Veloz:

  • La entrada a 5€ para los 30 más rápidos.
  • Especialmente indicada para los superhéroes con el super poder del rayo sónico.
  • Tendrás acceso a todas las conferencias y actividades del evento.

Entrada SH16:

  • La entrada a 7€.
  • Tendrás acceso a todas las conferencias y actividades del evento.
  • Precio de esta entrada en taquilla (si sobran): 10€.
  • Si quieres dos entradas de este tipo, tendrás que adquirir dos veces este tipo de recompensa.

Mecenas SH16:

  • Un patrocinio asequible por 50€.
  • Tu nombre o el de tu empresa en el listado de Mecenas que publicaremos en la web de SuperHéroes16.
  • Dos entradas para el evento del 16 de septiembre con acceso a todas las actividades.

Cómo hacer el pago en Indiegogo

Ser mecenas en Indiegogo es muy fácil siguiendo los pasos que te indica la plataforma, y aún más si ya tienes cuenta de Indiegogo y/o tienes cuenta de PayPal, la tpv virtual de pagos que utiliza Indiegogo.
De todas formas, y para que no te líes, hemos preparado esta pequeña guía con capturas de pantalla de cada uno de los pasos que debes realizar:

Paso 1. Elige tu Recompensa.

Todas las recompensas las tienes a la derecha de este texto. En esta guía hemos elegido como ejemplo la recompensa Entrada SH16 Veloz, de 5€.
Pasa el ratón sobre la recompensa elegida y haz click, y recuerda que si quieres dos entradas como esta, tendrás que repetir todo el proceso explicado aquí, sólo se pueden comprar las entradas de una en una. 

 

Paso 2. Identifícate.

Salvo que te hubieras logueado antes de elegir la recompensa, es en esta pantalla en la que te debes identificar para comprar tu recompensa. Tienes dos opciones:

  • Opción1: No tienes cuenta en Indiegogo ni quieres hacértela. Pincha en Pago de Invitados (1), y rellena tu nombre y apellidos. Podrás marcar o no la opción de que Indiegogo te informe sobre las últimas campañas, novedades y eventos (muy recomendable).
  • Opción 2: Ya tienes cuenta de Indiegogo así que pinchas en Iniciar sesión (2). 

Hayas elegido la opción 1 o 2, lo siguiente será elegir el Aspecto de la contribución (3), donde eliges si quieres que tu aportación sea pública o anónima en la página del crowdfunding. 
Nosotros preferimos que la aportacíon sea pública y marques Nombre Completo para así tener tu nombre a la hora de darte la acreditación el día del evento (¡y para que presumas de tu aportación!).
Tras lo anterior, debes pinchar en CONTINUAR A PAYPAL (4).

 

Paso 3. Pago en PayPal

Indiegogo usa la tpv virtual de PayPal como también lo hacen otras webs como Ebay, Meetup y tantísimas tiendas online.
Si ya tienes cuenta de PayPal, sólo debes pinchar en Iniciar sesión en su cuenta PayPal  y tras introducir tu correo electrónico y contraseña de PayPal sólo te faltará confirmar el pago.


Si no tienes cuenta de PayPal podrás pagar usando tu tarjeta de débito o crédito. Para ello deberás rellenar los apartados que ves en la siguiente imagen, bajo el apartado Pague con tarjeta de crédito o débito (1).
IMPORTANTE: Si no quieres que PayPal te cree una cuenta para compras futuras, entonces deberás desmarcar la casilla indicada con el nº 2 en la siguiente imagen, donde pone Guarde esta información con una cuenta PayPal. Por defecto viene marcada (como en la imagen), y para crearte una cuenta tendrás que introducir una contraseña para PayPal.

Tras esto (te generes o no cuenta de PayPal) sólo tendrás que marcar la casilla por la que aceptas las políticas de PayPal (como en cualquier tienda de comercio electrónico) y por último pinchar en el botón amarillo que pone Aceptar y continuar (3).




Paso 4. Comparte

Por último podrás compartir tu contribución en Facebook y Twitter. Hazlo, ¡que cuantos más SuperHéroes seamos mejor!
