story:
Inspirados por la distribución que se hacía a principios de los 80 por las empresas clásicas del mercado español de los 8 bits, en Questron y Commodore Plus hemos decidido empezar a acercar al sur de Europa las producciones de calidad que actualmente salen al mercado para nuestro Commodore 64.

 Protovision, empresa emblemática que lleva sacando producciones para este y otros ordenadores desde principios de siglo, lanza en breve al mercado “Sam's Journey”, una increíble aventura llena de buenos gráficos, jugabilidad y color, que nosotros no hemos dudado en traer para España e Italia.

 

 LA META

 La meta es alcanzar de 1100 eur para una tirada de 20 unidades, que desde Questron y Commodore Plus esperamos poder conseguir con tal de cumplir el sueño de muchos que es el de ver de nuevo una distribución autóctona de un juego de 8 bits para Commodore 64.

 En el caso de superarse esta meta, primero, nos pondremos muy contentos, y segundo, pues se ampliará la tirada de producción hasta satisfacer a todos los mecenas que nos hayan ayudado a sacar este juego al mercado.

 El dinero de la meta será empleado de la siguiente manera

 · Cubrir los costes básicos de producción del cartucho, los manuales traducidos, y las cajas traducidas

 · Pago de un % del total bruto a los creadores del juego, Knights of Bytes

 · Pago de un % del total bruto a su productora, Protovision

 · Sufragar los costes de más unidades físicas que se pondrán a la venta en las distintas ferias, reuniones y eventos a los que asista Commodore Plus durante el año 2017, y conseguir así que haya unidades físicas disponibles a la venta para los asistentes a las mismas. El precio de estas unidades queda sujeto a la decisión económica que tome Protovision una vez finalizado el crowdfunding.

Grafico 

 

La contribución básica con recompensa en este mecenazgo será de 55 eur, y a esto habrá que sumarle 10 eur de gastos de envío por correo certificado para recibir una copia del juego en cartucho, con su manual y caja traducidos al idioma del mecenas. Además del juego, los mecenas también recibirán junto al mismo un set de cromos en el que podremos ver los diferentes “disfraces” con los que podrá vestirse Sam durante el juego :)

 

La contribución para tienda es una contribución especial con un descuento para comerciantes. Con esto intentamos que el juego también esté disponible en las estanterías de las distintas tiendas que se dedican a la venta de retrovideojuegos. Si tienes una tienda y estás interesado en ayudarnos, esta es la contribución que debes hacer... pediremos datos físicos de la tienda a todos los mecenas que opten por esta opción.

 La fecha aproximada de lanzamiento del juego será antes de que finalice el año, así que esperamos poder estar enviando las copias del juego dentro de la primera semana de Diciembre.

 Por parte de Questron y Commodore Plus no se van a realizar tiradas en cassette o disco de este juego.

 

 CARACTERISTICAS DEL JUEGO

 Sam's Journey”, de Knights of Bytes, es un juego nuevo de plataformas con scroll lateral desarrollado para el Commodore 64. Trata sobre un pequeño, pero valiente héroe llamado Sam, quien se haya sin comerlo ni beberlo en una inesperada aventura en un mundo extraño y peligroso.

 Knights of Bytes quiere que “Sam's Journey” sea tan famoso como nuestros plataformeros favoritos para la consola NES o para la Master System. Con este propósito, han implementado en el juego una serie de características que son realmente poco comunes en un juego de Commodore 64.

 A pesar de que Sam es muy pequeño, puede correr muy rápido, y saltar muy alto ¡Es por eso que la cámara debe correr para poder seguirlo, sin importar a donde vaya!

 Del mismo modo, Sam tiene una serie de movimientos básicos. Si bien correr y saltar son habilidades básicas y obvias, su habilidad para escalar le permiten alcanzar nuevas cotas, y gracias a su habilidad de bucear, podrá explorar las profundidades acuáticas.

 El mundo de Sam no es solamente un arcoiris visual. Cada fase que atraviese en su aventura está acompañado por su propia música in-game, que enfatizará más si cabe la atmósfera del escenario.

 Algunas canciones serán una melodía feliz, otras melancólicas, algunas dramáticas... y por supuesto, también habrá efectos de sonido!

 La banda sonora al completo ofrecerá una amplia variedad de melodías que utilizarán las tres voces del SID chip del C64... puedes escuchar algunos ejemplos aquí.

 

RESUMEN

· Acción clásica plataformera de 8 bits· Gráficos a todo color

· Scroll multidireccional· Multitud de habilidades básicas: Correr, saltar, escalar, nadar· Seis disfraces especiales que ofrecerán nuevas habilidades.

· 3 Mapas completos

· 3 Bosses

· 60 mundos

· 2000 pantallas para explorar

· 19 canciones

· Pantallas secretas y Items ocultos

· Sistema de checkpoint: En el cartucho (4Mbit, 512ks) vendrá implementado un sistema de guardado de partida(2ks), que hará que esta pueda grabarse automáticamente en el cartucho.

· Caja a todo color que contiene sujeto el cartucho

·Manual de 18 páginas a todo color, tamaño A5

 

 

Producido por : Knights of Bytes

Distribución: Questron

Coder. Chester Kollschen

Gráficos: Stefan Gutsch

Sonido y FX: Alex Ney

 

 

'Por favor, ayúdanos en este primer paso (primero de muchos) y consigamos que haya novedades de Commodore 64 otra vez en el mercado!

 

¡Gracias!

story:
Short Summary

"On the day I was born, I knew I had a gift and a challenge, Healing Mama." Told through the lyrical voice of a 13 year old, this book narrates a mother and daughter's journey into healing the heart and soul of "Mama."  Healing the past and the present so as to give life and keep giving, as all mothers do. During the different phases of the moon, we learn the power of song and we learn to listen and follow the moon’s guidance. What is a daughter to do with this wisdom? What is a mother to do? For this mama and daughter duo the quest to regain and reclaim these ways is crucial to their well-being.

The Need

Self Publishing this short and beautifully illustrated 32 page story book needs YOUR SUPPORT to bring it to life!

  • Funding to cover printing and distribution
  • Preorder sales
  • Illustrator costs for full color original prints and copies
  • Graphic design costs
  • Marketing and getting the books into your hands ASAP
  • Outreach to others near and far
  • Printing a Spanish language edition.

The Impact

  • Empowered and enlivened motherhood & empowered and enlivened adolescence!

The Challenge

This is not a typical children's book. It is not a typical parenting book. This is not your typical spiritual guidebook, either. It is what happens when we put all of that magic together and trust in the story and the message that wants to be told. Publishers didn't know what box to put it in, so I have put it together myself and I take it to you directly, trusting that you will know exactly what to do with it! Included are themes of:

  • Birth
  • Nature
  • Religion
  • Spirituality
  • Ancestral lineages
  • Cultural sayings and songs
  • Menarche and Menstruation

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute right now, you can help by:

  • Asking folks to get the word out and sending this campaign on to others.
  • Share the Indiegogo campaign, post on your Facebook Page,  SHARE and like me, like me, like me on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AmandaNubeHealingMama/

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING ME AND BRINGING THIS STORY TO LIFE

Illustrator costs for full color original prints and copies
Graphic design costs
Marketing and getting the books into your hands ASAP
Outreach to others near and far
Printing a Spanish language edition.


The Impact
Empowered and enlivened motherhood & empowered and enlivened adolescence!

The Challenge
This is not a typical children's book. It is not a typical parenting book. This is not your typical spiritual guidebook, either. It is what happens when we put all of that magic together and trust in the story and the message that wants to be told. Publishers didn't know what box to put it in, so I have put it together myself and I take it to you directly, trusting that you will know exactly what to do with it! Included are themes of:

Birth
Nature
Religion
Spirituality
Ancestral lineages
Cultural sayings and songs
Menarche and Menstruation


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can't contribute right now, you can help by:

Asking folks to get the word out and sending this campaign on to others.
Share the Indiegogo campaign, post on your Facebook Page,  SHARE and like me, like me, like me on Facebook! https://www.facebook.com/AmandaNubeHealingMama/


THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING ME AND BRINGING THIS STORY TO LIFE

story:
Story of My Book

Beauty as It Is is a book that explores the power of tapping into a more inclusive beauty market and allowing all individuals to feel beautiful no matter what society they live in.

My name is Carlota Rodriguez-Benito and I am the author of Beauty as It Is. I wrote this book because of an innate curiosity that has developed within me after living in six countries, traveling to 32 and being a prima ballerina for 14 years: what beauty means to distinct individuals and societies around the world. After years of turning this thought in my head, I am convinced that regardless of distinct global perceptions of beauty, the radiating inner beauty of a person is the key factor when deeming an individual as beautiful, regardless of their genetic makeup. When the opportunity to write a book came along, I decided to research this hypothesis by speaking to as many professionals in the industry all over the world in search of support. 

I am passionate about how societies around the world perceive, feel and consume beauty.

My hope is that in reading Beauty as It Is, you will discover inspiring accounts and insights from 60+ elite professionals in the skincare and cosmetics industry around the world. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement I have for the success of inclusive and inside out beauty in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to position the beauty business as a means of empowerment and not a means to hide your true self. Last, but not least, I hope for people in the beauty business to learn from accounts of high-end professionals, in order to achieve prime success in today’s increasingly saturated beauty world. 

In this book, you will learn that the future of the beauty industry is what is: honest, authentic and relatable.

  • Honest: featured insights and stories from Dr. Barbara Sturm and Peter Thomas Roth, speaking about result-giving ingredients, and much more 
  • Authentic: featured in accounts from Stevie Wong, through her experience working with SK II, Ira Koko, though her experiences at L'Oreal, and countless others
  • Relatable: featured in accounts from Karla Martinez de Salas, with her push for Yalitza Aparicio to be the face of Vogue Mexico's January 2019 issue, Marie Englesson, through her experience founding an African beauty company, Atsoko, and many more 


You will love this book if you are interested in: re-assessing your own perception of beauty, an inside view on conversations occurring within the leading beauty industry and/or learning from crème de la crème beauty professionals about their personal successes and challenges to remain relevant in the industry.

Beauty as It Is is a non-fiction book that speaks to two main audiences: The curious consumer and the beauty innovator, executive and marketer, who are interested in the effects of inclusive beauty and how to make beauty brands thrive in the present and times to come.
 

The Book -Beauty as It Is

The book is written in 4 Parts.

Part 1 Contains the introduction and Chapters 1-8. Here, I share my personal curiosity towards the beauty industry and the importance of the themes that will be discussed in the book. This part also dives into the definition of beauty and its perceptions, how we have gotten here, and tech and the social media component that now drives the international beauty industry.

Part 2 Contains Chapters 9-14. This part is based mainly on consumer demographics and trends the beauty industry is faced with today. Present consumers comprise of Generation Z, Millennials, Generation X, Boomers, and Silent generations, which need to be targeted accordingly and given their own voice in the beauty industry. These chapters include stories about the power of authentic beauty and feeling beautiful, no matter your gender, age, race or ethnicity. 

Part 3 Contains Chapters 14-22. This part discusses the cognizance that giving societies the opportunity to feel more beautiful is only a win-win for the business and consumer. Why? because they will now purchase skincare and color cosmetics with a positive mentality to celebrate their features and not hide behind them. In these chapters, readers discover insights from professionals about the market itself and how innovation, effectiveness and integrity can ensure your business' relevance for years to come.

Part 4 Contains Chapters 23-25. This last part comes together in the form of a Handbook. All tips and recommendations are extracted from the words of experienced and successful professionals on how to achieve consumer loyalty for your a beauty brand or line. These are oriented to ensure that your brand's products and DNA is constantly making an impact in the lives of consumers regardless of the many brands being introduced in the market every day.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor that will work alongside me to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in Winter 2019

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Carlota Rodriguez-Benito is a last semester senior at the University of Southern California triple majoring in International Relations, Russian and French. She is dynamic and proactive with strong interpersonal skills and extensive experience with multicultural environments. Carlota is fluent in 4 languages and has lived in 6 countries - USA, Spain, Mexico, Switzerland, France and Russia. She is interested in global affairs and has keen affinity for the luxury goods and beauty industry. 

Carlota wrote this book because she is a strong believer that no matter what region of the world you come from, beauty is what transcends from the inside out. She is a persuaded that fostering a more authentic, relatable, and inclusive perception of beauty in the industry will not only benefit individuals to be the best version of themselves but, it will help them engaged with beauty businesses and brands with joy. In this way, they will not hide but celebrate and enhance their real self. She is a believer that outer beauty is a vehicle to radiate the inner most valuable self— the component that make others perceive them as beautiful.

Traveling, ballet, yoga, skiing, wellbeing, and immersing herself in other cultures is what Carlota lives for. She has a passion for meeting new people and linking them together. She loves to learn from others to later on teach to whomever is ready to learn. 

For more information you can connect with Carlota via email at crodriguezbenito@gmail.com, on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/in/carlotarodriguezben..., and/or on Instagram @carlotar.b.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #beautyasitis and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media if you can!

 

Thank you all so much for your love and support. I could not do this without you!

Thanks again,
Carlota Rodriguez-Benito

story:
lta.sputnikphotos.com

 

We cannot wait for favors from Nature. To take them from it—that is our task.

Ivan Michurin

 

About the project

The book follows a long-term photographic project by Sputnik Photos entitled Lost Territories, which is dedicated to the former Soviet Union – territories of painful experience and unfinished transformations.  

Short user manual animation explaining how the Lost Territories project works:

 

 

For several years, the photographers have documented the life and space of all the 15 countries born after the collapse of the former Soviet empire, exploring such topics as: propaganda in Georgia, veterans of the Georgian-Russian war, environment contaminated with uranium and nuclear waste, women veterans of the Great Patriotic War, borders between states, metaphysics of the dreams of former USSR citizens, long-lasting consequences of natural disasters, decline of the shipbuilding industry on the Ukrainian coast of the Black Sea, and earthquake in Spitak (Armenia). Some of this photo journeys have been supported via Indie Gogo campaign so the collaborative spirit has been present in the project in many ways.

 

 

The resultant 'Lost Territories' archive, which consists of several thousand photographs, has become a starting point for exhibitions, books, and installations. Each of the narratives to emerge in the future will address a different aspect of the post-Soviet lands. So is ‘Fruit Garden’.

 

 

More about the book

The book‘Fruit Garden’ itself may be called a photographic field guide of sorts, albeit one that leads the viewer less to the bird than to the cage; less to the tree than to the coil of wire painfully binding its bark; less to an Arcadian landscape than to the post-Soviet landfill.

 

 

Tweezers in hand, the Fruit Garden’s archaeological dig evolves to become a meticulous survey of the doctrinal mindset underpinning Michurin’s axiom; and of the ways in which, during the reign of the Soviet Union, its repeated and obsessive society-wide implementation left, in the ideology’s wake, a razed expanse of human ecologies and psychologies, here represented by unseen tribes of damaged individuals, scarred for life by the regime’s dehumanizing regimen of invasive scientific experimentation,

 

 

The book has already been partially supported by Polish Ministry of Culture and National Heritage. To complete the process of pritning we kindly ask for your support.

 

 

Technical information

Fruit Garden

Size: 170x220mm

Pages: 180

Hard-cover

Bound in half blue paper over ivory linen

Partial oil varnish

No. of photos: 85

Edition: 500

Book design: Anna Nałęcka-Milach/ Tapir Book Design

Photos: Andrei Balco, Jan Brykczynski, Andrei Liankievich, Michal Luczak, Rafal Milach, Adam Panczuk, Agnieszka Rayss.

 

 

OTHER REWARDS

Lost Territories: Wordbook ( English and Polish version available)

 

Size: 110x220mm

21 writers

164 pages

20 images

Print run: 500 copies

 The Lost Territories Wordbook (LTA 1), for which Sputnik commissioned nearly one hundred short texts from twenty-one authors (essayists and journalists, novelists and poets, political scientists and historians, artists and curators—and sometimes the journalists are poets and vice versa) charged with the express mission of drafting, oddly enough, a Soviet and post-Soviet lexicon with missing words in order to compile a dictionary with missing definitions.
Although upon closer inspection, the Wordbook in fact reveals itself to be a dictionary of missing definitions, crazy-quilted together from the kinds of “truth told slant” illuminations you’re unlikely to find in a definitive reference book or citable treatise.

 

SET OF POSTCARDS!!!

Set of 3 postcards with photographs Sputnik Photos photographers had taken during their Lost Territories trips. Posctacrds signed by authors.

 

 

ORIGINAL POLAROIDS!!!!

Original instant prints taken by Sputnik Photographers (random choice), signed by authors.

 

IS (NOT) - RARE BOOK! 

Only 3 copies.

Photographers: Jan Brykczynski, Michal Luczak, Rafal Milach, Adam Panczuk, Agnieszka Rayss Text by: Sindri Freysson, Hermann Stefansson, Kristin Heida Kristinsdottir, Sigurbjorg Prastardottir, Huldar Breidfjord Editor / curator: Andrzej Kramarz Designer: Ania Nałęcka / Tapir Book Design Language of text: English / Icelandic ISBN: 978-83-927485-8-8 Publisher: Sputnik Photos Print run: 1000.

 OUT OF PRINT, these 3 copies are offered for the campaign by our brave photographers!

More about IS(NOT) project here.

by Agnieszka Rayss

Special edition of BOIKO book by Jan Brykczynski + print

 

more information here

NEW PERK!!!

Special edition of THE GARDENER book + 2 prints

more information here

SPUTNIK NOTEBOOK + POLAROID!!!  sold out!

 

Sputnik Photos (the publisher)

 

 

Sputnik Photos is an international collective founded in 2006 by documentary photographers from Central and Eastern Europe. Experiencing the transformation of their home region has become a pretext for commenting on the social, political, and cultural processes occurring in it. Using photography, film, and photographic books, the collective has been building a record of the transformations in the former Eastern bloc for more than a decade. The activities are supported by a team of curators, writers, graphic artists, and animators of culture. Using documentary photography as a starting point, Sputnik photographers explore its modern dimension and functions, as well as experiment with its form and content. The collective is also dedicated to diverse forms of visual education with a view to supporting and promoting young artists from the region.

 

Timeframe

·       October – November 2016 – Indiegogo Campaign

·       December 2016 – January 2017 – Production and quality check

·       February 2017 – Shipping

 

Thank you for your support!

story:
The Stone Churches of Downtown Guelph Project came from meeting with a group of photographers every couple of weeks for the past few years. I'd been a news photographer for about three decades and, through this group, was challenged to explore another photographic venue.

Downtown Guelph is home to seven churches built between 1855 and 1877, five of which are examples of Gothic Revival architecture. As I began photographing these buildings and converting the photos into black and white images, I found myself amazed at their intricacy and grandeur.

The more on worked on the photography, the more I realized that the legacy of these buildings needed to be preserved. Which is where your help and participation in this Indigogo campaign comes in by funding:

1) The publication of a table-top book which will feature black and white photos of both the churches' interiors and exteriors, and

2) The creation of canvas prints of some of the books photos to be used as an art exhibit (I've already had inquiries about this)

What We Need & What You Get

The $7,000 I'm hoping to raise will cover the following costs:

  • Design ($450)
  • Publishing, printing and promotion ($5,050)
  • Exhibit-ready canvas prints ($1,500)

Everyone who donates a minimum of $10 to the project will receive a 8" x  10" print suitable for framing. At the $25 level, 50 donors will receive an autographed copy of the book. The perks get bigger and better, with larger prints and even canvas prints being thrown into the mix. Check the perks section for more details.

If for some reason I don't reach the $7,000 goal, I'm hoping to raise enough to print the book or, at the very least, create the canvas prints for exhibit.

The Impact

The Stone Churches of Downtown Guelph Project represents both:

1) The city’s church history: Anglican, Presbyterian (Church of Scotland and Free Kirk), Methodist (later United and now an independent congregation), Baptist, Roman Catholic; and

2) The best in 19th century church architecture. Most are built in the Gothic Revival style (and some have a common architect in Toronto-based Henry Langley). Others, such as Lakeside Downtown (originally the Wesleyan Methodist church) and First Baptist are built in a simple design representative of the congregations’ beliefs at the time.

Downtown churches, and in some cases, church architecture are fast disappearing from the Canadian landscape. As buildings age and congregations dwindle, difficult decisions will need to be made and, as has happened elsewhere buildings are converted or razed.

As a journalist who has spent much of his career covering the intersection of faith and Canadian culture, this project allows me to put my three decades of writing and photographic skills to use to preserve an integral element of Guelph's past, present and, hopefully, future.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute right now, but you can still help:

  • Take a moment or two to get the word out and make some noise about The Stone Churches of Downtown Guelph Project.
  • And an easy way to do that is to use the Indiegogo share tools

Thank you, in advance, for all your support.

The Stone Churches of Downtown Guelph Project came from meeting with a group of photographers every couple of weeks for the past few years. I'd been a news photographer for about three decades and, through this group, was challenged to explore another photographic venue.Downtown Guelph is home to seven churches built between 1855 and 1877, five of which are examples of Gothic Revival architecture. As I began photographing these buildings and converting the photos into black and white images, I found myself amazed at their intricacy and grandeur.
The more on worked on the photography, the more I realized that the legacy of these buildings needed to be preserved. Which is where your help and participation in this Indigogo campaign comes in by funding:

story:
My Pre-Sale Book Campaign

Work is a game and this book reveals unwritten rules for getting ahead at work that you aren’t taught in school. Learn to focus your efforts where you’ll have the greatest impact while enjoying success and satisfaction you deserve. Coming out in April 2020.

 

The Story of My Book

Winning the Game of Work reveals valuable tips for success that I learned during my 30-year career in the corporate world. Many ambitious professionals believe that working harder is the only path to getting ahead, but that approach often leads to stress, burnout and stagnation. When you step back and can see the bigger picture using the guidance in this book, strategies emerge that allow you apply your energy and talents to areas that benefit both you and your organization that are much more impactful than simply “working hard” and hoping for the best.

My name is Terry McDougall and I am the author of Winning the Game of Work. I wrote this book to share insights that I found were counter-intuitive to what I thought early in my career would lead to success in the corporate world. These lessons weren’t taught in college or even in my MBA classes. I learned some through the school of hard knocks, some from wise mentors and high-dollar executive coaches, and some from my own observations about the real dynamics of the corporate world.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will be able to understand the “game of work” and be strategic about the moves you make so your efforts are impactful and lead to success for your company and for you! I love business, but I also know that it can eat you alive if you let it. I want to help you gain a new perspective on the dynamics of a successful business career so you expand your options for how to navigate and increase your confidence in the value you bring to your work.

In this book, you'll learn how to identify and overcome common beliefs that prevent you from operating at your full potential:
  • Your work speaks for itself - I share 5 myths that show why this doesn’t work
  • What got you here will get you there - I relate a humiliating story that ultimately resulted in me doubling my salary
  • Office politics is to be avoided at all costs - Well, only if you want to give up on having influence within your organization

You will love this book if you are working really hard at your job but instead of getting ahead only feel frustrated and stressed out.

Winning the Game of Work is a non-fiction book that speaks to over-achievers and high-performers in all industries who want to enjoy the rewards and recognition that should be the result of their hard work and contributions.


The Book

The book Winning the Game of Work  is written in 4 Parts:

  • Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapter 1. This section focuses on why it's helpful to see work as a game. If you're a striver you undoubtedly take your work seriously. This can lead to blind spots that prevent you from seeing options for your advancement. When you reframe work as a game, it frees you to be more creative. When you step back from the stressful day-to-day activities of your job, you’ll start to see the bigger picture and you can plot out your moves so that you achieve your objectives with less effort and more impact.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 2-4. This section focuses on how getting clear on what you want from work is so critical and how so many successful people skip past this to their own detriment. In this section, I’ll also share research on the addiction that many “high-need-to-achieve” people fall into and how it actually holds them back from the career satisfaction they most desperately want.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 5-7. In this section, you’ll begin to learn the unwritten rules of the game of work. Your perspective will shift so that you start to understand how to navigate work on a whole new level. You’ll learn to take things less personally and see how your talents can be used in a way that is valued more highly.
  • Part 4 contains Chapters 8-10. In this section, you’ll learn to envision how you can leverage your talents to benefit your company and also to become the champion of your professional success and personal satisfaction. You’ll learn to see yourself objectively and make strategic moves that get you the outcomes that you want. The logical next steps will begin to emerge and you’ll see the playing field in a way that you never did before.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the Interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish April 2020.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to YOU”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic workshop/seminar where I will share experience of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Terry Boyle McDougall is President & Head Coach at Terry B. McDougall Coaching and an Executive & Leadership Coach for for high-achieving corporate professionals. After a 30-year career in corporate marketing where she advised senior leaders and led marketing efforts for billion-dollar businesses, she decided to start a new career as a Certified Professional Coach. Today she follows her passion for helping professionals gain clarity on their goals, remove obstacles to peak performance so that they can operate at the top of their games.

As a lifelong marketer, Terry has had a keen interest in understanding how to motivate and influence people to take productive action. As a coach Terry brings those insights into her work with clients to help them better understand their skills, strengths and passions and translate them into a vision for their career. Her goal is to support ambitious and goal-oriented corporate professionals envision and create a future where they are both professionally successful and personally satisfied with how they use their talents.

Terry wrote Winning the Game of Work to share the insights that she gathered over the course of her 30-year career so that people could see the big picture of how they can have a positive and satisfying experience at work without falling into a common trap where they become exhausted and burnt out. Her goal is to help people appreciate their own unique skills and understand how they can use them to bring value to their companies so that they are successful and happy in their careers and their lives!

Terry lives with her husband, Scott, three kids and pet puggle Gabby in suburban Chicago. In her free time she enjoys doing improv, seeing live music, and spending time with friends.

For more information you can connect with Terry at terry@terrybmcdougall.com, at www.terrybmcdougall.com or at www.linkedin.com/in/terrybmcdougall.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #WinningtheGameofWork and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Terry McDougall

story:
Sonnets from the American: An Anthology of Poems and Essays

Sonnets from the American (under contract with University of Iowa Press) is a new anthology that showcases the cultural and aesthetic diversity of the American sonnet. Roughly 800 years after the sonnet's invention, this project celebrates the extraordinary development of the sonnet in the hands of American poets from every corner of the aesthetic field. 

(A selection of recent sonnet-related titles from the Sonnets from the American Symposium's Virtual Book Fair.)

This new anthology, edited by poet and scholar team Dora Malech and Laura T. Smith, collects and foregrounds an impressive range of 20th and 21st century sonnets, including formal and formally subversive sonnets by established and emerging poets, and presents these alongside a selection of earlier American sonnets, highlighting connections across literary periods and movements. The critical essays likewise draw together diverse voices, methodologies, and historical and theoretical perspectives that represent the burgeoning field of American sonnet studies. 

The completed anthology, which will comprise 400 pages of poems and essays, shows the form continuing to function as a poetic bellwether as centuries of poets use its peculiar confines to negotiate public and private questions of nation, race, class, gender, sexuality, diaspora, and poetic tradition--and to transform it.

The volume builds upon the international Sonnets from the American Symposium held October 1-3, 2020, featuring three days of academic panels, keynotes, and poetry readings with poets and scholars from seven countries. The symposium, which was entirely free and open to the public, generated enough material for many books. The anthology will feature a further curated selection of essays by Jahan Ramazani, Carl Phillips, and others from the symposium and beyond.

We are asking for your support in the form of donations and pre-orders to raise the permissions fees necessary to publish this remarkable collection and compensate the writers included.  As editors, we are required to pay these costs up front ourselves and we are asking for your help to do so. The pandemic has further complicated our fund-raising as institutional support is severely limited. Funds will be used to pay permissions fees to copyright holders and honoraria to poets. Any remaining funds will be donated to Writers in Baltimore Schools. 

About the Editors:

Dora Malech is the author of four books of poems, most recently, Flourish (Carnegie Mellon University Press, 2020) and Stet (Princeton University Press, 2018). In 2019, Eris Press published Soundings, a UK Selected of Malech’s poems and drawings. Her poems have appeared in The New Yorker, Poetry, The Best American Poetry,  and numerous other publications. She is the recipient of awards that  include an Amy Clampitt Residency Award, a Ruth Lilly Poetry Fellowship,  a Mary Sawyers Baker Prize, and a Writer’s Fellowship from the  Civitella Ranieri Foundation. She has been a Visiting Artist at the  American Academy in Rome and a Distinguished Writer-in-Residence at  Saint Mary’s College of California. She lives in Baltimore, where she is  an assistant professor in The Writing Seminars at Johns Hopkins University.

Laura Smith is Associate Professor and Chair of the English Department at Stevenson University in Maryland, where she teaches poetry and poetics, queer studies, and creative writing. She has received grants and awards from the National Endowment for the Humanities, Marble House Project, Kairos, and Imagining America and is Founding Director of the Stevenson Summer Writers’ Workshop, a creative writing intensive for Baltimore area teens.

Risks & Challenges

We want to create the strongest and most inclusive anthology possible while paying writers for their work. We have estimated our probable permissions costs, but these are difficult to predict and may change. We are scheduled to go to print by late 2021 or early 2022; that timeline could be affected by our progress toward funding and securing permissions. We do not, however, anticipate encountering obstacles that would prevent us from going to publication.

story:
La Novela

Jota es un periodista al que le colgaron la medalla de admirable. La realidad dista de esa imagen, pues debido a un desafortunado acontecido en su vida personal, ve no solo peligrar su carrera sino su salud física y mental. Lo único que creía saber hacer, además con brillante mordacidad, parece no saber hacerlo ya, ni con mediocre dignidad. La única persona del mundo que le importa ha desaparecido. En su insalubre dieta no faltan el café ni los cigarrillos. Su mejor amigo y jefe, le ha estado salvando el trasero durante el tiempo que ha durado su hecatombe, por lo que se ve obligado a claudicar, cuando le pide un trabajo especial. Uno que haría a Fénix resurgir de sus cenizas.

La casualidad hará latir su corazón ajado, que volverá a pararse, perderá y recuperará a seres queridos en una montaña rusa emocional, donde el veneno y las pistolas se mezclan a la perfección con una historia de algo parecido al amor.
 

La Autora

Emma Pérez Méndez (Vitoria- 8 de Mayo de 1981)  es diplomada Universitaria en Enfermería por la Universidad de Navarra (1999-2002), graduada por la Universidad de León en Enfermeria (2012), y Técnico Superior en Prevención de Riesgos.

Publicó en 2007 su primera novela, La engaña (Ed. Celya),  la segunda un par de años después con la editorial granadina Alhulia, Colonia de verano para señoritas, publicando en 2013 Azul con Bubok, para repetir con Alhulia en 2015 con El secreto de Cartago.

Una Muestra

«Susurra despacio, permitiéndole inhalar el dulce aroma de su perfume. La  proximidad le hace flojear las rodillas. Caer rendido ante una mujer cobra un nuevo significado.
          Intrigado por el asunto del envío retorna a casa. Un pedido de rodaballos no es como para dar por terminada una entrevista, además una en la que ella obviamente estaba cómoda. El atún rojo podría ser algo más peliagudo, aunque no para verla tambalearse sutilmente a nivel emocional. No le pegaba. No parecía su estilo, pero por un instante dudó de que sus ingresos fueran lo suficientemente cuantiosos como para permitirse no solo el coste de la restauración, sino la adquisición y mantenimiento del teatro.
          Mariposea entonces en su cerebro la idea de que el polvo de hadas colocadas tuviera algo que ver en el asunto. Aunque arropada por el hecho de viajar por Europa, no debía descartar la posibilidad del contrabando de armas…
          ¡Qué idiota! Definitivamente se estaba haciendo viejo y creía ver fantasmas donde tan solo había pescado recién cogido.
          Escucha durante horas lo grabado. Puede que lo haga porque siente que esa voz, enlatada y atesorada en ese documento de audio, contiene parte de su alma.

De: Peter Harris López
Para: Gerardo Jota Ramírez
Fecha: 09/12/2014
Asunto: ¡Repórtame información!

Ni una llamada. Ni un correo. Soy tu jefe, al menos ten la gentileza de cogerme el teléfono. Estoy convencido de que si fuera Ana hubieras descolgado al segundo».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Emma Pérez Méndez os lo agradeceremos.
story_txt:
La Novela
Jota es un periodista al que le colgaron la medalla de admirable. La realidad dista de esa imagen, pues debido a un desafortunado acontecido en su vida personal, ve no solo peligrar su carrera sino su salud física y mental. Lo único que creía saber hacer, además con brillante mordacidad, parece no saber hacerlo ya, ni con mediocre dignidad. La única persona del mundo que le importa ha desaparecido. En su insalubre dieta no faltan el café ni los cigarrillos. Su mejor amigo y jefe, le ha estado salvando el trasero durante el tiempo que ha durado su hecatombe, por lo que se ve obligado a claudicar, cuando le pide un trabajo especial. Uno que haría a Fénix resurgir de sus cenizas.
La casualidad hará latir su corazón ajado, que volverá a pararse, perderá y recuperará a seres queridos en una montaña rusa emocional, donde el veneno y las pistolas se mezclan a la perfección con una historia de algo parecido al amor. 
La Autora
Emma Pérez Méndez (Vitoria- 8 de Mayo de 1981)  es diplomada Universitaria en Enfermería por la Universidad de Navarra (1999-2002), graduada por la Universidad de León en Enfermeria (2012), y Técnico Superior en Prevención de Riesgos.Publicó en 2007 su primera novela, La engaña (Ed. Celya),  la segunda un par de años después con la editorial granadina Alhulia, Colonia de verano para señoritas, publicando en 2013 Azul con Bubok, para repetir con Alhulia en 2015 con El secreto de Cartago.
Una Muestra
«Susurra despacio, permitiéndole inhalar el dulce aroma de su perfume. La  proximidad le hace flojear las rodillas. Caer rendido ante una mujer cobra un nuevo significado.          Intrigado por el asunto del envío retorna a casa. Un pedido de rodaballos no es como para dar por terminada una entrevista, además una en la que ella obviamente estaba cómoda. El atún rojo podría ser algo más peliagudo, aunque no para verla tambalearse sutilmente a nivel emocional. No le pegaba. No parecía su estilo, pero por un instante dudó de que sus ingresos fueran lo suficientemente cuantiosos como para permitirse no solo el coste de la restauración, sino la adquisición y mantenimiento del teatro.          Mariposea entonces en su cerebro la idea de que el polvo de hadas colocadas tuviera algo que ver en el asunto. Aunque arropada por el hecho de viajar por Europa, no debía descartar la posibilidad del contrabando de armas…          ¡Qué idiota! Definitivamente se estaba haciendo viejo y creía ver fantasmas donde tan solo había pescado recién cogido.          Escucha durante horas lo grabado. Puede que lo haga porque siente que esa voz, enlatada y atesorada en ese documento de audio, contiene parte de su alma.

story:
In what could be considered a consumer backlash of truly epic proportions, The Fandom Menace has become a beacon to those who want to pursue escapist entertainments without harrassment, assault, coercion or shame.

The rise of the truly 'toxic' fan in community circles has come. The Fandom Menace is the pushback to that toxicity.

The selfish, selfserving anti-social authoritarians want to control what we see, how we see it, how we feel about it and what we are allowed to say about it.

The Fandom Menace has come. They are consumers. They are global. They are Muslim, They are Christian, They are Pagan, They are in some cases - militant anti-theists.

They reflect the reality of our world and of our times in a reaction to 'cancel culture', 'outrage culture' and social justice mobs roaming unchecked through our cultural landscapes. This is the after effect of a 20 year program of forced political correctness.

This community is not political. They want politics out of their entertainment and they want the ideologues who have been given the keys to these vast kingdoms turned out into the wilderness where such socially destructive abberations belong. To the dustbin of history with these fanatics and masked bigots of virtue.

The Fandom Menace is the mainstream. The Fandom Menace are the voice of real people everywhere.

We will not be silenced. We do not negotiate with social terrorists.

Hail The Fandom Menace!

story:
¿Qué?

Hijos de la derrota te sumergirá en un mundo arrasado por las guerras, la violencia y la necesidad; sí, muy parecido al nuestro, pero mucho más peligroso.

En el año 2020, un desastre nuclear llevó al mundo a una guerra que redujo el mundo a cenizas. Ahora, catorce años después, solo unas pocas naciones luchan por la supremacía mundial. En Europa, una de las mayores potencias es el Imperio del Norte. Allí, en una de sus Academias Militares, se forman dos hermanos, Erick y Alice. Hijos de un héroe de guerra, viven con las expectativas puestas en un mundo mejor, donde el Imperio apacigüe las llamas de la guerra. Los jóvenes tendrán que librar las batallas más tempranas e importantes de su vida, las que les definan como personas y soldados en un futuro. Por otro lado, en los restos de un país diezmado, John es un joven y carismático aristócrata que, lejos de querer perder el tiempo con su dinero, centrará sus esfuerzos en cumplir un único objetivo: matar al Presidente de los Estados Unidos del Este.  

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de publicar obras poco convencionales pero de indudable calidad, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para promocionar cada título cuando esta todavía se encuentra en proceso de edición.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Guillermo Fernández Alonso.

Leer siempre ha sido mi pasión, hasta que me atreví a escribir con diecisiete años; puede parecer que fue hace mucho, pero nada más lejos de la realidad. Siempre me han gustado las buenas historias: cortas y simples o largas y enrevesadas, todas en general. Claro que, una historia te puede gustar más o menos, pero al final del día me di cuenta de que daba igual lo genial que me pareciera Harry Potter, el basto universo del Señor de los Anillos y las investigaciones de Kurt Wallander. Daba igual qué tan bien las conociera, ninguna de esas historias era tan cercana a mí como para llamarla mía. Por eso me decidí a crear algo por mí mismo. Soy consciente de que soy nuevo en esto y como dijo Brent Weeks: «coger un libro de un autor al que no conoces es un acto de fe». Pero estoy decidido a que este sea el comienzo de algo grande, nuevo e ideal para los que quieran aventurarse en lo desconocido. Cada palabra, cada línea y cada párrafo están destinados a haceros sentir un día como yo me he llegado a sentir leyendo. Hasta que lo consiga, seguiré pasando mis días estudiando Derecho entre montones de café.

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Un héroe no es alguien que se dedica a salvar a gente, ni a hacer el bien. Ni siquiera tiene que tener unos ideales admirables o un buen sentido de la justicia. Si al pensar en un héroe tienes en mente algo de lo que he dicho, te equivocas. Comprueba el diccionario si no me crees. Un héroe puede ser cualquiera. Tu padre, que trabaja horas extra y gasta horas de sueño en mantener a tu familia, es un héroe, por ejemplo. No un gran héroe. Desde luego sus logros no llegarán a mis oídos.
          Ahora bien, tú te refieres a un héroe distinto. Un héroe de guerra. Pero no le haces a casi nadie un favor convirtiéndote en uno, desde luego a ti no. Te digo esto porque conozco muy bien la Tierra de Héroes, muchos de los héroes que allí yacen después de la Tormenta, mis amigos.
         Quizás ahora estés perdiendo el hilo de lo que pasa en mi mundo, luego iré explicando.
          El caso es que he conocido a muchos héroes, pero solo los he admirado y odiado como los héroes que son cuando murieron. Ser un héroe significa morir, al fin y al cabo; no conozco a ninguno que siga vivo. Tienes que entender que es un sacrificio, tu vida por las vidas de otros, tu vida por unos ideales, tu vida por... en fin... lo vas pillando ¿no?
          Ante la posible pregunta, ni te molestes, yo no soy ningún héroe. Por lo menos no aún. Y Dios sabe que no quiero serlo.
          Escribo estas líneas para vosotros, una generación futura después de que acabe esta maldita guerra. Me da igual qué lado salga vencedor, llegados a este punto, no tengo nada más que perder. Pero solo quiero mostraros que esa libertad, que espero que tengáis, fue pagada con sudor y mucha, mucha sangre. Quiero que entendáis que hizo falta mucho esfuerzo, y que no quiero que seáis héroes, nunca más. Que comprendáis que un chico no necesita clavarle a su padre una espada en el pecho porque tengan ideales distintos. Que una madre ya no es un ejemplo a seguir si mata a cientos de hijos de otras madres del bando contrario.
          Empecemos desde el punto en el cual mi vida se vio involucrada en toda esta mierda».

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 960€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Guillermo Fernández Alonso vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

story:
The Short Summary

Five Little Zombies And Fred is a not-for-children children's book, written and illustrated to speak to the child in every one. It tells the story of our hero Fred who finds himself in the middle of the zombie apocalypse. Will he survive with the help of his friend the Mountie? It is written by Jules Sherred and illustrated by Matt Schubbe, with songs written and performed by Errol Elumir and mixed/mastered by Chris Cogott, and video by Andrew Edgar. Each person working on this project is completely in-love with the book. They are hoping to make the world fall in-love with it, too. If they can make the world fall in-love with the book, then they can turn it into a physical thing, with 42 8.5x8.5 beautifully illustrated full-colour pages, for the world to share. The final page count will be 52 pages. PLUS, a whole bunch of nifty extras and swag. More details are found below. We know the details below are OMG SO LONG and you'll be inclined to TL;DR them, but we have some REALLY AWESOMETASTIC perks planned, and they require a lot of space in order to be properly described.

The Longer Summary

The team behind Five Little Zombies And Fred consists of five people:

  • Jules Sherred is the parent of two teenage young men, and does way more than should be legal. Most notably, she is the General Manager and Programming Director of The Look 24/7, host of the Geeky Pleasures Radio Show and the offshoot website, Geeky Pleasures, and core contributor to Wired’s GeekMom. She’s already written two non-fiction books — From The Mundane To The Insane: A Wonderful Journey Without A Destination and Tales Of A Lupus Butterfly — the partial proceeds of which go to lupus research and treatment, is working on another book called Nerd Love, and is beyond excited to make Five Little Zombies And Fred a real thing for people to hold, read, and love. You can follow her on Twitter @GeekyJules. Also, SHE LOVES STAR TREK.
  • Matt Schubbe is a Minneapolis MN based freelance illustrator, designer, snappy dresser and man-about-town. He loves (LOVES) gaming of the tabletop and video varieties, playing the piano and Dr. Who. Now you know why he jumped at the chance to work on this project. You can follow him on Twitter @Sh00bs.
  • Errol Elumir is one half of the geeky, musical, comedy duo Debs & Errol. He is loud. He also creates podcasts, videos, a daily webcomic, and all manner of things that are geeky. His wife is the most patient person on the planet. You can follow him on Twitter @Elumir.
  • Andrew Edgar is Jules' partner in life. He doesn't like to be in the spotlight, but he enjoys supporting whatever project Jules is working on. He also loves to mess around in Adobe Premiere Pro. To that end, he has created videos for this project. You can follow him on Twitter @WileE577. 
  • Chris Cogott is a New Jersey based musician, singer, and songwriter. He plays and breaks guitars on a regular basis. When he turns on the recording equipment, he writes, mixes, and masters his own music and enjoys doing this for others as well. When not writing songs, he sits and watches his garden grow. You can check out his website and hear his music onBandcamp. You can also follow him on Twitter @chriscogott.

Have you ever had an idea that got you so excited, you wanted to grab every one you could, shake them, and exclaim, “I WANT YOU TO HAVE THIS! I WANT YOU TO BE A PART OF IT! I AM SO IN-LOVE WITH THIS RIDICULOUS, YET AWESOME, IDEA!” That is pretty much was happened one afternoon when, suddenly, Jules poured out the text for this book. Immediately, her mind was filled with images and she knew exactly how she wanted this story to look and feel.

Jules told Andrew about the idea, and read the book to him as she would read it to others. Immediately, Andrew fell in-love with the idea. Also, the story and image descriptions caused him to giggle like a little child.

Jules contacted an illustrator whom she admires greatly -- Matt Schubbe -- and shared with him this idea. Immediately, he, too, fell in-love with the book and wanted to be a part of it. He also shared the same vision for the project.

Jules' pal Errol saw her tweet about the project when it was referred to as [REDACTED], and wanted more information. She e-mailed him, and he, too, immediately fell in-love with it and asked if she needed any songs for the book, because he so wanted to have a part in this project filled with worlds of awesome.

Errol needed help mixing and mastering the songs. So, Jules called on her pal Chris Cogott to see if he was willing to lend his talents to this project. Immediately, he, too, wanted to be a part of it and help out any way he could.

Jules decided to test the waters and find out what others thought about the idea. Every one she told about it immediately fell in-love with it. Now the entire team is hoping the rest of the world falls in-love with Five Little Zombies And Fred, a not-for-children children's book that spoofs the Ten Little Monkeys Jumping On A Bed nursery rhyme. Not only is this book a quirky little story, it is a piece of exquisite and beautiful art, each page fully illustrated, in full-colour, crammed with wonderful Easter eggs and inside jokes, speaking directly to every geek. PLUS, ZOMBIES! Who doesn't like adorable, little, flesh-eating creatures? And we cannot forget the Mountie! And, of course, our hero Fred! Does he make it through the story alive? To find out, this project needs funding.

If this project is successfully funded, most importantly, Five Little Zombies And Fred will be available for the entire world to read and share. It will be made available in both electronic and paperback format. It will also be made available for global distribution: such online and offline retailers and distributors such as Ingram and NACSCORP; the book will be made available through Baker & Taylor to libraries and academic institutions; Amazon, and more. The songs will also be made available for the general public to purchase. We will also figure out a cost-effective way to make the posters, mugs, t-shirts and messenger bags available for all to purchase. Depending on how much we raise, we will also create other Five Little Zombies And Fred swag, such as stickers, magnets, hats, etc. If we double our funding goal, then we will find a developer to turn the book into an interactive book app, for both Android and iOS. We want to make Five Little Zombies And Fred accessible to all, with a variety of ways to enjoy the story.

What We Need & What You Get

Aside from the below perks, we have other bonuses prepared. Each time we reach a 12.5% funding mark, you will see a new video, showing you 6 completed pages of the book. Upon successful funding, we will also show you the original sketches created during the idea phase, including the original rough sketches of the first two drafts, and reveal both songs. We will also show you other phases of the work-in-progress. For every extra $1000 dollars funded, one lucky contributor, to be chosen at random, will receive a bonus perk: The Travelling Zombie. If we double our funding goal, we will seek out a developer to turn the book into an interactive app for both Android and iOS.

So what are you funding and what you will receive:

  • We need to raise $11, 500. This may seem like a large amount of money for a book, but the project included a lot of art and swag, and those things are not inexpensive to create. Specifically, the funds will be used as follows:

    • About 1/3 of this goal will go towards the printing costs of the mugs, t-shirts, device covers, posters, paperback book, personalised versions of the book; PLUS shipping to all corners of the world.

    • About 1/3 of this goal will go to the illustrator. Even though this project is a labour of love, Jules firmly believes in compensating people for their work, at a fair price. Even at 1/3 of the funding total, that still does not cover the cost of illustrating 42 8.5x8.5 full-colour pages; PLUS 90 pieces of personalised art, ranging in sizes from 8.5x11, 12x12 (personalised copies of the book, with the contributor's name and likeness used for the hero) and 24x24 personalised cover poster. If we raise the full amount, that works out to approximately $29 for each piece of art. Really, that isn't a lot of money. Especially if you take into account little extras he is doing, such as making the art in a format usable for swag, and logo designs.

    • The other 1/3 will be going towards a lot of miscellaneous expenses: such as IndieGoGo and PayPal fees (that comes out to approximately $1,150, more if the project is not fully-funded); giving Errol and Chris something for their time and energy for writing, mixing and mastering two songs; PLUS singing, mixing and mastering the Five Little Zombies And Fred song an additional 30 times for the personalised versions; PLUS, hopefully, having someone professionally layout the book and get it ready for print and eFormat; PLUS a little bit for Jules' writing, and time and money it costs to create the Five Little Zombies And Fred website; PLUS a few other things she is creating, like an online store and more.
    • The more we raise, the better those behind the project will be adequately compensated for their time and work. And if the goal is doubled, then we will be able to pay someone to develop an interactive app, both for Android and iOS.
  • Deciding to fund this project will not only help Jules, Matt, Errol, Andrew and Chris make their dream project and labour of love a reality, but you will receive some pretty nifty perks. Originally, they had decided on 17 perks. However, IndieGogo only allows for 12 perks, so they had to consolidate some of them. The wonderful thing about IndieGoGo is that you are not bound by the perk amounts. You can contribute as little as $1 or as much as you want; PLUS add an amount on top of an existing perk. Once you click on the “Contribute Now” button, or “Claim This Perk” buttons, the instructions on how to contribute, including contributing amounts above the listed perk price, should be pretty self-explanatory. Not only will we love you forever, in a non-creepy non-romantic sort of way, your name will be included in the book's acknowledgement. The Short Summary
Five Little Zombies And Fred is a not-for-children children's book, written and illustrated to speak to the child in every one. It tells the story of our hero Fred who finds himself in the middle of the zombie apocalypse. Will he survive with the help of his friend the Mountie? It is written by Jules Sherred and illustrated by Matt Schubbe, with songs written and performed by Errol Elumir and mixed/mastered by Chris Cogott, and video by Andrew Edgar. Each person working on this project is completely in-love with the book. They are hoping to make the world fall in-love with it, too. If they can make the world fall in-love with the book, then they can turn it into a physical thing, with 42 8.5x8.5 beautifully illustrated full-colour pages, for the world to share. The final page count will be 52 pages. PLUS, a whole bunch of nifty extras and swag. More details are found below. We know the details below are OMG SO LONG and you'll be inclined to TL;DR them, but we have some REALLY AWESOMETASTIC perks planned, and they require a lot of space in order to be properly described.
The Longer Summary
The team behind Five Little Zombies And Fred consists of five people:

Jules Sherred is the parent of two teenage young men, and does way more than should be legal. Most notably, she is the General Manager and Programming Director of The Look 24/7, host of the Geeky Pleasures Radio Show and the offshoot website, Geeky Pleasures, and core contributor to Wired’s GeekMom. She’s already written two non-fiction books — From The Mundane To The Insane: A Wonderful Journey Without A Destination and Tales Of A Lupus Butterfly — the partial proceeds of which go to lupus research and treatment, is working on another book called Nerd Love, and is beyond excited to make Five Little Zombies And Fred a real thing for people to hold, read, and love. You can follow her on Twitter @GeekyJules. Also, SHE LOVES STAR TREK.
Matt Schubbe is a Minneapolis MN based freelance illustrator, designer, snappy dresser and man-about-town. He loves (LOVES) gaming of the tabletop and video varieties, playing the piano and Dr. Who. Now you know why he jumped at the chance to work on this project. You can follow him on Twitter @Sh00bs.
Errol Elumir is one half of the geeky, musical, comedy duo Debs & Errol. He is loud. He also creates podcasts, videos, a daily webcomic, and all manner of things that are geeky. His wife is the most patient person on the planet. You can follow him on Twitter @Elumir.
Andrew Edgar is Jules' partner in life. He doesn't like to be in the spotlight, but he enjoys supporting whatever project Jules is working on. He also loves to mess around in Adobe Premiere Pro. To that end, he has created videos for this project. You can follow him on Twitter @WileE577. 
Chris Cogott is a New Jersey based musician, singer, and songwriter. He plays and breaks guitars on a regular basis. When he turns on the recording equipment, he writes, mixes, and masters his own music and enjoys doing this for others as well. When not writing songs, he sits and watches his garden grow. You can check out his website and hear his music onBandcamp. You can also follow him on Twitter @chriscogott.


Have you ever had an idea that got you so excited, you wanted to grab every one you could, shake them, and exclaim, “I WANT YOU TO HAVE THIS! I WANT YOU TO BE A PART OF IT! I AM SO IN-LOVE WITH THIS RIDICULOUS, YET AWESOME, IDEA!” That is pretty much was happened one afternoon when, suddenly, Jules poured out the text for this book. Immediately, her mind was filled with images and she knew exactly how she wanted this story to look and feel.
Jules told Andrew about the idea, and read the book to him as she would read it to others. Immediately, Andrew fell in-love with the idea. Also, the story and image descriptions caused him to giggle like a little child.
Jules contacted an illustrator whom she admires greatly -- Matt Schubbe -- and shared with him this idea. Immediately, he, too, fell in-love with the book and wanted to be a part of it. He also shared the same vision for the project.
Jules' pal Errol saw her tweet about the project when it was referred to as [REDACTED], and wanted more information. She e-mailed him, and he, too, immediately fell in-love with it and asked if she needed any songs for the book, because he so wanted to have a part in this project filled with worlds of awesome.
Errol needed help mixing and mastering the songs. So, Jules called on her pal Chris Cogott to see if he was willing to lend his talents to this project. Immediately, he, too, wanted to be a part of it and help out any way he could.
Jules decided to test the waters and find out what others thought about the idea. Every one she told about it immediately fell in-love with it. Now the entire team is hoping the rest of the world falls in-love with Five Little Zombies And Fred, a not-for-children children's book that spoofs the Ten Little Monkeys Jumping On A Bed nursery rhyme. Not only is this book a quirky little story, it is a piece of exquisite and beautiful art, each page fully illustrated, in full-colour, crammed with wonderful Easter eggs and inside jokes, speaking directly to every geek. PLUS, ZOMBIES! Who doesn't like adorable, little, flesh-eating creatures? And we cannot forget the Mountie! And, of course, our hero Fred! Does he make it through the story alive? To find out, this project needs funding.
If this project is successfully funded, most importantly, Five Little Zombies And Fred will be available for the entire world to read and share. It will be made available in both electronic and paperback format. It will also be made available for global distribution: such online and offline retailers and distributors such as Ingram and NACSCORP; the book will be made available through Baker & Taylor to libraries and academic institutions; Amazon, and more. The songs will also be made available for the general public to purchase. We will also figure out a cost-effective way to make the posters, mugs, t-shirts and messenger bags available for all to purchase. Depending on how much we raise, we will also create other Five Little Zombies And Fred swag, such as stickers, magnets, hats, etc. If we double our funding goal, then we will find a developer to turn the book into an interactive book app, for both Android and iOS. We want to make Five Little Zombies And Fred accessible to all, with a variety of ways to enjoy the story.


What We Need & What You Get
Aside from the below perks, we have other bonuses prepared. Each time we reach a 12.5% funding mark, you will see a new video, showing you 6 completed pages of the book. Upon successful funding, we will also show you the original sketches created during the idea phase, including the original rough sketches of the first two drafts, and reveal both songs. We will also show you other phases of the work-in-progress. For every extra $1000 dollars funded, one lucky contributor, to be chosen at random, will receive a bonus perk: The Travelling Zombie. If we double our funding goal, we will seek out a developer to turn the book into an interactive app for both Android and iOS.
So what are you funding and what you will receive:


We need to raise $11, 500. This may seem like a large amount of money for a book, but the project included a lot of art and swag, and those things are not inexpensive to create. Specifically, the funds will be used as follows:


About 1/3 of this goal will go towards the printing costs of the mugs, t-shirts, device covers, posters, paperback book, personalised versions of the book; PLUS shipping to all corners of the world.


About 1/3 of this goal will go to the illustrator. Even though this project is a labour of love, Jules firmly believes in compensating people for their work, at a fair price. Even at 1/3 of the funding total, that still does not cover the cost of illustrating 42 8.5x8.5 full-colour pages; PLUS 90 pieces of personalised art, ranging in sizes from 8.5x11, 12x12 (personalised copies of the book, with the contributor's name and likeness used for the hero) and 24x24 personalised cover poster. If we raise the full amount, that works out to approximately $29 for each piece of art. Really, that isn't a lot of money. Especially if you take into account little extras he is doing, such as making the art in a format usable for swag, and logo designs.







The other 1/3 will be going towards a lot of miscellaneous expenses: such as IndieGoGo and PayPal fees (that comes out to approximately $1,150, more if the project is not fully-funded); giving Errol and Chris something for their time and energy for writing, mixing and mastering two songs; PLUS singing, mixing and mastering the Five Little Zombies And Fred song an additional 30 times for the personalised versions; PLUS, hopefully, having someone professionally layout the book and get it ready for print and eFormat; PLUS a little bit for Jules' writing, and time and money it costs to create the Five Little Zombies And Fred website; PLUS a few other things she is creating, like an online store and more.




The more we raise, the better those behind the project will be adequately compensated for their time and work. And if the goal is doubled, then we will be able to pay someone to develop an interactive app, both for Android and iOS.


Deciding to fund this project will not only help Jules, Matt, Errol, Andrew and Chris make their dream project and labour of love a reality, but you will receive some pretty nifty perks. story:
Why Write This Book?
Have you ever been told that you needed to 'read the Bible' for moral and spiritual guidance? Odds are the person who told you this never read it themselves. In 2007, USA Today reported over 60% of Americans couldn't name more than 5 of the 10 Commandments, while nearly half of students thought Sodom and Gomorrah were a married couple. Clearly, it isn't familiarity with the Bible that makes a person religious. Could it possibly have the opposite effect?

Remember, this book has a talking donkey in it.

I think reading the Bible is the most effective way to lose your faith. There is a snag, however. The Bible is not an enjoyable read. It's a stuffy, boring, and confusing mess, which explains why so few people read it. My aim is to change that. I want to make the Bible more accessible for people. I want it to be a funny, sarcastic, and honest look at the stories and claims of this book, without any punches being pulled. It's my belief readers will come to see the Bible for what it really is: a collection of ancient stories, and nothing more.

Get Your Face In This Book!

The book will feature my illustrations throughout, which will be adaptations of famous works of art, such as Govert Flinck's "Blessing of Jacob" (below). Patrons willing to donate for our deluxe package will be immortalized by having their faces illustrated right in the drawings! Imagine reading a book with your own likeness in it. It's about as cool as that sounds.


What Will The Book Be Like?

I've been working on and off on this project for a few years, and I've been producing more and more content based on some of my preliminary first drafts of the book. The video below is an excerpt from one of the most popular episodes of the TGA podcast, entitled Bible Stories: Moses. The full episode can be listened to here.


Naturally, the book will have a slightly different tone, but irreverence is the key feature which won't be changed. As I continue writing the book throughout the year, I will be featuring more episodes of Bible Stories on the podcast, allowing a constant update on the project and any bonus material I plan on releasing in the future.

What Made You Want To Write This?

From the very beginning of the TGA podcast, I've always wanted my first book to be self-published. I've spent years building a fan-base for my podcast with the anticipation of eventually publishing a book. It wasn't until the last few years that it became clear what that book should be. While experimenting with different show formats, I introduced Bible Stories, a funny and sarcastic re-telling of the Bible. The response was huge. People wanted more.

Over the following months I continued to produce shows, and their popularity finally convinced me people could get excited about a book version. So I began working on the book version. So far, I'm 30% of the way through the first draft, and many of the stories are available in the podcast for free.

If We Get More Than We Asked For...

If the pre-sales go well, I want to re-design the website to allow patrons to more easily access the content. If the book does exceptionally well, I would like to pay a professional animator to make an animated version of Bible Stories featuring some more of my 'cartoon' style. This would help reach a much larger audience, and has the potential to really go viral.

Final Thoughts

None of this would be possible if it wasn't for all the support of my fans. This book is for you guys.
